Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research prior to purchasing the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablet.I had read the hundreds of reviews on the product,as well as many professional reviews from sites such as CNET  and PC World to name a few.Two day ago,I received my Kindle Fire tablet from Amazon.All that I can say is that it has not disappointed. It really is just an incredible tablet.The screen and picture quality are really nothing short of stunning.Bright,crisp,rich colors with an amazing resolution.The sound is first rate too.After setting up my wireless router,I was enjoying my Kindle Fire and all of it's wonderful features.Viewing movies is a great experience.Surfing the web is also excellent.Lightening fast browsing.The tablet itself is very thin and has a "well made" feel to it.The battery is very long lasting from my experience.I honestly wish that I could have given this product 10 stars.The size is perfect.A 7" tablet is too small to fully enjoy,while a 10" tablet is too large for true portability.The 8.9" is perfection.As for choosing the Kindle Fire over other brands of tablets,to me the choice was easy.An iPad tablet can not match the viewing experience for watching movies.The Kindle Fire leaves the iPad in the dust.Widescreen movies are viewed on the Kindle Fire in true 16:9 ratio,where as they are displayed on the iPad in 4:3 ratio with black bars on the bottom and top greatly diminishing the viewing experience.Not to mention the dual Dolby speakers on the Kindle Fire blows the iPad single speaker away.Simply put,the iPad costs double what the Kindle Fire does and has an inferior 4:3 display for widescreen movies and far inferior sound.The Kindle Fire's "brightness" level is beyond belief.It rates "higher" on tests than virtually any other tablet on the market.This is a very important quality in a tablet,although seldom gets mentioned in reviews.Amazon has a true winner with the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablet.I honestly can not understand why some would rate this tablet with a poor review.In my opinion,it has to be one of four things. 1).Their wireless connection is less than stellar (you can't blame the tablet for this).2).They are die hard Apple fans who paid double for their iPads and refuse to admit that a tablet actually exists that is as good (or) better at half the cost.3).They failed to read the product details such as not including the wall charger.4).Some people will simply not be happy with any product.In conclusion,I feel that my purchase was one of the wisest decisions I have ever made.For those looking for an incredible tablet that is about as close to perfection as can be on this earth,look no further than the Kindle Fire HD 8.9".You will love it.

Reviews.Title: ScreenDim saved the kindle fire HD
Reviews.Author: Manoranjan
Reviews.Content: I have owned the second generation kindle and this is my first kindle fire. I have been using this for close to 3 months now and my review is below:Size (4 stars):* The size is good for me to read books and watch videos.* Since I read more books than watch videos I might have preferred the apples iPad dimensions probably better (little more wider). However it is also much costlier than the fire.Screen (3 stars):* Screen is very good and crisp.* Sometimes I feel I pressed a link but it will actually press the one below - so not very accurate to touch. This is sometimes annoying.* It is really bright to read at night when the lights are turned off - even when the brightness settings is set to the lowest. This was the biggest deal breaker for me. However the screen dim app saved the kindle and I did not send it back. That is the best app for the kindle for my usage.Power button (3 stars):* The power button is placed in the top of the kindle almost very hard to find without looking at it.Software (1 star):* The software is just horrible. They have heavily customized android as many know. It has crashed on me close to 10 times in the last 3 months. The whole device will suddenly become unresponsive and it will automatically restart after 2 to 3 minutes.* I was looking forward to use the silk browser after I saw the amazon demo. It was easily the worst browser so far. It crashes almost all the time. I am now using the dolphin browser which is decent.* Many people complain about the carousel (homepage) but I think I got used to it now.* Accessing amazon's content is awesome - they have done that very well. It is easy to access videos, books, etc. I believe this was the primary purpose for the kindle when amazon built it probably. This is excellent.* Email app - It is not good and I dont use it. The push notifications of gmail did not work for me but I did not care to check it since my phone has a much better app than fighting with this.Apps (3 stars):* Apps are very limited to the kindle as many know. I knew this before I bought it so this is ok.* I installed the 1mobile app and that gave me access to almost all the android apps. Many dont work as expected like chrome browser, firefox, etc. However dolphin browser, dropbox and some other apps works. I had to get the apk file of 1mobile and install it - I think they call this process sideloading.Will I recommend it or buy it again:It will be a NO. The software provided is so limited to use for anything else apart from browsing amazon content that paying $249 (I got this in a deal) seems high. If I had known these issues before I would have probably went for the iPad mini or a prev generation iPad by paying a little extra. If the only reason you buy is to access amazon content (which I think many wont) this will be an excellent choice. If not, it is better to shell out the little extra to get the iOS tables or android tablets.

Reviews.Title: Overcontrolled
Reviews.Author: S. McNulty
Reviews.Content: I've owned a 32 GB 8.9 inch kindle for the last 2 months, and I've explored usage heavily, having used just about anything in my power to expand on the device. It works fairly well, and I've never really had any issues with the quality of the picture and sound. The primary weakness of the kindle is it's horrible creator's app store. In their attempt to force you to use their various cloud services, they heavily limit what you can do on the device.To get around that, I rooted the thing in the first week I had it, allowing me to finally use the play store, which voids the warranty, which I could live with. I uninstalled a few system apps, installed at least 30 apps from the play store, and then a few dozen from the internet itself. After that, I loved this thing, it ran perfectly, I had a really nice collection of apps and I could watch videos and TV and read ebooks from anywhere, not just amazon.About 2 or 3 days ago, Amazon SCREWED everyone who had their device rooted and installed an OTA update (Which I thought I had disabled with a play store app, kindlefree). They completely upgraded OS, deleted my root backups, re-installed every system app and un-installed all my system apps like play store and supersu. Now around ~20% of my apps don't work, soon to be more most likely if I don't fix it. Needless to say I was angry and called Amazon, they basically told me it sucks but there's nothing they can do.They pretty much ruined the $300 device for me, and apparently this update patched the method of rooting I had used.So let me summarize-Picture is great-Audio is great-Interface is okay-App selection is awful-Customer support is fairly useless regarding kindles

Reviews.Title: Initial Review
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've had my new 8.9" Kindle Fire HD for a couple weeks now and I feel I can make at least some intial comments on the new device. The new, larger version of the device is I think better for watching videos or surfing the net, although people who mainly use it as a book reader may prefer the smaller, lighter 7" version. The new display is very bright and clear and the new speakers sound great when watching a video.Overall, this second generation device seems to address all the critisisms I had of my Kindle Fire 7", LCD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB - Includes Special Offers.  The touch screen is much more accurate and responsive than the original one, the updated Silk web browser is faster and displays non-mobile formated pages much better, and the autocorrection when typing works much better than before.  Even the minor problem of the original, bottom mounted power button has been resolved and it was moved to the top, along with a "hard" volume control that maks listening to music or videos much easier.Honestly, at this point I have no real complaints about the device.  The device integrates smoothly and seamlessly with Amazon content (books, movies and music) which is my main use.  Even the much maligned "ads" are not at all intrusive and I decided they are not even worth the $15 charge to opt out.  I suppose if I had to point out something, its that the micro-USB port is very easy to confuse with the micro-HMDI port right next to it as there are no markings on the case to identify them.

Reviews.Title: What they DIDN'T TELL YOU
Reviews.Author: Jamie G. Ashley
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Kindle Fire HD 4G LTE Wireless and was looking forward to using it!  I received it and was having GREAT FUN. I soon discovered a really BIG PROBLEM-when I attempted to set up the 4G provided in the special deal by Amazon through ATT I kept receiving an error message saying the account couldn't be set up. After spending time with Amazon Tech support and ATT I discovered that if your credit card address is a PO Box ATT WILL NOT allow you to have an account. I have been an ATT landline customer for over 20 years and they send my bill to a PO Box, but they will not for this. I am walking out the door to return the KINDLE now and heading to get an I PAD. Amazon and ATT failed to disclose this detail. Rotten trick.

Reviews.Title: Old Age - Review with Old Eyes
Reviews.Author: The Old One
Reviews.Content: This is my third Kindle...........love them!  Seems each successive model has a few things I don't like along with stuff I do like.  Wish this model had an easier on/off switch.  On my Kindle Fire I can just feel and slide it on/off.  This one I have trouble trying to locate it.  Would be nice if somehow it could becolored to help locate it.  I also think the 'super charger' should be shipped with the unit and not sold as an 'add on'.  The graphics are displayed beautifully!  Love reading after I go to bed, so convenient.....no light to turn on or off, just fire up the Kindle.  I would be lost without my Kindles now.  They caught my eye when the first one hit the market, thought it would be so wonderful for anyone traveling to be able to carry books so conveniently.  Never thought as an old retired lady I would want one.......BOY, WAS I WRONG!!  I would also like to add that I have found Amazon's Customer Service to be such a pleasure in today's world.  They listened, acted promptly without customer hassle got the job done.That's another star.........guess I should have made it 5!

Reviews.Title: Good Fun. Nice Device. Just don't expect an iPad for this little money
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: I've had this device for a little over a month now so I think I can be pretty fair/objective about it. I was toying with the idea of a tablet for awhile and did a lot of side-by-side comparisons by playing with them in stores. I liked the idea of a tablet mainly for media consumption reasons. I like ebooks (I also have an older eReader), I stream lots of movies and content from Netflix/Hulu+ and have an audible membership. Games are funner to play on bigger screens too. For these needs, the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" is perfect. It has a nice screen resolution, the sound quality is excellent and gets really loud when you need it to. The dual band means that it is kicking my laptop's butt in streaming quality, especially in my bedroom where the wifi in our house drops out a bit. My laptop is usually hiccuping in there, while my kindle runs smoothly. And you know what, the price is right too! I am also an amazon prime member so being able to check out kindle books and have access to other free content is nice. The Prime Video content isn't that different from what Netflix has but it's still a nice bonus. Screen is a perfect size too. It's big enough so that it doesn't have that "I'm reading on a giant cell phone" feeling that you get from 7" tablets. And pretty much the perfect device to sync all of my other amazon content to- for instance, I already used my cloud drive extensively for documents, buy mainly amazon music, and am an audible member. On my iPhone, I can stream my amazon content, but not purchase any additional content, and even if you download it from your cloud drive, on an apple device, you can't access it through anything but the app that downloaded it. I always thought that was lame and was one of the reason I didn't want an iPad.Cons to the device: The camera is a bit lacking (reminds me of the camera on my first cameraphone) but still functional. App library is not nearly as extensive as the android or apple app store. (some work arounds available for android apps though0- think getjar). Lack of expandable media really bugs me. I mean, even apple, who is notorious about locking people out of their devices, offers a camera (SD) card reader as an accessory. I have yet to see that for kindle, which is disappointing because otherwise this would be in my camera bag all the time. I will just have to try to find a solution that works with the micro usb port. So no, this is not an iPad 4, but then again, it costs about $200 less so I think these are fair trades. Most of us use tablets as streaming media devices and in that function, the Kindle Fire HD excels.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Brian Futrelle
Reviews.Content: I was a current owner of an IPAD 2 that I spent 700 dollars on when it first came out.  I really wasn't looking into getting a new tablet, but I dropped my IPAD and the corner class was cracked.  It did not interfer with the screen at all, and it still worked just fine, but it did bug me a bit.  When my co-worker purchased his Kindle Fire HD 8.9, we did a basic side by side compare, and the Kindle just blew the IPAD 2 out of the water in picture quality.  We played the same movie side by side, and it was a pronounced difference.The biggest difference to me is the download speed, which a lot of people might dismiss.  I did a unscientific test and downloaded the same episode of big bang theroy on my ipad and then seperatly on my kindle.  Standing in the same spot right beside my router.  The kindle downloaded the episode in just over 5 minutes, then IPAD 2 took 21 minutes.  I was blown away.  While I don't expect these types of results typically, the kindle HD is consistently faster no matter what network I am on.  To me that made the kindle worth the upgrade right there.  Throw in Amazon prime and getting a free book every month, full color magazines, and having all my content stored on amazon.  The kindle fire is one of the best purchases i've made in a long time.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely love my new Kindle HD!
Reviews.Author: M. Kelly "Life is a Cabernet"
Reviews.Content: I was currently an Ipad 4 user, having owned an Ipad 3 previously as well. I thought I was sold on Apple until till I purchased my nephew a 7" Kindle Fire HD for Christmas. When he opened the box and began to use it, I was mesmorized with the quality of the picture and the amazing sound. Being that I have been a Prime member for years, I began to consider purchasing one for myself so I could benefit from the free Kindle book loans and streaming videos. I purchased this 4G LTE 8.9" version on the Kindle Fire HD and after having used it for several days now non-stop, I assure you that the Ipad is going into the closet (or will be made a gift to one of my neices shortly). I could not resist the $49.99 package for 250 mb a month for 12 months along with the $50 credit Amazon was doing as a promotion. Surfing the web is easy, speed is amazing, I am just so happy with my purchase. You honestly can't get a better deal out there. I love the Fire HD!

Reviews.Title: What they don't tell you...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Rather then restate all the positive comments that everyone else has mentioned about the Fire HD, I'd like to make potential buyers aware of a couple things that aren't obvious.Android devices (the Fire is one) do not support Adobe flash. This is annoying to say the least. I never realized how much stuff uses flash until I didn't have it. This often results in YouTube videos not functioning. There is allegedly a work-around involving using the Dolphin browser instead of Silk, but I'm not savvy enough to get it to function. If you're a techno-peasant like me, you'll have to learn to live with spotty YouTube application or get someone to configure it for you.Reading books on the Fire is far better than I expected it to be. Which leads me to a related issue. The Amazon prime membership has many great perks, but the "kindle owners lending library" is not one of them. Meaning, the selection of free monthly books is horrible. With the exception of the three Hunger Games series books and some classics, it's a bunch of trash no one has ever heard of, much of it bordering on porn. Forget "borrowing" a free book that's a best seller, not going to happen. Expect to pay $10-$13 for most anything you'd find at a bookstore.On a brighter note, the Prime live movie streaming is flawless! With the purchase of a $6 micro-usb cable you can connect your Fire HD to your HDTV and watch crystal clear, no stuttering, HD movies. The selection of free stuff is not super current/just released, but still very good.My point is, don't get lost in the advertising hype. No tablet does everything. Read between the lines and do your homework and you won't be surprised or disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Inferior--Not good for books if that is why you use this Kindle
Reviews.Author: Baty Reasoner
Reviews.Content: In the beginning I was extremely disappointed with the lack of book organization, but I could read a book. Presumably now I may have too many books on the device, but it does not let me remove books like it did when I first got the Kindle.  When the books happen to apppear ( which the books often don't show), they will do nothing.  You can't read a book or remove it.  This purchase was such a waste of money.  I would like an organized, electronic library device that works on demand, without major troubleshooting.  This Kindle certainly is not useful to me for an electronic library.Very, very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Family perfection
Reviews.Author: Huckleberry
Reviews.Content: We have (too many) kids, and the youngest are not quite ready for unfiltered internet access or admin-level privileges on any device, so the deciding factor in our purchase was the Free Time.  We're a pretty digital group, with many PCs, an assortment of laptops, this Kindle, iMacs, several iPod iterations, a smaller Android tablet and a Transformer, and a very wide, full assortment of smart phones (S3, G2x etc.), so a weakling is quickly routed out and abandoned.  And yes - they are all capable of playing nicely with each other on our network (no easy feat).The Kindle is simply perfect for what it is, and performs at least as well as we had hoped.  The display is rich and compelling and the ergonomics are good.  The Amazon flavored Android is glitch free, and while some settings are veiled, with some time they can be found and optimized.  For Amazon content, it is very nearly perfect; the delivery speed is excellent and the chance of a kid or uninformed adult accidentally screwing things up is minimal.  The Free Time is what sets it apart, and in a VERY good way.  Our teenagers have Android tablets also, but the younger kids would have no idea how to manipulate settings or install anything if it involved anything more than a click, so we got this purposely for a 7 (8 in days) and a 9 y/o to be able to read books, watch appropriate videos, play some learning type games and, in a perfect world, learn something while having fun.  They continually bicker over my wife's iMac and tie up the main TV on Netflix, so we wanted to get them their own devices, namely this and a Win8 laptop.  In retrospect, the jump to W8 at the same time as adopting a distinctly flavored Android variant was a little taxing, but we're working through it.  The trades between the new laptop and the Kindle are carefully negotiated affairs, and the only user complaint is the time it takes to recharge when the battery dies (and it IS used until the battery dies every single time).The one disappointment (beside the missing SD slot we knew about beforehand) is the difficulty of accessing the PlayStore on the Kindle.  It was fairly easy to get the Amazon content onto the Asus tablets, but another thing entirely going the other way.  This brings to light the main difference between the Kindle and any other tablet; while the Android units are more or less designed to be easy to change, root, mod, and restore if it goes south, the Kindle is not.  Being under warranty has prevented  any attempt to root it, and they've done an admirable job of making the garden walls high and sturdy. I'm sure that at some point a non invasive method of getting PlayStore apps to run will be figured out, but for now (given the ages of the main users), Amazon has everything we need on this device, and with Free Time, there is very little chance they'll access inappropriate content or brick the unit itself.  We also have iProducts galore, so the notion of controlled access and throttled content is not new to us, but at the same time, there ARE some things on PlayStore that have no equivalent on Amazon, and it would be nice to be able to access them on the Kindle too.The sound is MUCH better quality than any other tablet (and 99% of the laptops), but due to the sheer number of devices in use at any given time, headphones are the norm here.The bottom line is that the display is absolutely gorgeous, the download speeds are excellent, the content is great (and growing), and the technical skills needed to use it are nil.  For tech averted adults or growing kids, this is the ideal tablet.  It never hangs, crashes or misbehaves like it's speedier, more adaptable but less stable counterparts, and Free Time alone should warrant a very close look if you have younger kids (or a technophobe) in the house.

Reviews.Title: 20 3/4 stars!
Reviews.Author: Shanks
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife... Wish I hadn't. Now she's been sucked into the world of Kindle. The house will never be the same again.

Reviews.Title: Ooooh Boy!!!!
Reviews.Author: Mike in Illinois
Reviews.Content: I LOVE MY KINDLE!!!  I have an original Kindle Fire as well, and I use them both every chance I get.When I was first introduced to the "Amazon Experience" with the original Kindle Fire I was impressed. And after viewing the Hi-Def  display of the Kindle Fire 8.9" I am amazed. It has gorgeous bold colors, a crystal clear picture, and GREAT Dolby sound! What's not to love? Oh, and if you love to read, you can easily personalize the page color and font size so it looks the way you like it, making reading anywhere a joy.... If you want the best in content and really solid hardware, you can't go wrong here! Find a friend who has one and take it for a spin, you'll see!  I have other tablets, both Android and Apple, they are great as well, but the "Amazon Experience", in my opinion, is best enjoyed on a Kindle Fire... I LOVE MY KINDLE!!!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful design!
Reviews.Author: Sally Balmer
Reviews.Content: This tablet is sleek and feels nice in your hands. The back has enough tack to keep it secure on your lap. The gorilla glass should stand up to any punishment. The HD display is crisp, colorful and it's connected to Amazon. What more do you need?

Reviews.Title: Beautiful tablet but disappointed
Reviews.Author: Angie
Reviews.Content: What I do Love:The size is perfect! Feels great in your hands. Not super heavy. So you can comfortably read without your arms hurting from holding it.  I do love the picture, It's beautiful. I like the speakers, and the case I bought to go with it fit perfect, looked good and functioned great. The carousel was a nice feature to me. I'm a prime member and I buy a lot of stuff from Amazon. I already have two of the Kindle readers and love them!. I really wanted to love this tablet but I just really don't . I hope the bugs get worked out and I will buy again. :( I was so looking forward to this.I don't like:The Silk browser doesn't give a very good user experience. It crashes often. i was  being asked many times to restore tabs. There were times that the whole tablet was unresponsive while using Silk, and it reboots after 2 or 3 minutes of being frozen.  Silk slows down a lot and begins to shutdown your previously opened webpages. When you return to them it reloads everything again so you lose information you've already typed in. For example: filling out forms or cc info. The Facebook app stinks. You can only see a few posts and the rest is blued out. You can access just fine by the browser but that brings you back to the browser problems.  Plus No Instagram.... BOO

Reviews.Title: Kindle Loving Momma
Reviews.Author: C. Sanabria Damron "smart shopping momma"
Reviews.Content: Love this! Have had my new Kindle since Christmas. Still love my Fire but this one is amazing.  The sound quality is great, images are amazing. I have watched movies, played games and read books to name a few things. I also ordered the Bluetooth wireless keyboard and quite frankly I enjoy this more than my Laptop. Am still trying to set up my printer to this, probably just operator error lol No question this is amazing and I know a few people that are envious of the quality for the price and they spent lots more for an IPAD... so sad.

Reviews.Title: Had to side load flash player but once that was done just as Satisfied as my first fire purchase was.
Reviews.Author: todd kross
Reviews.Content: After having the First generation Kindle fire that came out in 2011 and loving it for all of 2012 I decided I wanted the 8.9 kindle. The 7 inch was perfect for reading but a little small for surfing the internet. A ten inch tablet would have been to big for reading comfortably in bed but great for the internet. Amazon introduced the 8.9 inch which is perfect for reading and perfect for the internet.The only issue I had was it would not open my email due to the lack of flash player. So I had to sideload flash with the dolphin broswer. This is very simple to do and YOU DO NOT HAVE TO ROOT OR JAIL BREAK THIS TO DO THIS. So you still keep the manufactures warranty. You just have to check the box under your settings to allow 3rd party applications. Then download dolphin and flash, or safari and flash or whatever android browser you like to use as the flash will not work with the silk browser. The kindle still updates with all of amazons new updates. Picture quality is amazing, touch screen is ultra responsive, browser is very fast, and sound is clear and loud. The weight of this kindle is the same as my older first generation kindle fire, that my 2 year old now inherited.I also purchased a blue tooth keyboard and a stylus for this one so I use it like a netbook. I purchased the ad version that displays an ad everytime you take it out of sleep mode. At any time if you don't want the ads you can sign into your account and pay to have the ads removed. They don't bother me so I left the ad's on. Thank You again Amazon for another amazing kindle. My only hopes for the future of this kindle is that an update for flash will come out and I will be able to once again check my email from the silk browser instead of the dolphin browswer.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant!
Reviews.Author: Big_Mike
Reviews.Content: Did side-by-side comparisons versus the iPad mini and Nexus 10 before deciding on the Kindle Fire HD 8.9". Great value for the money!I bought one for myself and one for my 26 year old daughter and we're both very pleased. We decided we didn't need a full featured tablet, since we already have powerful ultra-light notebooks and top-of-the-line smartphones, so this fit nicely into our needs. Great as an eBook reader, with very good media options for listening, watching, and generic internet access (including emails).The initial set-up of the Kindle HD Fire was fast, easy, and intuitive. My daughter & I both downloaded books from Amazon's library and were impressed at the ease & speed. I downloaded a 6 novel set of Tom Clancy books (7-12) in a matter of seconds. We also "upgraded" the Kindle to 32GB, paid $15 more for the "without special offers" option, and glad we did.The only (minor) complaint I have is the PowerFast charger is extra and not included in box, Fortunately I already knew this, with some advanced research, and we made sure to buy the charger (at a discounted price) with when buying the Kindle Fire HD 8.9". Being able to charge the Kindle using a USB port on another pc is ok, but being able to charge it with a standard electrical outlet makes better sense.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift
Reviews.Author: Rhino
Reviews.Content: I bought my wife Kindle Fire HD for her BD and after she started using it, I fell in love with hers.  I couldn't get her to trade my Nook Tablet for hers!! (I thought it was a good idea, she didn't think much of it) Then for Christmas she gave me a box and inside was my own Kindle Fire HD.  WOW, was I happy and surprised.  I am really enjoying it. Great for movies. I like the idea it has a bigger screen as at 76 I do have some seeing problems and I can make the print even larger.  I am even more pleased now that I have my own.

Reviews.Title: Real Nice Tablet
Reviews.Author: Thomas E. Bennett
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Fire HD 8.9 with 32 gb of memory, without the ads and with the plug in charger and I am pleased with my tablet. I might have given the tablet 5 stars if it were not for the ads and plugin charger. Note to Amazon: just increase the price up front and take care of these two complaints.My family has five Kindle products (Keyboard, Paperwhite, Fire, Fire HD 7" and, of course, the Fire HD 8.9") and we like all five especially the Fire HD's. On the 8.9" the extra screen size really makes watching movies more enjoyable and reading is better. I was really surprised by how much more I enjoyed reading because of the screen size (not to mention the HD resolution). It is just easier on the eyes. The new screen also has less reflection than the old Fire.The camera addition is a good one. We enjoy using Skype for family contact and find the camera resolution to be very good.The dolby sound on the 8.9" is great. You can enjoy movies, music or games without earbuds and/or sound boosters. The dynamics are super, too.As this tablet has the best processor of the Kindles it is more responsive even though I find surfing the web to be a bit sluggish at times. Still a nice improvement over lesser Kindle models as one would expect.This is a good size for a tablet for the things noted above, but I find it a bit large and heavy for reading in bed. You will agree if you doze off as I did and have it thunk you in the head. That is where the Paperwhite shines with its reduced weight and size.Overall, my impressions of the Fire HD 8.9" are very favorable and I recommend it if you are not tied to the Apple world. There are better tablets out there but I think you will pay more for them.

Reviews.Title: I'm impressed!
Reviews.Author: gadgetjunkie
Reviews.Content: I consider myself a techie and had no plans to buy the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" until I saw the one day sale, so I said what the heck.  I was actually planning to buy a Nexus 10 instead to replace my aging Asus Eee Pad Transformer tablet, but I'm so glad I decided to purchase the Kindle Fire HD because it saved me almost $200 over the comparable Nexus since I would have been charged for shipping and tax on the Nexus.Granted, I'm not happy with the lack of access to the Play Store since I can't access the apps I've already purchased, but I love being immersed in the Amazon environment and having access to my Amazon Prime movies and TV shows.  I've already downloaded Season 5 of Mad Men and it actually fit on my 16GB tablet.I also love the Amazon shopping experience on this tablet.  It's much cleaner than the standard Amazon shopping app.  And surprisingly enough, I love the overall interface - it's very easy to use and very intuitive.  The speaker volume is much louder than my other tablets too.I didn't think I'd like this tablet at all, but it is really good and it would have been a good value even if I'd paid full price.

Reviews.Title: Must be fantastic!
Reviews.Author: 2became1
Reviews.Content: Ummm...I can't rate this accurately because I can't get it away from my husband and kids. I can only assume it is fantastic. My husband loves all the free movies because we are PRIME members and my kids like all the games. Everyone loves the HD! It's great for in the car, while waiting for appointments, etc. I have to figure out how to use all the features and getting the Wi-Fi initiated through AT&T; though.

Reviews.Title: Welcome addition to the family
Reviews.Author: day7light
Reviews.Content: I have had 2 previous kindles this new one puts the others to shame.I love the larger buttons make it a plus  and the sound AMAZING even with headphones on it feels true to life

Reviews.Title: sweeeet!!
Reviews.Author: Christopher K. Brumbaugh
Reviews.Content: just upgraded from the original kindle fire.this thing is awesome with the high def and external speakers.better storage and faster downloads

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Deanne Adler
Reviews.Content: I turned in my apple i-pad for this item.  I do love it and I'm not sorry I made the exchange.  My only complaint is it doesn't have adobe flash so I can't get all of the games I like.  I use my i-phone for them.  The clarity and sound of the fire cannot be compared to any other tablet.  It is fabulous.  Reading books is a pleasure on this device.  Photo's are extremely sharp as are videos.  Magazines pop out at you.  The size of the screen is perfect.  Not to big and certainly not small.  I would recommend this item without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: PERFECTION!
Reviews.Author: SusieQ in Clive Iowa
Reviews.Content: The main reason we give the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 five stars is because they don't allow you to give it 6 stars.  We were hesitant to buy it wondering if we would really use it all that much.  Well, we use it all the time and love it.  It is easy to learn how to use and if you have any questions, they are promptly answered by the technical people.  It is exactly the same as the description says it is - no small print - no exaggerations on its quality in comparison to other brands.  It is a great product!

Reviews.Title: Superb product
Reviews.Author: Chad Simons
Reviews.Content: I loved the original Kindle I bought a year ago for my daughter.  I thought it was the best tablet ever, until the new one arrived.  The improvements are dramatic.  The best change is the sound.  The quality of the original was okay but not much volume. The new one is better quality and has great volume.  The display is fantastic, lots of memory, and somehow thinner then the original.  I don't know if it's my wireless router but the original had limited range and was sometimes slow online.  The new one has much better range and very fast.  I can't compare it to other tablets as the only two I've owned have been Kindle's, but I can't think anything else could be better.  It does everything I expected and better.

Reviews.Title: Kindle 8.9" HD 4G
Reviews.Author: Machikoneko
Reviews.Content: I have the first Kindle Fire, and it was very good, but it needed some improvement.  (But don't all 1st gens do?)I now have the newest kindle; I bought the Cadillac of the series, with all the bells and whistles, and as much storage capacity as it offered.First the Pros:1 The picture is beautiful; crystal clear resolution, and great color.2. The interface is a little different than the first Fire, but it was easy enough to learn.3. The picture size is a LOT better, both for watching movies, and for playing games like "Bad Piggies".4. Both the case and the unit are very sturdy- I've dropped it a couple of times, and no harm at all!5. The X-Ray option is great!  I don't have to worry about reaching for my iPhone to use Google to look up the Actor's bio. (Haven't used the text-to-speech yet, so I can't comment on this feature.)6. I like the fact that the display stays on, if you want it while the film plays.  (How long left to go in the film, battery life, 10 sec. "rewind" option.) I like to pause films all the time, and the fact it stays on makes it easier to do so.7. Being a Prime member, there's so much free content, it's fantastic!8. I love the fact that the Fire can be put to sleep by just closing the cover- very efficient.Now for the Cons:1. I realize that the speakers can't be large, but your ads are very misleading about their power.  This is one of the main reasons I bought the new Kindle Fire, because the first one was too hard to hear without headphones.  So much for the portable advantage.While the speakers are louder than the first one, they still have a LONG way to go to live up to your hype.  Even some of your own guides you offer say headphones are the best way to listen.2. Who was the design genius who decided to put the charger on the bottom?  When my Fire's getting low on power, I can't use the case to prop it up, because the charger is in the way! I have to lay it flat- once again, not the most watchable experience. The first version had it right- the charger was on the side; no need to change.3. I guess the same design genius decided we don't need a charging light that is visible, either.  I like to know when my machines are charging by having an indicator to look at.  (I can see if it's charging when I wake it up, but I still like an indicator when it's asleep, like the old one.)4. I have yet to successfully establish by connection with AT&T.;  When I put in my password, it tells me I need my last four digits of my SS number.  When I put in my SS number, I cannot add my password, when I do, the SS number disappears.5.There is an option to back up ten seconds in playback.  Couldn't there be an option to skip ahead about the same time period?Well, for what it's worth, that's my review of the Kindle Fire 8.9" HD.  Not perfect by any means, but still one heck of a lot of fun!  Amazon will always be one of my favorite places to shop!EDITED ON 12-14-12I found a good work-around for the problem of the charger being on the bottom.  I bought a cheap stand that is used for holding decorative plates.  The Kindle fits perfectly on the stand, with plenty of room for the charger to be plugged in.I've only used it in the horizontal position, though.  The vertical seems a bit too unstable for my liking.  Now, on to trying to boost the speakers...EDITED ON 4-23-14The only way I've found to improve the speakers was to add external portable speakers.  The ones I've found to be the best are ROKONO.  I'm sure others are as good, but, in my experience, these are very good, with long lasting battery life, and decent sound.  I usually use two, because I use the Kindle mainly in the kitchen, with the washer, dryer, and running water noise to overcome.Another problem- I'm a Prime member, and use the free streaming shows quite a bit.  I often get an "error code 13"- can't play the video at this time.  This is SO frustrating.  I know it's not my internet connection, because the same video will play with no problem on my Mac.But all-in-all, it's still not a bad unit.

Reviews.Title: best tablet for the price
Reviews.Author: robert orona
Reviews.Content: awesome speed, the graphics are great. The family uses it all the time. Sorry apple wont pay the extra 200 for the same technology!

Reviews.Title: For the Amazon aficionado ... perfect
Reviews.Author: robert johnston
Reviews.Content: There are plenty of tablets out there to choose from for your purposes. If Amazon is your major source for books, videos, movies etc. the 8.9" was engineered for you. The Amazon Prime inclusion provides pricing gimmicks that more than makes up for the state taxing issues.If you're an Amazonian, the Fire HD 8.9" is the right choice. The web surfing capabilities and apps are good enough for me. It's the so-far seamless linkage to Amazon that is the attraction here and at a price that's dang difficult to beat.

Reviews.Title: To Fire HD or not to Fire HD
Reviews.Author: jaldeuce
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying I am moderately tech savvy.  I could not blog for hours on nuances of android operating systems or systemic differences between Nexus 7 vs. Fire HD.  I am the average user that wants a tablet but hates to be tied to Apple and its runaway proprietary chain that comes with all of their products.  I had the original Kindle and the subsequent Fire and I liked both for what they were, simple...more so for Kindle, a little less so for the Fire.  The Fire was buggy.  I have found my Fire HD is also buggy.Problems:Web Browser: I received the notice that my web browser was not responding, this happened 7 times within a few minutes until I was forced to restart my browser.  It was a nuisance out of the gate when I am simply trying to read the news.Google:  It appears the only way I am able to voice/video chat is through Skype, which means I have to subscribe to another service and pay a fee for a number.  I know Skype is great and useable around the globe...so is Google+/video chat.  There is no Amazon App to use Google+/video chat.  Also the web browsing version is scaled down to the point where I cannot actually web chat through the browser.LTE:  My mistake but, I thought part of the increased payment for the HD W/4G LTE was the initial year of 4G service for $50.00; a great deal.  I did not know that I still had to pay the $50 after the fact.  Small sure, but all these small things begin to compound.Not problems:The screen is so much more vivid.  External controls are a major plus.  Sound is fantastic, and battery life is quite good.So if the above problems do not factor against you, I think you will be pretty happy with the Fire HD.  If you are like me and stopped using ITunes, have a Prime account, and order almost everything from Amazon, the HD is a great purchase. Unfortunately Fire HD is less functional than I need it to be.  Otherwise it is a great piece of gear and you should Fire HD!Some updates after further use:Problem:Power and Volume Buttons: Simply put they are too close, I shut off the screen a couple time while trying to adjust the volume.  Perhaps in the next iteration, these buttons are on either side of the tablet.Not Problems:Ads:  I have noticed the ads but not found them to be a major distraction to my use of the Fire HD.  I get the ad at start up and I believe I have seen the ad one other time but it was not a distraction from my overall Fire activities.Silk:  Since the initial bugginess, I have not experienced any further problems...I don't browse a lot with the Fire (thus far).  I am a creature of habit and go to the same sites or apps over and over again.Apps: yes, I do miss some of my Apple Apps, mostly I miss AutoBlog.  I am not a real car guy but that app excited me because it distills the important car info that has come out without having to trek through a dense website.  Other apps, I don't miss and most of the good ones I get: Stumble upon, Flipboard, Shazam, etc...Google integration:  I like the instantaneous integration on my Google calendar, address book, Gmail throughout my Samsung galaxy III Smartphone, Fire HD, and Apple Computer.  I still miss Google+ video chat on the Fire HD, I have to do that on my phone.WiFi Streaming: I watched a full HD movie last night via Prime, I have the lowest data speed via my internet provider...no buffering, no diminished picture; it was a fantastic experience.  The image quality of the screen and the movie was simply amazing.  The volume never distorted through the speakers during loud scenes or heavy bass.  Same goes with streaming music, never a problem, fantastic sound quality.HD Port:  I have yet to try this but, I like the idea that I can plug this into my HD TV and stream Prime, I will let you know how the picture quality translates.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Victoria I. Reeve
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and fun!This is my first Kindle so I'm still exploring.I would recommend this for a friend or loved one for Christmas!

Reviews.Title: Love the kindle fire hd 8.9
Reviews.Author: Susan Hildebrand
Reviews.Content: love the kindle fire hd.like the bigger size. It,s much like the IPAd but at a much better price. I wish the camera was a a flip camera so I could take easier pictures.

Reviews.Title: An Excellent Alternate to the Apple iPAD
Reviews.Author: Stephen Kovac Jr.
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9 tablet is an excellent inexpensive alternate to the Apple iPAD. I am very please with the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 tablet. I use it in lieu of my Asus thin notebook. It works great for email and the silk browser is fast to search on the internet. I also do online banking when I am connected to a secure Wi Fi network. It is easy to shop online with this tablet. If you are looking for an inexpensive alternate to the Apple iPAD take a look at the Kindle Fire HD. It is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: Improvement from Original Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Sarah L. Bernardo
Reviews.Content: I have used my original Kindle Fire EVERY single day since I got it. I just stopped using it when the new one arrived. So let's talk pro's & con's between the Original Kindle Fire 7" and the new Kindle Fire HD 8.9PRO'S:*Bigger Screen*Vibrant HD Display*Slimmer design & more comfortable to hold.*TV & Movie's sound amazing with the dolby audio.*The keyboard is bigger and more comfortable to use. And now it even underlines your miss spelled words in red so you can correct them!*Amazon Silk browser is faster & more compatible with different websites. On the older model some websites wouldn't cooperate and let me scroll so I would have to use Opera Mini browser to get around that.*Volume controls on the outside now!*Speakers are spaced out better*Finally a webcam & mic to Skype or take pictures and videos.*HDMI connector.CON'S:*No more Adobe Flash. Which means I can't view videos on some websites, because Adobe is no longer making it for Android or mobile devices. Which means on older websites that still use flash instead of HTML5 you cannot view videos. (Original Kindle Fire had flash installed).*Certain games that you may have purchased for the original are not compatible yet with the Kindle Fire HD 8.9".  (Facebook App is not loading newsfeed correctly on the 8.9, it stops loading after about 12 newsfeed updates).*Silk Browser seems to crash more often if you have 'Accelerate Pages' box checked in browser options. (Maybe an update will address this).*TV & Movies sound amazing with the dolby audio, but I found playing music through the speakers didn't have the same quality. And there's no equalizer in the newer model.*Lot's of Ad's. Supposedly you can pay $15 to disable all the ad's permanently. But, I did find in settings/applications you can turn off some of the recommendations. The only thing you can't disable is the ad's that show up on the screen when it's locked.All in all I'm quite happy with my new Kindle Fire HD 8.9. There are a few bugs that need to be worked out with different App's and the Silk Browser, but hopefully updates will correct those issues.

Reviews.Title: Coming into the 21st Century
Reviews.Author: Janice M. Burns
Reviews.Content: Well, I finally decided to go for an electronic device that I could use as a reader, as well as, giving me access to my apps. I love the Kindle Fire. It's easy to read, get and use apps, and access my internet accounts. And the HD screen is incredible.

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire hd
Reviews.Author: Valerie Jones
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my kindle fire.  I have already downloaded books, magazines, games and watched a movie.  Love it, love it, love it!!!

Reviews.Title: Best $299 I have spent in a long time!!!
Reviews.Author: T Teel "T Teel"
Reviews.Content: OK - This is my 4th Kindle. I had two b/w kindles and the 1st gen Fire and now the 8.9. For the cost - I am very impressed. I wish the on button was not next to the volume button and I am not really sure what that other connector next the the USB isfor - Video??? - but it runs all my apps much faster and since I have already loaded then on my Fire - they are ready to load on the 8.9 - very cool! If you want to upgrade from the Fire - this is a no brainer!!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle FIre HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: R. Jones
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews of the 7" KFHD I have no complaints about the lack of a charger or Flash.  I already had a Kindle KB charger and a cell phone charger both of which work fine with my 8.9" device.  That said, I am really liking this device.  The color is fantastic, sound is great and have learned very quickly how to navigate on it.  The only thing I don't like is the carousel.  I would prefer to have a desktop like on my PC and have apps and websites represented by icons.  Tapping would open an app or connect to a website.  I sent feedback on this to Amazon today.  One minor complaint about a couple of apps I downloaded:  tried to open them multiple times but each time they would quit working.  I paid a small charge for one but the other was free.  Have not watched any videos or movies but probably will over the Thanksgiving weekend.  All in all, Amazon, a great device!  Oh, and one more thing, somebody please, please make the Scrabble app work on the KFHD.It is Dec 7 and I have had my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" for 3 weeks. I had a few minor problems figuring the device out but managed fine on my own (I am 83) and have everything resolved.  The Battery HD app works well to keep up with battery charging.  I am enjoying game apps and have watched movies (since my earlier review).  My only difficulty is that my hearing is very bad and I have to use earphones to be able to hear dialog in movies. The control buttons are not a problem and I know exactly which port is for the USB charger. I still give it 5 stars.  There have been too many complaints about the design of the KFHD but no device will ever please everyone!  Still want good quality Scrabble game for this device.

Reviews.Title: Super Tablet
Reviews.Author: The Patster "Pat"
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablet great! It automatically connects to my wireless router and brings up my home page very easily. And it is really fast. Checking my e-mail is a breeze as well as surfing the web. My games are so much more fun on the larger screen. I have 3 Kindles of various types and sizes and use them all depending upon what I am doing. I love them all!

Reviews.Title: Love it but the "special offers"
Reviews.Author: aRzrbackfan
Reviews.Content: I love everything about the new Fire HD except the "special offers".  I will be removing them very soon.  I am also finding some compatibility issues between the original Fire and the Fire HD in the form of apps.  Several of my games are not loading correctly and shutting down, or will not allow me to link with Facebook.Other than those small problems, I'm loving the new HD!As a side note, if you do purchase the Fire HD, make sure you purchase the Kindle "Power Fast".  The device does not come with a plug in to charge via wall outlet.  Instead, it comes with the USB tethering cable and that is it.Edit*Since my original review, I have removed the "Special Offers".  It was a bit tedious trying to figure out how to remove them.  In order to remove them, you have to sign in to Amazon and find the link that takes you to the management of your Kindle.  From there, you can rename the device and remove the offers.  Because I had the original Kindle Fire when I activated the new HD, the HD had "(my name)'s 2nd Kindle".  I was happy to change it to just "(my name)'s Kindle".One con that I have found with the Fire HD is the buttons are a bit tricky to turn the device on and off.  I do like that there is an external volume control, but the button to bring it out of "sleep" is so small.  I have seen cases that will automatically put the device to sleep or wake it up when using it, but I chose to go with a more durable case.Also, the Kindle Fire HD had some sort of "upgrading".  Once it was complete, the apps that I had been having issues with closing down have been resolved.  However, I am still unable to link the apps with my Facebook account.

Reviews.Title: From Kindle 2nd Generation to Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: J. Walworth
Reviews.Content: Just received my new Kindle.  This review as of 11/19/2012 reflects my out of the box review and score.  After I put the device through its paces, I will update.PROS:- Really impressed with the out of the box functionality.  Very little setup required. I'm very tech savvy, but it is really nice when a device comes out of the box, drops a software update and is ready to rock in minutes.  Very slick.- E-Mail, Web, other basics very easy to set up- App store (what it contains) works well and in 10 minutes I had my basics (Weather, Vevo, Netflix, HBO GO, Pandora and Myfitnesspal) downloaded and running- Sound is very nice both via speakers and headphones.  I can really tell the difference in speaker quality between this Kindle and my wife's Ipad 2- File transfer -- particularly music -- is really easy.  All my itunes purchased music (except the odd drm stuff) is dropping right onto the device and playing.- Music plays while reading with no work arounds or issues (maybe I'm dating myself here, but this was a huge issue on many of the devices I've had over the years)- Form factor, weight, etc. works just fine -- two points I have huge hands and I bought a case so your experience may not match, but this easily works for me as a tablet and e-reader on the "holdability" side- e-reader works well and screen does not bother me for reading (glare, etc.)WAITING TO SEE- The carousel function of display takes some getting use to -- but it is growing on me as I learn to quickly add and delete.- Screen resolution for videos looks good so far, but for me the proof is in the longer term viewing (i.e. do I give up and just wait to fire up the big screen because it feels fuzzy / low resolution).  This more of a feel factor for me -- so it will take some viewing hours to determine.- Reading on the screen.  I'm not giving up my old kindle yet for reading books -- I'll have to see if the screen works long term- Video files -- I've attempted no file transfers yetCONS- Limited android application download.  I've had this less than 6 hours and it already bugs me that I can't download apps from Google Play and/or that many applications are unavailable. If you are an android application freak and/or can't live without X -- check before you buy and think carefully.- Charging.  When plugged into my computer there is nothing but a trickle charge -- you really do need the amazon charger which, given they don't include in the package, is a negative.- No desktop management software.  I intend to use this device as one of my primary multi-media consumption platforms, it would be nice to have some (even stripped down) desktop software to manage books, music, videos etc. I'm fine with opening the device directory and dropping in, but some automation and management would have been really nice.I will update after I play with the device, use around town, and try and use bluetooth keyboards etc., but so far this device is a very solid hand-held multi-media tablet.

Reviews.Title: worst tablet
Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: This is the first review I have ever writen. being a long time amazon costumer and Kindle user I thought I'dd give the Fire a try. What a mistake!!! it is slow, crashes, and it's interface must be one of the worst out there. I was actually trying to read Wired magazine on here but after the app crashed over and over, and even crashed the device, I decided to write this review. If you think you could use it for browsing the web, forget it, it's so slow you will end up using your phone...what a terriblebrowser.What I am most surprised about is how on this day and age it is still possible to launch such a poor product?!!! I just can't believe they thought they had something good and decided to launch it... I hear they don't make money on the sales of Kindles??? Maybe they should charge a little more fore a working product.

Reviews.Title: Good hardware, restricted to Amazon-approved apps
Reviews.Author: Donald Henderson Jr.
Reviews.Content: I'm impressed with the hardware, which has been discussed in many other reviews.  I'm not impressed with the fact that many, many great Android apps which are available from Google Play are NOT available from Amazon.  Perhaps Amazon has responded to another review regarding this limitation/problem, but I don't have time to read all of the reviews for this item.  I'd love to hear the real reason why these apps don't make it on to the Amazon-approved list (got something to do with money? royalties, maybe?).The main screen design is okay, although it would be great to have more control over the items that appear in the carousel, so that I can tailor the items readily available on my main screen, kind of like every other Android device in existence.  Just give me the option - let people who like the automatic nature of the carousel the way it currently works keep it that way.With those two exceptions, I think it's a wonderful device, but if I had it to do over again, I'd buy one of the new Google Nexus devices.  7 inch screen, but functionality is more important to me than screen size.

Reviews.Title: Wow!!!
Reviews.Author: Heather Leach
Reviews.Content: As an original Kindle fire user, I thought it was pretty great. Then they came out with the 8.9 HD, I put off buying it until recently when my original fire bit the dust. I had this within  2 days of ordering it and I love it. I can do soo many things with it and I have big plans for it as I keep learning about different apps I can use. I was debating on whether to buy this, the IPad or the windows surface. The price on the the other 2 are soo expensive, and since I already have a great laptop I couldn't see spending all that money. This is at-least half the price of the IPad I was looking at and for what I am wanting to use it for I think it is the better investment. I know people with the IPad and all the functions they have with their IPad that I was wanting I have on this Kindle Fire 8.9 HD. I know I got the best deal for me and my needs and love it.

Reviews.Title: I am obsessed!!
Reviews.Author: Charlie
Reviews.Content: I am a huge kindle fan. I have owned pretty much every type of kindle and have loved them all. I had the original kindle fire and I preferred using it over my ipad. In fact, I always said that if Amazon brought out a slightly bigger version with a camera for skype and 4g, I would never use the ipad again. I got this for Christmas and have since given my ipad to my sis. I love that it has my entire reading collection, stunning hd display, and amazon prime! Love, love LOVE it!!!

Reviews.Title: Do You Enjoy Amazon's Unique Online "Ecosystem"...?  If So, You May Also Ejoy Using Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: HJW "o8Heather8o"
Reviews.Content: By this point in time, all that should be said about the 8.9" Kindle Fire HD has already been said by other reviewers, so I will comment on some of the unique aspects of my experience with it.First & foremost, if you're undecided about getting one, I would say, ask yourself this... "How much do you enjoy hanging out at Amazon's website?  How often do you visit their site, & what do you like to do when you're here?  Do you prefer visiting a different bookstore's site?"  I would recommend the Kindle Fire 8.9" HD to you if your answer runs along the lines of, "I log into Amazon almost every single day, usually at least several times a week...& I get lost online here...I lose hours just immersed in all of the different 'cool stuff' there is to see & read about here.  A huge percentage of the things I can't buy locally, I buy from Amazon...& I admit that I dig hanging out on their website, just checking things out & maybe commenting on them."I say this not because we're all going to shop ourselves into sweet oblivion on this tablet (although at times we may), but because if you like visiting Amazon.com & spending time in Amazon's unique "ecosystem" in general, & if you like what it "feels like" to be here - you will probably also enjoy the new Kindle Fire HD.  If you like the feel of hanging out in an ever-changing atmosphere & look forward to seeing what's new at this particular "virtual bookstore" - it's likely you may also like spending time on its tablet too.  It's easy to either like or dislike both Amazon & this tablet for the same reasons.  Because I very much like Amazon's site, I immediately liked this tablet - because it offers that familiar feeling of "cruising Amazon," & being able to take the entire contents of your digital account there with you, wherever you go.  My one wish that would make it perfect...is if it served fresh cappuccino lattes from a virtual espresso bar.  :) Ah well, I can dream.All of which leads to Amazon's excellent continuing tech support.  With many tablets, & the manufacturer will help you to set it up, & iron out any initial technical issues, then after that - you're on your own.  Which is Ok.  But if you have an issue with an item on your Kindle Fire HD, Amazon's Kindle Customer Service Dept. is just a phone call away, 24/7.  This has been quite handy, & they've stood behind their product with me so far.  As an example, for some reason I could not access over half of my music downloads, & they helped me to retrieve all of my purchases, so I can hear them as I read.  Help with malfunctioning apps ordered from Amazon is also a huge plus.  So far I am impressed, & I hope this does not change.I read some dour complaints about this Kindle Fire's limitations as a tablet, & really expected nothing more than a glorified eReader & a portable iHeart Radio & Netflix machine, & that was Ok with me.  I am graduating from the "Kindle 3G With Keys," & I chose it.  But what really surprised me, was how much I can actually DO on it...besides access all my books.  There's basic internet & email access, which is a must, & I also insisted on smooth, high-def video Netflix access.  But if you're a casual gamer & an e-gadget lover, there are SO many nifty & often free apps available to you, that you may forget to even open your books...  I have a nice collection really great books, but in the 5 weeks that I've owned this Kindle, I have actually have spent more time goofing off with my apps (like issuing howls of laughter at smashing things in "Let's Break Stuff!" Premium)...than I actually have reading.  And new & interesting apps are arriving each & every day.  In fact, Amazon offers Kindle Fire owners a "Free App Of The Day" daily for your consideration & enjoyment.  Some of the stuff you'll see featured there is creative & amazing...& some not.  But it's always fun to look forward to seeing what's next tomorrow.  If these ideas appeals to you (& you don't really just wish you could buy an iPad, but are settling for a Kindle)...you may really enjoy the 8.9" Kindle Fire HD.Also, I am impressed with the screen sensitivity.  I have tried tablets that I really had to *press* on hard, to get to respond.  In my experience, I find that the better the quality is of the tablet stylus I use, the better & faster the screen responds to it.  And the more cheaply made the stylus is, the more poorly it performs.  For me, using a different stylus (even though they may look almost identical) results in differing performance that is almost like using 2 different tablets.  When selecting a stylus, go with "what feels right in your hand".  Stylus reviews are hit & miss, & only you will know what's right for you.  It's cheap of them but probably just as well that Amazon does not include a stylus with this tablet, because half the people would probably hate it...although it would be nice for emergencies when your stylus of choice has wandered elsewhere.Those are the pros, now for the cons...I actually give this tablet 4 1/2 Stars primarily because it needs to use a little faster processing speed than what it comes with, for what it's trying to do.  It's good enough for most average functions, but if you're used to technology that really flies, you may feel a slight sense of lag with the 8.9" Kindle Fire HD.Also, the price gouging on the 32GB version of this tablet & the deliberate lack of an SD card port, is a major issue.  You can always keep most of your less frequently used books, music, & apps in your "Amazon Cloud"...but it's amazing how eerily fast the memory in that 16GB (part of which is taken up by the O/S) starts to fill up.  I never thought I'd use so much internal memory so fast, but after a few weeks, the increased memory usage is sneaking up on me like an evening shadow.  If you generally use up a lot of external memory in other areas of your life (eg. PC, phone, cameras, etc.)...you may want to bite the bullet & get the 32GB version of this tablet, just for the greater elbow room.  I wish I had, but I was too stubborn to pay for it.  That said, I actually would have paid the 32GB price if what it offered instead was an external SD memory card port capable of accessing cards up to 64GB.  That price I could live with.Furthermore, I give it 4 1/2 Stars due to its average battery life.  Like my cordless phone, my Kindle Fire HD always seems to be on the charger.  I would like a tablet that can do this much to hold a charge 30-50% longer than mine does.  Also, it came with a USB cable, but when I plug it into the PC to access it, it actually loses charge, instead of gaining it.  That's unfortunate, because after I use & unplug it at my PC, I still have to charge it from my wall outlet.  IMO...that's just wrong.  And the PC USB charging that occurs during "sleep mode" has been barely noticeable.Also, if you decide to purchase this tablet, I highly recommend also getting a supportive, well-constructed cover.  You will not "love" all of the covers out there (believe me...) but using this tablet "bare" feels very risky for a device of this value, & I highly recommend protecting your new investment with a Kindle cover that you can at least "like".  For this purpose, I prefer the over-priced bonded (Ok, barely) leather cover that Amazon makes Amazon Kindle Fire HD 8.9" Standing Leather Case, Royal Purple - even though the color actually arrived a murky "burgundy"...because I have tried equally expensive covers much worse.  Amazon's cover focuses on durability, surrounding & cradling their new Kindle HD with rubber bumpers on all 4 sides, to see it more safely see the bumps & clunks of life on the move.  Short of a "Nerf Cover," this magnetized cover will offer protection for your Kindle if you hope to toss it into your purse or tote bag, to take with you on the go.  It's also good if you tend to absent-mindledly bump things around while your mind races onto its next great idea, Kindle in hand.  For me, the sleep/wake cover feature really was its best selling point.  No matter what you do though, make sure you find this device a good cover that you can live with.  Because even though it's not flimsy, life will happen to it.Overall...  I give the 8.9" Kindle Fire HD tablet 4 1/2 Stars, because if Amazon were a real brick & mortar book store...I would probably live there...sipping lattes & eating scones in a wireless hot spot.  And because during my free time, this Kindle Fire has practically been my right hand since it arrived, & it's been hard to put down.  Also, the round the clock tech support has been great.  But I believe somewhat higher specs should have been offered for this device to match its capabilities, & at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: Better than the original
Reviews.Author: Noname
Reviews.Content: I have the original Kindle Fire.  When my husband asked me what I want for Christmas, I told him a Fire HD 8.9".  I got to play with my present early, and it is so worth it.SETUPSetup was a cinch.  It came registered to my account.  I just had to turn it on.  There was a short tour on screen, but I barely looked at it.  I can't even tell you what it said.  If you've had a Fire, this is just as easy.  Your favorites are at the bottom of the screen when you press the star.  Swipe from the top down to get at the settings.  Swipe back up to bring back your screen.BETTER THAN THE ORIGINALThe main reason I wanted the Fire HD is the larger screen.  I read a lot, and the larger screen size is so much kinder on the eyes.  Videos and photos are also much more vivid, and they stream smoothly.The new Fire HD has Bluetooth technology.  Finally, I can pair it with my Bluetooth keyboard and my Bluetooth speakers.  They make the tablet experience so much richer.Also included is a camera on the screen side facing the user.  I downloaded the free Photo Editor app to take advantage of it.  Too bad the camera isn't on the other side.  I'd find that more useful, but a front facing camera is better than no camera.Other advantages are external volume control buttons and a power button located on the *top* of the Fire.  No more accidentally turning the screen off.WiFi is very good.  While the WiFi signal on my old Fire keeps cutting out, the one on my Fire HD is constant and strong.SOME DRAWBACKSI don't care for the placement of the micro USB port along the longer side.  My cases and sleeves open at the top, so I can't charge the Fire HD while it's in the case because of the location of the power port.Also, although most of my apps that I use on my old Fire could be downloaded on the Fire HD, a few of them are not compatible.Flash is not supported.  This has not been a problem for me, but it may concern others.  I've run into a few instances where video wouldn't play, but I can live with that.  There are workarounds, but it's more work than I care for.Lastly, bigger means it won't fit in my purse.  We can't have it all.WITH SPECIAL OFFERSI got the Fire HD with special offers.  It gives me a beautiful ad at the startup screen.  No big deal.  I was hoping for coupons, but I'll take the ads.  So far, they have all been pleasing to the eye.CONCLUSIONI'm so happy I got a Fire HD.  It really is an upgrade from the original.  I use my Fire HD all the time now.

Reviews.Title: Way to Go Amazon
Reviews.Author: J. Fuller
Reviews.Content: My spouse quickly took possession of the newer,  larger Kindle and absolutely uses it everyday.  We are PRIME member so that makes this device worth the money.  How great of Amazon to also price match this when within a week or so of purchase they offered it $50 cheaper.  That is customer service when clearly they did not have to agree.  For this reason I am sticking with Amazon.This is a wonderful device for folks that love to consume media, and want a portable and easy to use product.  We have both a 7 and 8.9 HD versions now.  The extra screen size does mean a little more in size and weight but may be easier to read and view movies, etc.  I find that by double clicking the 7 inch I can easily increase  my text so this is not really an issue.I described my experience with the first 7 inch HD that I had to return and am monitoring the new one to see if the same problem develops.  However, I do not consider this issue to be a deal breaker.  Basically I have multiple email accounts and when I would check them from time to time, inevitably at least 1 would give me a connection error.  YES, I deleted and reinstalled the email settings and all would be fine until later I would return to find the same error.  I'm not sure what was causing that issue.If you are into Amazon, I mean if you're like me and pretty much buy a lot of items from them, then you need at least 1 of these devices in your household.  It you're a PRIME member, it is absolute in order to really enjoy the benefits with the simple touch of a few keys.Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: don't need anything else
Reviews.Author: matt meyers
Reviews.Content: I've had it for a little less than a month.  I LOVE this thing!!!  My one complaint is: the speakers have very clear sound, but if you want to hear a show, you have to have something behind it like a table or your hand to "direct" the sound forward since the speakers are on the back.My 3 year old daughters love it!  Everyone I've let try it loved it!  It has great parental controls so my little ones can't accidentally purchase something - I love FreeTime!  The free streaming videos with Prime account are the greatest thing on earth!  Wide variety of apps for free.  The battery lasts a long time, especially if you don't have the wireless turned on all the time.  The touch screen is just the right sensitivity for me, but my fingers are too fat for a few things that are small on the screen - but there might be a way to adjust the size of those that I haven't found yet.  It is so easy to use, understand and find things - I never read the instructions and don't think I'll need to.  I've seen some other tablets for similar price that are not nearly as easy to understand and navigate.A downside - I'm addicted!  The first couple weeks, housework and other responsibilities suffered, so I have used the FreeTime to restrict my time on it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: dona
Reviews.Content: I've really enjoyed my new Kindle Fire HD.  I purchased the larger one after much thought and am really glad that I did.  The larger size makes viewing my streaming videos even better than I had hoped.  I no longer need the lamp on to read in bed.  The graphics for games are exceptional.  It was a great purchase.

Reviews.Title: better, bigger, faster
Reviews.Author: Marc Lauterbach
Reviews.Content: as a happy user of the first fire, all i have to say: better, bigger, faster. what's not to like!?Amazon proofed once again that they know well what the typical tablet using media consumer wants.I still use the "little fire" quite a bit though, due to its nice form factor. It is just easier to hold in one hand.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 8.9" Review
Reviews.Author: dachsiedogs
Reviews.Content: I have progressed through the Kindle Fire products and was excited to receive my pre-order Kindle.  One thing I noticed right away was the power button was a little bit harder to find than in the previous version.  The volume button is right next to it and you really have to feel carefully for the power button.  I also had a few problems with applications failing because of the Silk.  Previous versions did not have silk on them, so was curious what this was.  I also notice that the games do not seem as quick to react as the previous version.  I am disappointed that the adaptor and other accessories are marked down, when I paid full price.  Still like the product and the bigger screen, but am debating whether I should keep the smaller or larger machine and gift one.

Reviews.Title: Long wait has been worth it
Reviews.Author: P. Johnson
Reviews.Content: I have been checking all the ultra portable tablets, net books and ever the high end phones and find that this with the additional purchase of a keyboard far the best price to feature choice.  Obviously some of the other products may do "some" more but this does all I need for home and travel at a much better price point.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9 a welcome addition
Reviews.Author: Dick Snell
Reviews.Content: Have had it a couple of weeks now. No problems whatsoever. Just used HDMI hookup to TV for a couple of :Prime Movies (Tin Tin & The Headhunters) and the picture on my 5+ year old 42" Panasonic Viera HD Plasma TV is easily as good as playing a DVD. Have watched 'North by Northwest' and much of first season of 'Buffy Vampire Slayer' on device itself and very pleased with the screen quality. I don't think the speakers are overly loud, but I'm a little hard of hearing. Use of some inexpensive ear but headphones solves that problem nicely. Battery life is very good and charges up rapidly when depleted. My only problem has nothing to do with  the KF HD, but may be of interest to this forum's readers. The CaseCrown case I bought simply reeks of chemicals and you may want to carefully weigh any possible purchase decision.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 8.9
Reviews.Author: marge
Reviews.Content: This is a really comfortable size tablet for reading books or on the web.  Lightweight and good color.  The control buttons are really small and hard to see for older eyes, colored buttons would be easier to see.  There is also no charging light to let you know when the device is charged as there was on the older Kindles, a feature that would still be nice.  Sometimes tapping a item does not work and requires extra taps which can be annoying.A major turnoff is the apps that are preloaded by Amazon that I don't want and can't get rid of. For this price the tablet should allow you not Amazon to control the content loaded on the device.  When you pay extra to avoid the ads it would indicate you could also control the preloaded ads.Overall I would buy it again but it could certainly use a few improvements in the above areas.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality
Reviews.Author: Teresa A. Smith
Reviews.Content: I had purchased a cheaper Android tablet for my daughter but had many problems with it. So I wanted something reliable and made to last. I'm very pleased with the Kindle Fire, the images are vivid and crisp. The sound quality is superb and have no problems loading and managing content.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: JDS
Reviews.Content: Have only had I my Kindle for a few days but I love it. The size is perfect-bigger than just a reader but smaller than a laptop.  It is very user friendly and easy to use.  The screen resolution is wonderful.  So far the battery life is exceptional.  I have had it on all evening using it and have not charged it yet.  My only concern is the weight of the unit.  It is a bit heavier than i expected.

Reviews.Title: HD 8.9 nicely survived a short drop onto tile floor
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: My 5 year old son borrowed the Kindle to play angry birds.  I told him to be very careful with it and NOT drop it because I don't even have the case for it yet.  Well I guess it's my fault..  The Kindle took a tumble from his arms crashing onto the hard tile floor.  To my complete suprise, it survived unscathed and I can't find a scratch or dent on it.  I have nothing anything negative to say...I believe pad prices will come down over time. The unit feels a bit incomplete without the Amazon case.  It's not easy to hold in the hands without a case.  I have the case for my smaller Kindle and they're very nice.  I especially like the way the Amazon case has a magnetic cover that turns the item on and puts it to sleep when you open and close the cover.

Reviews.Title: My third kindle
Reviews.Author: Ronna L Miller
