The App store isn't as large as Android and many of the apps I had free on Android cost on Kindle because the vendor only offers the pay version. Not a deal breaker given the general cost of apps and you can side load apps if you really want to. "I Love My Kindle (fire)" is a good blog about the fun things that can be done with a Kindle Fire.It is smaller and lighter than my Touchpad. The screen is amazing and it has good sound overall. It's a very responsive device; opening apps quickly. I've had no problems with any apps.Battery life is amazing. I find myself forgetting when I charged it last, even after streaming movies.You have to buy an outlet charger separate. It's $19.99 but sometimes you can get it for $9.99. I assume not including one was a way to keep costs down but seems silly.I bought one without ads. My wife has the ads and doesn't mind them but it kind of annoyed me. Costs $15 so it may or may not be worth it to you.Since we have a Prime account, the integration with Amazon is really nice. I can easily access all my books and videos from the top menu bar. No more logging into Amazon to get to my videos and I don't have to open the kindle app to get to my books. These are all a swipe away.The Kindle has its own desktop, using a carousel and bookshelf. The thing I don't like about this is everything gets ordered by last use, making locating things a bit of a challenge because they are never in the same place. But there is a "favorites" where you can put stuff so this isn't a big deal.  And if you really hate it, you can side load a program that gives you the Android option of multiple screens. I initially hated the carousel and bookshelf but have gotten used to them.

Reviews.Title: Great for most needs
Reviews.Author: S. Gordon
Reviews.Content: Love the display & ease of use.  My son has a 1st gen Kindle Fire so I knew what I was getting.  No regrets.  Still need to sign up for the $50 1st year data service - been using wifi so far.  I do wish it was open to the Google Play store since I have many apps that are on my phone that can't be accessed on the Kindle but I knew that going in so I can't really complain.  I wish Amazon would start getting more high quality games & apps though.  There are several that I really would like to be able to get on the Kindle (games mostly).  All-in-all it is what I expected and works really well.  Go ahead and get the Amazon cover with auto on-off for it.  It's expensive but lightweight and works really well.  I have dropped the Kindle on pavement with no damage (corner hit) - only a small scuff that I didn't notice until now.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Arlene F. Brauckmuller "Arbrauck"
Reviews.Content: Being a IPad user for the past couple of years.....mine was a first generation, was getting a little testy, and I needed a new one.  However the prices of the newer ones scared me off.  I ordered the Kindle Fire (at $300 less) in hopes that it would come close to my usage of the IPad.  Believe me when I tell you it has surpassed my expectations.  It took a little time to get used to it,..... wasn't sure at first it would give me everything I wanted out of it......but little by little I started getting out of the "IPad" mode and into the Kindle Fire mode.  It has all the things I need and want, just had to learn how to find them and use them.  If I had gone by my very first impression (I didn't feel like it was user friendly at first) and not tried to work things out, I probably would have sent it back.  So glad I didn't....I love it.

Reviews.Title: Just cracked the Kindle box
Reviews.Author: canesfanPBC
Reviews.Content: Hi, So far I like this thing. I am not a super techie, but fairly tech savy. The picture is stunning, the audio with phones is fantastic.Out of the box, in a few minutes, I was watching Xfinity, and enjoying "Walking Dead". There is excellent support from both Amazon ( as always) and very active user forums for more help. The big knock on this product is you can't view Flash content, after a 30 second search on a forum I found a fix for this. It took 5 minutes to download and install the needed files and another browser, and I was veiwing You Tube without a hitch. So far,  after about 20 hours into owning this, I have the opposite of buyer's remorse! I am loving it.

Reviews.Title: Learning curves in old age
Reviews.Author: Josephine
Reviews.Content: Its a great device, and the best part is the super support provided by the Kindle agents.  At 87 yrs. I'm a bit of a slow learner, and it was, at first, quite a challenge to learn how to use its many aspects.  But Kindle people were kind and patient and helped me over the hurdles.  I love its portability and the many apps that give me a new window on the world.  Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Excellent tablet within limits
Reviews.Author: J. LaRamie
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet to use around the house and occasionally at a coffee shop or hotel to check email and facebook, surf the web, read some e-books, watch a movie, use a few apps, and let my kids play a few games.  It's an excellent tablet for all those things.  I looked at the iPad mini, Nexus 7, and Kindle Fire HD 7 and 8.9 and chose the Fire 8.9.  Got it on sale (same price it's selling for now apparently) plus used some Amazon points so it wasn't that much more than the 7.  Bigger screen than the 7" tablets or the mini makes web use and movie watching a lot nicer.  Understand that any technology like this is going to be obsolete in three to five years, so there was no reason to spend more money for stuff I wouldn't use.  Plus it's not so expensive that I don't mind the kids using it now and then.The display is awesome.  Better than an iPad mini (which doesn't have a Retina display when I compared them).  Speakers are very good for a tablet.  The Silk browser works fine...I haven't had problems with it.  I like the display of webpages I've been to before because I typically go to the same ones over and over.  Hasn't crashed or had any software problems so far, and I've been using it every day for a couple months.One con is it's not a "real" computer, but that's not what I bought it for.  Wouldn't get it to run spreadsheets, move and edit files, compose documents, or do anything specialized.  Amazon puts their own skin on it, which in principle annoys me but maybe not as much as someone who is used to pure Android computers.  I'm not heavily invested in either the Android or Apple environments so it wasn't a practical concern for me.The thing that annoyed me the most was not being able to find some pdfs I downloaded from the web.  The system explorer that comes with it sucks.  I had to plug it into a desktop and look through it with Windows Explorer to find, move, and delete files.  I downloaded the OfficeSuite app and that works better.  Still, there are some files that say they were downloaded but I can't locate without plugging into another computer.  Yes I'm looking in the "download" file and any other relevant folder I can think of.Some people gripe about the ads but I couldn't care less.  It's one ad on the unlock screen.  You see it for one second when first waking the tablet up and that's it.  Others say it's just a portal to the Amazon universe to make you buy things.  Well, I buy all my online books as well as a lot of other stuff from Amazon anyway.

Reviews.Title: Excellent tablet within limits
Reviews.Author: J. LaRamie
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet to use around the house and occasionally at a coffee shop or hotel to check email and facebook, surf the web, read some e-books, watch a movie, use a few apps, and let my kids play a few games.  It's an excellent tablet for all those things.  I looked at the iPad mini, Nexus 7, and Kindle Fire HD 7 and 8.9 and chose the Fire 8.9.  Got it on sale (same price it's selling for now apparently) plus used some Amazon points so it wasn't that much more than the 7. Yes I'm looking in the "download" file and any other relevant folder I can think of.Some people gripe about the ads but I couldn't care less.  It's one ad on the unlock screen.  You see it for one second when first waking the tablet up and that's it.  Others say it's just a portal to the Amazon universe to make you buy things.  Well, I buy all my online books as well as a lot of other stuff from Amazon anyway.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding device, just a few drawbacks.
Reviews.Author: Randomly Awesome Guy
Reviews.Content: Well, I've had the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" for almost a month and a half now. I figured I should post a review on it, so here it is. I'll break it down by sections, as the Amazon page has the different features broken down:Display:They weren't kidding, this screen has to be seen to be believed. I haven't compared it to the latest gen iPad, but it's really gorgeous. I've played back Wreck It Ralph in full HD on it and wow, it just pops. Singularly the best screen I've seen, and I've seen many. :)Regarding reduced screen glare, I guess I can see where other displays could have caused glare where this one didn't, but it's such a non-issue in day-to-day use that I just really can't comment much on it. I would have to do further specific testing to see if this is the case with a similar screen to see if there is indeed a difference.Sound:Although it's not "booming sound", it certainly beats the pants off of any other tablet I've used in terms of loudness and quality. I have an iPad 2 and a Nook Tablet, and both frustrated me with how low their sound output was. Not a problem with the Fire HD. I personally haven't really heard any virtual surround sound effects as yet (Waiting to get the money to buy something that'll actually use it, like say the Band of Brothers series in full HD), so that's also a non-issue for me now. Will update when I get a chance to test that specific function.Dual-Band Wifi:I have a MIMO router, and I've attempted to use it to transfer large files over (In my test case scenario, downloading the full HD version of Wreck It Ralph to my Fire HD). It's seamless, but I wouldn't say it's 43% faster than the new iPad or 65% faster than the Nexus 7. I don't have a specific rating, but to me it just felt about 20% faster than using straight up 802.11g. Still, it's a nice bonus.Processor Speed:No complaints with the OMAP4470, it does just about everything I've thrown at it with aplomb. The SGX544 graphics core was able to handle the most graphically intensive game I could get (A Bard's Tale) with zero problems. The only thing that was perplexing was that I was unable to get MKV files converted to MP4 format to play, but I'm rather suspecting that it's a converter issue, so I'm not holding that against the Fire HD. I'll try again later with other MP4 files that I know are good and report back.Storage:I got the 16GB version, of which 12.8 is user available. If you can swing it, I highly suggest the 32GB version. When I downloaded an HD movie (About 8GB), along with two other SD TV episodes (40 mins each) and a few hundred MP3's, I was getting some serious space issues. I really, really, REALLY wished the Fire HD had a microSD slot, and I'm going to knock a star off for just that. It's really annoying having to constantly shuffle content around just because of space issues. I'm actually considering gifting this one to my wife and moving to the 32GB version just because of that, but that extra expense wouldn't have been needed if they just put in a microSD card slot. :(Amazon Prime:Pretty freaking awesome. However, that's not germane (much) to the review of the device itself (Barring the ability to borrow books from the Amazon Lending Library and Prime Instant Video), so suffice to say that you should consider getting Prime if you buy a Fire HD.Apps:Getting better day by day, and the Free App of the Day is actually pretty neat, but still lags behind what's in the Google Play market. However, they got most of the popular apps available, so that's a plus. Still as yet have to see any real Fire exclusive apps, but I'm not holding my breath on that as yet. Quick note (And again, not related specifically to the device), the Facebook app (As of 3/19/13) still is pretty buggy. Just a head's up.Content Availability:This is Amazon we're talking about. They have quite a bit of content available, and growing day by day. So you're covered on that front. :)Book Reading:My first and foremost use of my Fire HD is an eReader. In actuality I almost got the Paperwhite because that's what I really wanted. However, since I had lost my Nook Tablet I was without a media consumption device (My Vita doesn't count), I decided that the Fire HD would do it for me. Reading on an LCD screen doesn't bother me (Although I know for some they get eye fatigue), so I figured it would be okay for that purpose. Indeed, it is. Although this might sound like a minor thing, but I really like the default background color they use when you're reading a book. It makes the letters stand out like a real book would, and reduces eye strain. However, if that's not your cup of tea you can change it. The fonts and sizes of said fonts are also changable if you so wish to do so (I found the defaults to work fine). All the usual e-reader things are available (Thesaurus if you double-tap a word, highlighting passages of interesting, sharing passages on your social networks, etc..), and it takes DRM-free e-books just fine (I had purchased a Tom Clancy novel from another vendor, an e-pub file, and it worked fine once I copied it over to the Fire HD). In addition, to those folks who need bigger print to read, I can see this device be very handy for them.The only downside to this device as an e-ready is very simple... Weight.While laying down in bed and holding it with one hand aloft reading it will tire out your hand/arm quickly enough. While not a MAJOR problem, you need to be aware of it. If you want something light enough for that to not be an issue, I would suggest looking hard at the Paperwhite. In fact, I'm STILL considering a Paperwhite for just this reason, as I tend to read a LOT in bed.Side note: I attempted to test out the Text to Speech option. It's okay in a pinch, but the synthetic voice would drive me a bit insane after a while. :) THAT being said, I have NOT tried the "Professional Reading" option that you have on certain books. I'm sure that would make a BIG difference! I'll report back when I test that out. Note: This option is a bit of an extra charge.Magazine Reading:I decided to put this in it's own category because I thought that it was important enough of a distinction from book reading. On the whole magazines look very crisp and sharp (Actually, comparing my in-print copy of Maxim to the digital version I think the digital version is sharper on the HD!), and for some magazines (For example, the latest issue of the SI Swimsuit Edition) they add tons of additional content that you can't get with print, such as video clip add-ons and the like (The coolest was a live Twitter feed of the SI models, creative!). You can zoom in to see details or just go page by page, as you prefer. Very nicely done!Music/MP3's:I've been transitioning away from iTunes for some time now, so I've got a decent selection from Amazon's MP3 store. It was seamless to transfer the songs over, using the same app that's on my phone. So no worries there.Audiobooks:I was unaware that Amazon had purchased Audible, and I had several audiobooks with them already. Transferring them over was cake, and worked just fine. Good stuff there.X-Ray:A cool feature, but not one that I've used at all. I just haven't really seen a need to. Still, it's cool.Skype:Works like a champ, but then again I'm not expecting anything different.Kindle Free Time:Although I have kids, they have their own (low cost) tablets, so there is no need for them to share mine. Thus it wasn't tested. However, I can see that this would be great for families that are sharing the Fire.Browser:Drives me a bit batty, but that's just me. I eventually am going to try and side load Chrome on this, but the default browser drives me a bit nuts. That being said, at least YouTube works in it (Especially critical because there is no native YouTube app!). Generally I try to avoid the browser whenever I can. Again, for most folks I guess it would be fine, but I'm a bit of a browser snob. ;)Photos:I LOVED the fact that it would automatically download all of my Facebook pictures into my Fire. Other than that, it's a standard photo app, nothing to write home about. =)Shopping:Obviously the Fire HD is a great window into all the wares that Amazon has to offer. It's way, way, way too easy to do so. =DWell, that's about it. I hope that I was some help to some that are thinking about the device. I'm giving it a four out of five stars, with losing a star because of the lack of expandable storage and because of the weight (.90 of a star for the former, .10 for the latter, if you want to know my breakdown). So yes, a SOLID device. :)

Reviews.Title: SO FAR, GREAT!
Reviews.Author: DAG
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tablet after purchasing and iPAD mini for my son for Christmas, the iPAD work flawlessly as much as I was able to determine for the short time I was able to use it.  After reading the reviews on the Kindle Fire HD 4g LTE wireless WIFI unit I found that it had 'better' video quality, also sound quality (as per advertisement) but in reality the sound requires a 'booster' for the 'hard of hearing' (which I am) but on the positive side I 'LIKE IT' it is able to get aps that I personally like, Netflix, Hulu Plus, Crackle, games and accessing my home PC, etc., etc. I haven't really gotten into the other aps just due to 'time to explore' but what it has which is the ICING on the cake as it were is the 4G LTE wireless access which allows me to access aps and computer from almost anywhere (so far), so I gave it a FOUR STAR rating for doing what it is doing so far and I must admit that it is pushing a FIVE STAR rating if it continues to 'work' as it has been doing, I'm sure it will get BETTER as time goes on, let's hope, eh?Now for the AT&T; services required for the 4g LTE mode, I will just keep a tight lip on this for now, I not thrilled so far and when I purchased this 'item' I was sure it stated that the dollar amount was $49.99 A YEAR, which isn't true, perhaps I read it wrong, so now I just renewed the service for 250mgs for 30 days @ $14.99 per month which I was not made aware of when I purchased the KINDLE FIRE HD 4G LTE WIRELESS WIFI 8.9" SCREEN, ETC, ETC.  but I still LIKE IT, even though....???

Reviews.Title: Happy!
Reviews.Author: D. P. Wright "If it ain't broke, I'm gonna fi...
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to write a 50 paragraph technical review.  I am not qualified nor do I think there is any need to add to the bunch of them here already.  In short, I love it.  The wifi works, the email works, the music works, the books and games work.  That's all that's important to me.  It works and I don't have to wonder about any of the reasons why or why not the different features work. My 8.9 is an upgrade from my original KFire and I'm happy that it was less than 100 dollars more than the original, which now is in the hands of my kid.  My one single issue was the the "suggested items" which was a 2 minute problem with a visit to the forums. Oh, sorry, there was one other issue.  I bought it literally hours before the price drop.  I paid $314.00.  When I got up the next morning to check if it had shipped, there it was for $284.00 without the special offers.  My wife called and they gave her the full difference to the special offer price.  She told them we didn't buy the sponsored screensaver version but they credited us that amount anyway.Amazon rocks.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I first want to state that this was my very first tablet purchase.  I work in the IT field, and I knew a lot of people that had different types of tablets.  I played with the iPad, various versions, and I was impressed, but the price was a big turn off.  They were asking for a lot of money for a product that I could tell the Kindle Fire HD tablet could compete with.  I primarily made the purchase because of college.  There are soooo many textbooks that you can either rent or purchase for the Kindle Fire HD that you cannot purchase for the regular Kindle Reader.  The price difference between physical copy and digital copy finally drove me to purchase the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 inch tablet.  The product was simple to configure and use right out of the box.  My only gripe is that I wish that all of the applications that you can get on an Android device were a purchasable option for the Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: Are you kidding me?
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This Kindle is "over the top", I love it.  I bought the original Kindle years back, but I managed to break the screen about a year later and waited 'till now to get a new one.  I was originally planning to get the Kindle HD 7 inch version, then decided to upgrade to the 8.9 inch when I recieved a $30.00 discount off the listed price.  I am so glad I did, the screen is huge!  The wireless works flawlessly and fast.  I haven't watched any movies on it yet, but I have joined the amazon prime club to get access to all the free streaming videos and movies on demand.  This is so cool!  The picture is crisp and clear, very easy to read on!!!  You can download games and apps along with checking your email on the web.  I was concerned about spending this much money on something like this, not any more.  As a tablet it does lack some amenities, so do your research, I LOVE it.  I use it everyday at work and read on my breaks.  I purchased a case for it to protect it when I bought it, I am not breaking this one.This really is my favorite gadget to date!  A MUST have, go get it.  Did I mention you can download your music and photo's?  Well constructed with a beautiful picture.  WOW!!!

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT!!!
Reviews.Author: Brandon
Reviews.Content: Don't ask questions. If you are looking for something in the way of touch screen or quality that doesn't lock up and freeze then this is the kindle for you. Battery lasts forever and you could stomp this thing and it will not break. EXCELLENT quality product and very user friendly. I bought this one for my girlfriend and she absolutely loves it. Price IS INDEED a little steep but you're getting a lot for your money. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: This thing rocks
Reviews.Author: Larry Parker
Reviews.Content: It simply does more than what I expected. So in using it I've really enjoyed the quality content available in my Prime membership.I've used this thing for a while now so this is an update. The more I use it, the more I like it. I still haven't explored all it's feature yet but it aces everything I've TRIED.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture and sound
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am not going to comment on the software concerning lags, freezing, etc. because I have side-loaded apps not meant for the Kindle (not rooted though), and I don't believe it would be fair.I will instead briefly comment on the picture and audio. The picture is extremely good, especially on the two HD movies I bought to test - "The Town" and "The 'A' Team." If, when contemplating your purchase, you are contemplating skipping out on the HD videos because the quality won't be a big difference (I do that with DVDs compared to Blu-Ray because my eye can't necessarily tell the difference even on a 47" screen), you should reconsider. On the SD videos I bought or already had - "Toy Story 3" and the 2 seasons of "Dark Blue," the quality of the video was not nearly as good. So, if you are planning on sticking with HD videos, this device will be a good buy for you. With HD source videos, the picture is nice and clear. You do get some glare, but it's about the same as with other devices. The HDMI out works fine, I bought an HDMI A-to-D cable and hooked it up to my TV, no big deal.Now... The sound. Devices claiming to have superior sound are a dime a dozen. This one gets the prize, though - it has the best sound by far of any other tablet, phone, or laptop I have owned (note, I have never owned an iDevice of any sort so I can't speak to that). The "Dolby Surround" is truly great, especially at higher volumes and while watching things such as action movie trailers that are packed with explosions and deep bass. Sound is also decent through bluetooth - I have a Bluetooth speaker and a pair of headphones, and they both perform about as well with the Fire as with as with my other devices.I hate to say it, but the hype about the wi-fi on this device is mostly that, hype - at least for those of us with regular-speed Internet (DSL/cable) and N-routers. I haven't tried it with a dual band router and FiOS or something equivalent, maybe it would outperform its competition on something like that, I don't know.The Facebook app for the Kindle is terrible - this is not Amazon's fault, but Facebook's - I feel this is worth noting, since a lot of people would want to use it. The last I checked, Facebook is claiming that they are working on a fix, but I won't hold my breath. Also worth noting that the Fire HD is not flash compatible, meaning that you will not be able to watch a lot of online videos out of the box - again, not Amazon's fault, but Adobe's, as far as I know, Adobe is not providing support for Flash on any new mobile devices.Again, I have not compared this device against an iPad 3 - but at this price point, if you just want a device to browse the Net and watch some videos, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Gail Joramo
Reviews.Content: I have to make you aware that I had my son and many of my friends help me research which type of e-reader I should buy and I was torn between the IPad and the Kindle Fire so when the 8.9 made its way onto the scene and I saw the reviews...I was sold.  I have NOT been disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: Ipad move over, your beat on price and quality.
Reviews.Author: Brent P. Mayeux
Reviews.Content: Recently received my Kindle HD and love everything about it. The display is amazing. It is just the right size, and the price was unbeatable. The ability to put my music, movies, etc, without going through another program service like itunes is fantastic. My wife has an Ipad 2 and wants to sell it to get herself a Kindle. Combined with Amazon Prime, it is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: If you're still shopping around for a HD tablet, just do yourself a favor, and buy this one now...
Reviews.Author: John A Waterbury
Reviews.Content: ...and let me tell you why.Not only do you get a well made, highly capable, HD tablet, you also get the world of Amazon support and services with it.The controls, subscriptions, and other services available just from "Your Account" for the Kindle, makes it easy for parents to ensure acceptable access to content, regardless of age.May I also suggest signing up for Amazon Prime, it provides so many free movies, books, benefits, and perks for the low cost of a membership, it will make your Kindle Fire HD into something you won't want to put down.

Reviews.Title: Kindle HD 8.9 Lite
Reviews.Author: Jan Barke'
Reviews.Content: Excellent! Kindle 8.9 Lite is unbelievable!! It was a gift for my daughter, Brittany for Christmas! It is even better then the iPad! She has friends with the iPad & her Kindle exceeds the quality & the performance of the iPad!!Thank you Amazon!!

Reviews.Title: Short and Sweet
Reviews.Author: Rhonda Mulkey
Reviews.Content: I could ramble on and on but you really just want to know if I like it or not. I love this product, I have the original Kindle Keypad and now a Kindle Fire. If you are really looking at this product and are trying to make a decision if to buy it or not, I would say 100% buy it! Its top quality, runs great, speakers are fantastic, high speed and fun. Every device runs through some company or other, this one runs on Amazon blood, so you buy your apps (and there are many) from Amazon. I Like the fact that you have Amazon Cloud so I can buy books, albums, apps, whatever and delete them and they stay in the Cloud.Any way. that's my 2 cents. I love it.

Reviews.Title: love it love it loveit
Reviews.Author: T. Engle "toni"
Reviews.Content: I really liked my original Kindle but this one goes so far beyond it in capabilities- I had to adapt to the touch screen but that was easy too even for an old lady --I'm 65 soon--so don't be afraid to try it

Reviews.Title: This is my second Kindle purchase and I love it!
Reviews.Author: weedqueen1
Reviews.Content: My husband kept asking me if I wanted the new Kindle Fire and I kept saying that I was quite happy with my original Kindle keyboard. Then I happened to be talking with a couple of the girls that I work with, they each had Kindle Fires and raved about them. Then the one girl said that she was getting a new one because she wanted the HD and I thought that was a waste of money because she already had a Fire. Well; long story short, the other girl brought her Kindle HD in for me to see. I was hooked and ordered mine within days. I love both of my Kindles. Originally I thought that I would sell my old Kindle when I got the new one but I use them both daily! My husband thinks I am a bit nuts to have two or three books and 5 or 6 games with friends going at the same time but I love it!

Reviews.Title: better than expected
Reviews.Author: Bipfog2
Reviews.Content: I have two kindle fires already so I knew the operating system would be good .I got this for the bigger HD screen and absolutely love it. I travel all the time and I use Netflix on it for my tv and it does excellent. better sound quality as well.

Reviews.Title: awesome! love  my kindle fire.
Reviews.Author: Peggy Smith
Reviews.Content: Never realized how much I would use it. I love the clarity, the size of the key board and the helpful words scrolling across the screen that make writing so easy without mistakes. I can take it everywhere with me, it fits right in my handbag.  Most restaurants I eat at have WiFi so getting my emails that are so important to me I can do while I eat.  The most important thing to me was how complicated would it be for me to use? I have to say at 66 I even impressed myself it is simple to use. Good weight and handling,love it.

Reviews.Title: What would I do without it?
Reviews.Author: Mimi
Reviews.Content: I am legally blind and this (along with my other two kindles) is truly a gift.I take it everywhere.  The screen is clear and I am capable of seeing the wordswith my glasses.  Thank you.

Reviews.Title: after 2 days
Reviews.Author: flatline
Reviews.Content: Writing this from my 8.9 I got Friday. Upgraded from a first gen fire. I love it. Had a little trouble getting flash up and running but got it done. Love the hd movies and tv. App selection is kinda small but can be augmented. Don't know what else to say except that I am one happy camper. If you have problems getting flash let me know, and I will help out. 2/9/13.

Reviews.Title: Review
Reviews.Author: terryfburk
Reviews.Content: It arrived as expected, on time and as described. Already used this and it works perfectly. It is a great product for the price. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: This is absolutely great.
Reviews.Author: Sheila
Reviews.Content: I had bought a Nook and used it for a short time. I had a problem with it from the moment it arrived in the mail. Nook would not replace it and wanted to charge me 68.99 shipping charge to return it, even though I said it did not come without problems.I decided to spend the money to buy an Amazon instead. I absolutely love it. I can sit for hours reading a book, or playing games, or just reading up on how to use the Amazon. As for the games, and books, it seems as if I am always getting a book for free. They give out points each time I buy something and they add up and when I buy a game they discount them and I end up getting them for free....The service is great. If I have a problem I call and get the most knowledgable and respectful service on the other end. Bear in mind that I am a Senior and was not brought up with all of these systems. I do not find it hard to use, the instructions that are contained withing the Kindle are easy to follow and if I have a problem, a phone call to Amazon helps me immediately.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Last year I purchased the original Kindle Fire and I was disappointed.  The processor was slow, typing was awkward, and the screen was too small for web surfing.  I ended up returning it.  This new 8.9 kindle is nothing like the original.  The screen is more responsive, web surfing feels natural, and it's the perfect size for everything.  The email account that is preloaded is excellent.  I love that it pulls up all of your folders including my junk mail, something that a lot of email apps don't do.  The calendar is great because it links right up with my Gmail calendar.  The free time is awesome.  Our kids love using it and it gives me peace of mind knowing they can't purchase anything, change any settings, or access the web.  The web browser needs to be improved but it's still a very good browser that does everything I need.Overall an excellent product.  I need to get the 7 inch for our kids because they always have mine.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Tablet.
Reviews.Author: cachingmom
Reviews.Content: I really love this tablet.  Our family has several Kindle Keyboards, the original Kindle FIre and now the Kindle HD.  It's been easy to use.  I love being able to put photos on it.  I love the camera.  The only thing I wish it had was maybe a sd storage slot.  That would make putting info on it a little easier and would give it more storage options.  Other then that  I love it!!!!!  Its the best Kindle Amazon has come up with and it was a lot cheaper then an Ipad.

Reviews.Title: Screen flickering on Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Bought the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" for our Dad. We've barely used this a month and one day the screen started flickering like an old TV with rabbit ears. Once this happens, the only way to make it stop is to hold down the power button longer than 20 seconds. If this continues to happen, we will be returning the Kindle. After numerous Google searches, saw that other people were having the same issue.  Hopefully, Kindle will fix this problem.

Reviews.Title: love love love
Reviews.Author: Doxie
Reviews.Content: this lil thing is amazing ..to be honest i kinda like it better than my apple Ipad ....picture quality is much better ! size is great & seems pretty simple to use . I truly can't believe the picture quality. My husband is addicted to it !!

Reviews.Title: Worth the wait, and the import
Reviews.Author: BAMinShanghai
Reviews.Content: I received the new Kindle Fire for Christmas and have been really enjoying what Amazon has released.  The new Kindle Fire competes with many of the new tablet devices on the market today.  I had my parents purchase the Fire for me, and then they shipped to me.  I live in Shanghai.  The package was held by customs, and I was required to pay an import tax of 10%  of the total value (30USD=195RMB).  It was worth it.PROS:The numerous forums and discussion post that can be found about the Kindle make using it a breeze.  AS others have stated, using the kindle as is does have its limitations (movies must be converted to MP4 in order to be played on the Kindle My Video Player) but a minor problem quickly solved with the download of a free third party app, EZ File Explorer.  With this you can add multiple third party apps that run on the Android iOS.Excellent video quality.  When buying a video through Amazon you are given a choice of quality to download.  Lower quality = quicker download time.Speakers.  Fantastic sound quality from the new Fire.  I ran FUN Some Nights at full volume against my friends iPad 2.  Sound was clear, with no distortion, and noticeably louder than the iPad.Prime Members have access to a vast selection of Movies and TV Shows to stream, and access to an extensive lender library for eBooks.Office Suite Professional 6.  Upon starting my Kindle Fire for the first time, and after initial setup I began exploring and working things out for myself.  I opened the Office Suite 6 app for the first time and was asked if I wished to upgrade to professional.  It was free.  I now have the ability to Open, Edit, Save, and Create Word Documents, Excel Spreadsheets, and PowerPoint presentations.  A wonderful application that helps the Kindle compete with many of the other tablets on the market today.Screen Resolution.  Having subscribed to my favorite magazines I was stunned by the excellent picture quality.  While reading with the Kindle held in portrait mode results in a block of empty black space at the bottom, it does not interrupt reading.  Works well in landscape mode as well.Reading.  While reading, you can change between a white background with black letters, a black background with white letters, or the sepia background with black letters.  While personally have not, do think I will be reading white letters on a black background, the options are nice help to meet a variety of preferences.Keyboard.  The touch keyboard is quick to respond and easy to navigate.  Letters, Numbers, and Symbols are well organized and easy to find and use.  While typing very quickly can result in a brief lag time, it is the same lag I experience with my iPhone 4.Cloud Storage.  The inclusion of Cloud Storage is a great addition to the Kindle, and greatly increases your storage space.  There is plenty of space for a nice collection of movies, music, and books for any Kindle Holder.Bluetooth Capabilities.  I purchased a Bluetooth keyboard to use with the Kindle as well.  It is a wonderful addition turning my kindle into a portable net book.  It beats having to carry 17" HP Laptop to the office every morning that is for sure.Ads.  Not as bothersome as I thought they would be.  The lock screen will feature and ad.  Slide to the right to learn more, slide to the left to unlock.  If it is not an ad, it is just a random picture of a book or colorscape.  Not at all bothersome, and I would not spend $15 to rid the Fire of Ads and instead use that $15 to purchase an Italo Calvino novel from the Kindle Store.CONS:No VPN.  One con, which others may not find as bothersome as I do, is that currently there is no working VPN for the Kindle Fire that I know of.  I currently run Astril on my home computer, but they have yet to release an app for the current version of the Android iOS the Fire runs.  The only working VPN is one that requires Cisco systems corporate servers.  A VPN should not be a make or break point for those considering the Fire.  I live in Shanghai, and the Great Firewall of China is bothersome, blocking not only Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, and other social media sites, but also randomly blocking sites for unknown reasons; marthastewart.com, punchfork.com.  I do hope that either Amazon or a third party can get a working VPN out soon.No wall charger.  Out of the box you will get your Kindle and the new black mini USB cable.  The fast charger is available, for $19.99.  This is slightly bothersome as I need to keep my Fire plugged into my computer to charge.  Also, I am warned that my Fire may not charge while in use.OVERALL:All in all, I am loving my new Fire.  In less than a week of use I am pleased with the new Fire and see.  I have it with me everywhere I go.  It is a fantastic release from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Fire is a winner!
Reviews.Author: D. GORR
Reviews.Content: I got an earlier-generation Kindle Fire when they were first introduced. After that one was stolen, I stepped up to the 8.9" Fire. My primary reason for having this tablet is to consume media. I don't think you could ask for a better tool in that regard. The screen is big, ultra-sharp, and beautiful. My first-generation Fire had rather sluggish touch response, but this one seems to have corrected that problem. The Amazon library of TV shows and movies is extensive, and when you pair a Kindle Fire with an Amazon Prime subscription, you even have a very nice selection of content that costs you nothing to view. Web browsing is quick and easy. Although the number of apps is limited (this is a custom-tweaked Android device), the set that is provided is good and more than meets my needs.I'm a happy camper.

Reviews.Title: Gift
Reviews.Author: Princess
Reviews.Content: Gift for 92 year old Mom.  A great pass time for her and she loves it.  The good variety of free  games and books plus inexpensive ones that you can purchase.  All around great gift for any age.

Reviews.Title: I'm so jealous right now!
Reviews.Author: Janice Broderick
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my 13 yo son.  I have to say, I love it!  The size is great, the resolution spectacular, and it has so many amazing capabilities.  I almost bought an iPad mini, but when I compared the two and added Prime to the mix, there is no comparison.  The Kindle Fire is a great product and the packaging was beautiful.  I couldn't have thought of a better gift.  Now, I'm jealous and can't wait to get one for myself!

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: Everything works great right out of the box. This is my first tablet so I had a little learning curve to get started but progressing without any problems. Haven't done any streaming yet. Waiting untill I join prime to try that.It connects to wi-fi quickly ,boots up fast, and surfs the internet great.  I don't know what could be any better.Larry

Reviews.Title: media magic
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey C. Joseph
Reviews.Content: I am not a big gamer or apps dude. I am into movies, music and books. Given this, there is no tablet better. the movie display rivals my wife's IPAD 3 while the sound beats the Ipad and Samsung by leaps (my brother has a Samsung). the book reading experience is also terrific. If you are into lots of games and are an apps freak then, I have to be fair the IPad and the Google devices are better. so it all comes down to what you want your tablet to do. The Kindle does, for its price, deliver media magic to me. let me end by saying this, no tablet, not even the all holy, all wise Ipad, is in a position to replace a laptop..yet. So when purchasing a tablet and you are tempted to spend ridiculous amounts of money remember it's still not a laptop. one other thing. i didn't pay the $15 to remove the ads. i knew then what I still know now. it's not a big thing to me. I only see the ads when the tablet is locked. why am I going to fret over what's displayed on my screen when I am NOT using the Kindle?

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: author
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful upgrade to the basic Kindle. My son really enjoys playing games on this in addition to reading books.

Reviews.Title: Good product that could have been better
Reviews.Author: Vaughn "I'm a casual gamer, and music and mov...
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 16GB for christmas as a gift for my family (2 adults and 2 kids). I also own an original fire that I got last year for myself. I have mixed feelings on the new HD fire tablets. First I'll briefly go over how I use my kindle, then the good and the bad stuff. So far I think it's definitely a step up from the previous generation and worth the purchase though. I do have a few gripes.I use my fire to do quick internet checks as it starts up much faster than a computer. I have a few eBooks and a LOT of audio books. Since our family has Amazon Prime and Netflix accounts I can also watch video on it when convenient. Finally, I surprisingly enjoy gaming on the tablet. I have a few gaming systems and with excellent games like Rayman Jungle Run, Cut the Rope, and Stupid Zombies 2,to name a few, I probably play games on the kindle more than on my PSP.So whats better? The new Kindles have an app called Free Time which finally gives parental control options for the device. And you can opt into the Free Time Unlimited service which is basically like Netflix for children's programming. This includes apps, videos and over 1,000 books. It's good but not perfect. I can micro-manage and designate how much time the kids can spend playing games versus reading for example. Or I can simply give them 2hrs per day and they can do what ever they choose. But I can't give them a different time allowance for weekends which is not cool. I'd like to, for example, have the option to maybe give them 2 hrs on school days and 5hrs on the weekends. Another shortcoming is that there is no way that a kid can log out of their account without a parent entering the password. This probably isn't an issue if the kid is the sole user of the tablet but I have 2 kids sharing so when they need to switch I have to log them out every time. It would have made more sense to let them log out to the profile selection screen and require a password only if backing out of that space. This wouldn't work for 5 year olds but at least allow this option for older kids who can have passwords. On the positive side, the parental feature disables ads and in-game purchasing in the child accounts. Unfortunately you still can't have more than 1 adult account though.Another new feature than I really enjoy is the immersive reading. If I have the eBook and audio book for select titles I can sync them. So I can look at the eBook text which highlights words in real time as the audio book plays. Or I can listen to my book during my commute and then read the ebook at home and the ebook will sync up to where the audio book left off. Thats very cool. The speaker sound is also much improved.The new models also have more storage. The screen also looks really good though I admit it doesn't really make that much of a difference for streaming video. It also had an HDMI port, but it's micro HDMI so you'll have to get the cable as it's unlikely you own one. On the up side it now has physical volume buttons. The virtual volume controls still exist. On the down side, the new models don't come with chargers included anymore and it seems to take much longer to charge than before. They can be purchased though.  Thats about all I can say. It does have a few more tricks like  wireless options and wifi, bluetooth for access external keyboards, and skype capabilities if you have the model with the built in camera. You can also take pics but since there is only the front facing camera it might be a bit awkward for taking pics of anything but yourself. And there are also new apps like the mail client, but since I share my tablet and you can't have more than one adult account I am unlikely to use it. Also I miss seeing the glowing power button or the charging battery animation when my old kindle charges. The new one doesn't seem to have it.One odd thing to mention is that the partially subsidized models (which is probably what you'll get if you buy from a physical store - Amazon calls it "special offers" on their site) have ads on the screen saver. You buy it a few bucks cheaper but you see the adds. If that bothers you, you can still pay the difference (one time fee - just a few dollars) to not see them though.Overall I like it. If you own a 1st gen and the new features don't appeal to you then stick with the first gen. Otherwise I think its a good buy. Hopefully this helped someone. :)

Reviews.Title: Better then I expected!
Reviews.Author: Paula Chapman
Reviews.Content: This has been such a dream come true and so much less expensive then a ipad. It has the camera, you can do video, take pictures, even skype with it. The pictures and video are wonderful. The screen is truly high defination. Those on comcast can put the comcast app on it from Imobile..and control what to watch, you can record from the DVR..you can even change channels from the Kindle fire. TV Shows are amazing with the high def screen.  The memory is amazing. Tons of room for apps, music, books..you name it.It does text to speech,surf the web.. the deal of ATT for 39.95 is perfect for me. When I am out and need to pull up a map of where I need to go, it is perfect. WiFi is almost everywhere...so the deal works wonderfully on the inbetween places where there is not wifi. If you need a comparable device to the IPAD and can not afford it.. this is so wonderful. Another plus.. Amazong gives one APP a day (full version) free. I am very pleased with this one! Very well worth the money you pay for it!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9" Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 16 GB - Includes
Reviews.Author: Sandra Gayle Ogilvie
Reviews.Content: LOVE IT !!!! To me its as good as having one of those expensive ipads. Couldn't be any better and so glad I decided on it.

Reviews.Title: 3RD Kindle
Reviews.Author: Betty Montgomery
Reviews.Content: I was given the Kindle Keyboard as a gift from my Husband..Loved it ..Then he gave me the Kindle Fire ( he liked the keyboard)AND THEN out comes the KINDLE FIRE HD 8.9 You guessed it, HE BOUGHT IT FOR ME>>> (he really liked the Kindle fire) haha So now I am really enjoying my new Kindle HD 8.9  I would like to hang on to it. So dont hurry to put out another one right away! My 6 year old granddaughter really wants mine. But I am keeping it. Also got 21 year old Granddaughter one....

Reviews.Title: I LOVE THE NEW KINDLE
Reviews.Author: Desiree Churbe
Reviews.Content: I DO LOVE THE PRICE AND NOW A BIGGER SCREEN, I APPLAUD AMAZON!!!A big Thank You from TEXAS State

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: Denise Johnson
Reviews.Content: great product - easy to use - fast shipping exceded my expectations ! Would reccommend to all of my friends

Reviews.Title: Great!!!
Reviews.Author: J.B.Vesely
Reviews.Content: I purchased this in order to read books, but also to use the web, etc.I have not had any problems with this Kindle Fire HD, not even setting up the 4G with AT&T.;Any questions that I have had, I either read the user guide or asked on "chat" my question.  I'm very pleased with this purchase.Also, This product is on the same level ( from my point of view) as the apple IPad, if not better.The apps was easy to purchase and like magic the items appeared on the screen.I'm very glad that both wi-fi and 4g was offered, since I think when your lights go off due to storms and no wi-fi connections, I can use the 4g to connect to the web and the local tv station to fid out the status of the storm.

Reviews.Title: happy happy
Reviews.Author: redgirl
Reviews.Content: bought for husband for xmas and I bought the smaller one; love it,,, hard to put down,,love amazon..good deals ck it out

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Alyson K. Magowan
Reviews.Content: I love my KINDLE Fire HD 8.9...its everything i hoped it would be.  I recommend it highly.....battery is great too :)

Reviews.Title: My latest Kindle
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Jane Kaufmann"
Reviews.Content: So far I love it.  The battery lastslonger then my previous 2 Kindles.  The color is great. It is easy to use. I do have two small disappointments.  The fact that there were ads on the home screen and it costs more not to have ads.  Also I didn't like that I had to buy an app to use the phone on this Kindle.

Reviews.Title: superb
Reviews.Author: kiran desai
Reviews.Content: I just love this kindle as is as good as an ipad if not better. It does everything that i would want it to do and more. It has a brilliant display and real beautiful sound.

Reviews.Title: Great Amazon Product!
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle!The HD screen is very very crisp! Love it!The convenience of the prime benefits with the device make it totally worth it!There are a few "drawbacks" to make you aware of for me even though it doesn't make me regret my purchase one bit...it's a little heavier than I expected.when opening different apps or even browsing the web, it might become glitchy. Don't get this if you want an internet browser...this device is more meant for amazon content of books and videos and shopping..ect.being limited by the amazon app store is a little disappointing. theres a way to "root"/jailbreak it, but I have not done that because it's not so easy (fyi)but, i do love the device!free book rentals and video streaming with prime membership makes it AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: great item
Reviews.Author: Russ T
Reviews.Content: I have had a blast using my new kindle, it does much more that I had imagined. Love using it with my Amazon prime and watching movies, playing games and reading books

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd 4G
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet.Data plan much cheaper than the Ipad data plan.I will be carrying this everyday and leave my Ipad at home.Real fast when surfing the net.Love reading books on it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Cindy Mae
Reviews.Content: The kindle fire HD 8.9", is my 3rd Kindle, and I love it.  The picture quality is great, it's very user friendly. The sound system is great.  I would recommend this to anyone who likes to read, play games and watch videos.  I am not a real big internet surfer. So this Kindle has everything that I need.  I take it everywhere with me.

Reviews.Title: Awesome sound and color.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is my third Kindle.  I like to read - a lot.  This Kindle Fire H D 8.9" is so much fun.  The colors are vibrant and the Dolby sound has the other guys green with envy.  Although I had the Kindle Fire, I never really learned about the features.  Now with the H D Fire, I am learning how to download music, listen to the audiobook feature, watch videos, and now taking pictures.  As much as I enjoy this new Kindle Fire H D 8.9, I am so disappointed with the camera feature, I could cry.  With such lovely, vibrant colors, pictures of the ceiling fan was not my plan.  Nor was I excited about a picture of my nose as I tried to take pictures of my poodles.  I truly appreciate Amazon's customer service.  The Kindle product has changed my life in several ways.  The camera may be a deal breaker, however.

Reviews.Title: Good fit for most needs
Reviews.Author: Elliot
Reviews.Content: This is my second tablet replacing a Motorola Xoom  that was lost. In choosing a new one I considered what I actually wound up using my old tablet for. That turned out to be primarily as reading tablet using the Kindle app, light web surfing and social networking while watching TV or traveling and as a music streaming device. Although I have my Android smart phone loaded with apps I used relatively few on my old tablet. The Kindle seemed a good fit for the price essentially splitting the difference between a reader and a tablet. I chose the WIFI version because I didn't want another charge from my wireless company and found with my old tablet that I could usually find access to a WIFI connection when I wanted to use it. To get the most use out of it one does have to commit to a content relationship with Amazon but there is no fees or contract; just pay as you go. If you already buy your content on Amazon it's really no change. It's cheaper and more flexible than being joined at the hip with Apple ITunes etc.Pros:* The HD Screen has beautiful resolution and streams video nicely.* The lightweight .5 device is a manageable size that has enough real estate to read,  view video, or view photos while still light and comfortable in the hands.* Works well as a Reader, Web surfing and Email as well as social networking and of course shopping on Amazon.Cons:* The User interface is kind of tacky and commercial reminding you constantly that you are connected to Amazon.* App availability is and will be low* Like most tablets it is awkward to view and manage documents.All in all a good fit for me and I suspect many usersUpdate 1/29/2013: I have lived with and traveled with the device and am still reasonably happy with my choice.Pros:* Performs well, no crashes so far.* Ease  in accessing content is excellent* Great for streaming videoCons* The Carousel Home screen interface is REALLY REALLY ANNOYING. Every one I know with a Kindle hates it. It quickly clutters the home screen with an icon for every book, app or website you have visited even once. It cannot be turned off and individual icons have to be removed one at a time; a very tedious process. This is a user unfriendly coercive feature that I hope Amazon will get rid of and soon. It sucks the joy out an otherwise pleasant device.The user blogs are chock full of others who feel the same way but I ahve yet to find a satisfactory remedy if there is one.* The power an volume contact switches are poorly marked, difficult to see/find, and have such a shallow detent that they can be deployed inadvertently. A latched power switch would be much better.So  all in all I am still happy with my choice especially at the price. If Amazon would get rid of that godawful Carousel feature it would be a solid win.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: L. Belasco "belascol"
Reviews.Content: I just got it, and I haven't tried out everything that I can do with it yet.  I love the bigger screen than the original Kindle Fire, and I love that Amazon is giving us more options with movies--renting as opposed to buying.  But so far all my books, movies, newspapers and magazines are all coming through fine--great picture quality, and I can adjust the print for my books so that I don't need my drug store glasses.  I may review again--but for now 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE MY KINDLE
Reviews.Author: b
Reviews.Content: I LOVE IT! The HD is awesome and I can play all types of games and the color is amazing. The only down side is that about four times a day it freezes and I have to turn it off. The battery lasts all day (I'm sure it would last longer if I wasn't on it all day long) but it is awesome. It is my first tablet and I wouldn't trade it for anything.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Lena Grey
Reviews.Content: I'm still learning to use my Fire, but so far I like it a lot. It's definitely worth the money. Thanks Kindle!

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Tina
Reviews.Content: Was very excited to get my new Fire. Love the larger screen size. Video is very crisp and clear. Sound is good. Haven't had lots of time to play with it yet, but so far it is everything I've come to expect from Amazon and Kindle. It is a little heavier, which was expected because it is bigger and the case I bought with it adds a little weight. Adding my email account was a snap and it linked me with my Facebook account as part of the registration process.... however, I can't seem to find the Facebook app now. Don't know if I inadvertedly deleted it or what, but it seems to have disappeared. Has anyone else had this problem?

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 8.9" HD is all it is advertised to be!!!
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: The Fire 8.9" HD is everything I hoped it would be and more.  Picture quality is excellent and sound quality is very good, considering the size of the speakers. Surfing the web is very fast.  All in all, a great return for the money.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: The Pros:Amazon Prime Instant Videos - awesomeExtremely sharp picture. I did a side-by-side comparison with my Samsung Galaxy Tab. I froze the pictures in the same spot while streaming. The Kindle HD won hands down.The build is very solid, however this Pro comes with a caveat (see below).The software, with one exception (see below) is very solid-responsive and quick.The sound quality through the on-board speakers or through headphones is quite good. The Cons:It boots up slowly.It is too heavy, in my opinion, in relationship to it's size. It has a smaller footprint than the Tab or the iPad, but weighs more (the caveat mentioned in Pros).Buttons are too small, poorly placed, and unresponsive, in my opinion.The software issue I mentioned in Pros was the email app. I use Gmail and the interface presented in the mail app is lacking in functionality and lacks the simplicity Gmail usually presents.It takes a LONG time to recharge, even plugged in to the wallNo access to the Play Store. I realize it's a closed system but it is too closed. Apps I use often that I am unable to access on the Kindle include:DropBox, Directv, Delta, an actual Gmail app, Google drive, Logitech Alert, American Express, and Scrabble. Summary:A well built, albeit heavier machine. As mentioned, the picture, sound and content purchase options are great. The buttons need work, the apps need work, the closed system needs work. If you are looking for a device to mostly consume items from the Amazon storefront(s)and do not mind some functionality trade offs, this device will work for you.

Reviews.Title: Mostly good, room for improvement and all about usage
Reviews.Author: Caveat Emptor
Reviews.Content: Kindle's HD 8.9 is a product I had waited for since before it was even a rumor.  On balance its actual performance should please some, displease some and mostly be found a welcome addition for those whose digital world is centered in the Amazon eco-system.  It all rather depends on what you are looking for--- even within the Amazon system.  As an owner of the iPad's every generation, a couple of iterations of various android tablets, iPods/iPhones and the odd e-reader, including the original kindle, I believe I have a better grasp than many on the real world factors which judge success and failure in such devices generally.Without trying to reinvent the wheel in this review or go too far afield in measurements and techno-speak, I feel a select group of factors are to the point particularly with this specific item and I will confine comments to those, so that a concise and understandable comparison with not only choices of other devices, but most importantly the unique and singular needs this one fulfills best.Specific factors: size, screen quality, form factor, durability, flexibility, value (cost/what you get) and continued satisfaction in longterm.This version of the Kindle has a number of capabilities: as a limited personal computing device for web-surfing, document handling and light office duty, as an ebook reader, streaming media player, etc., but not to get into the weeds of such a shopping list I will jump to the end and simply state that what it is or should be seen as is as a media player which occasionally is used for some of these other  tasks.  A laptop, even a lightweight and inexpensive ultra-book is going to do office jobs and web-surfing better, a couple of tablets, most notably the Nexus and the iPad are more flexible and higher powered for running apps, with greater libraries of apps to draw on even.  A smartphone is lighter and more portable.  However--beginning with a screen that is absolutely comparable with the deservedly touted retina display, a nimble combination of hardware components that make for stellar responsiveness-- especially for those persons within the Amazon Prime family, this tablet leaves all others in the dust for the breadth of high quality media (movies predominantly) delivered.As a streaming media device the amount of storage is of relatively minor impact as what is left of the baseline 16 gigs should absolutely be more than enough for a few apps, pictures, a moderately robust collection of audio books, books and music (think of this device as the equivalent of your everyday carry bag or commuter backpack for your media).  Since you are streaming your movie content from Amazon and have an infinite storage space for your Amazon content: books, audio books and music; you really shouldn't be storing much on it.If you are more about a purse or a briefcase or if what you are predominantly doing is reading ebooks then you need to look to the 7" little brother with its lower price, as the greater real estate of the 8.9 inch doesn't do for you or doesn't appreciably add, respectively.  Similarly, if your primary thrust is for your children, since it is easier in smaller hands and comes with all of the same services, the smaller/less expensive version is your sweet spot.It feels solid and sturdy, much more so than a number of similarly sized android tablets.  It has a nicely finished surface for gripping and has an edge to edge glass screen which is scratch resistant and tolerably low in reflective glare.  Though some reports have contested the claim of its speedy wifi connectivity, for streaming video it is second to none and flawless with no discernible stuttering, freezing or hiccuping for buffering.  The pricey, optional Amazon tablet cover/case preserves all the physical aspects of the tablet including its svelte lines, further extending its durability without turning it into a giant plastic brick.Finally, while including most every nicety you find on other tablets bluetooth, hdmi out, support for Exchange based corporate email, Skype and social media integration--- it adds a few of its own, Amazon specific extras like Read to me, Whispersync, integration into the Amazon shopping experience including product suggestions etc, the new X-ray function for most consumable content, a huge lending library of free books and a gigantic and heavily discounted textbook rental library-- making overall value untouchable (again for those in the Amazon system) by any of its tablet competitors.The single, largest deficit is the battery life.  While an improvement on the earlier version of the Fire, the 10 hour claim is pure marketing fantasy.  One of the real pluses, its thinness, doesn't leave enough room for a sufficiently sized battery. The real world battery usage will run between 6-71/2 hours depending on screen brightness being set anywhere from 50-100%.  While minimally acceptable, in the age of similar devices running in excess of 10 hours, this is far from ideal. On the flip side of that, with the speedy charger (which should be free, but isn't) the recharge time from near 0 to fully charged is considerably under the 5 hours they promise---taking roughly 3 1/2 hours or around 2 1/2 hours for 80%.The single biggest asset of the device is Amazon, itself.  Its track record, its overall services, but most of all its customer service--which in my considered opinion is not only light years ahead of its nearest rival, Apple, but in a consumer world of deception, built in obsolescence and recorded telephone loops...the closest thing to absolute perfection any of us will ever see from a business.  For this alone you may bank on the long term reliability and value of your purchase.Final thoughts:  I underscore that this is a media streaming device, if your primary thrust is something else, look elsewhere (though as an affordable electronic babysitter or a way of cutting textbook costs it may likewise prove the singular touchstone for those strongly of those needs).  The 4G LTE option is potentially a killer for Amazon, but not as it exists now.  Until Amazon can work out a deal with a cellular provider based upon the muscle of their client base so that an unlimited or at least a very large allotment per month (5-10 gigs) for a reasonable, flat yearly charge, it is all but useless.  For a media streaming device, what does the present allotment buy you in terms of streaming--1/2 of one movie?  Why would you pay double for the LTE version, essentially so you could do email and download that book which you JUST can't put off another 15 minutes until you reach home, office, Starbucks or the train? I don't think so!!If there were a percentage rating possible I would have given something in the mid to upper 80s, even with the very disappointing battery life, but with stars it has to be 4 until that one problem is substantially solved.  On balance, I love this device.

Reviews.Title: WOW!!!
Reviews.Author: V. Woyak
Reviews.Content: I am a first time ereader/tablet owner.  All I can say is, WOW! Oh, and now what do I do with my almost new laptop that is now going to collect a LOT of dust!!!  The Kindle's screen is so sharp and clear it's just amazing!!!  2 complaints however.  first, this is going to cost me some money because I want EVERYTHING it can do and all the books!!!!  Many of the coolest apps are free!!!  I love the "toys" on it as well, like the autoharp and piano. My only serious complaint is the inability to upgrade the flash player so I can play my favorite FB game on my Kindle.  I know this is not Kindle's fault, but am wondering what this will mean down the road since Flash player is no longer supporting the android format. Not seriously concerned however because I am sure someone will quickly come up with a fix, they always do :)Overall, any one considering the Kindle Fire Hd 8.9, WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR???

Reviews.Title: ATT service does not activate
Reviews.Author: caroline a strachan
Reviews.Content: I had to go to 3 different wifi locations to activate the Kindle but the ATT service never activated. I called Amazon twice and they said call ATT. So I called ATT and they said call Amazon. I have been bounced back and forth but no one can help me. I spent $500. for something that does not work.

Reviews.Title: Not a smart purchase
Reviews.Author: ChadK
Reviews.Content: Had a terriable experience.First problem. It is loaded with intrusive adds to include the lock screen. There's an option to pay $15 to remove adds. That's only for the lock screen there are still all over once you get past lock screen.Second problem.You can't customize anything. Lock screen back ground, nothing. Even if you pay to remove the adds.Third problem.It's slow and doesn't play a lot of videos on websites such as ABC or NBC for shows like SNL.Fourth problem.It wouldn't charge past 80 percent when it would charge. I had to send it back and told them to keep it.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle
Reviews.Author: sandy
Reviews.Content: I suffered  a broken neck and have problems with processing and comprehension.  It has affected my ability to use the computer upstairs because of walking, my laptop is too bulky and the Kindle is just right.  I need to spend more time learning how to use it properly though.  Since retiring from teaching 12 years ago, I have not kept up on the latest technology so the first 6 year old I could find gave me a crash course on how to use my new Kindle.  I'm still learning and know many adventures await me with my Kindle as my guide.

Reviews.Title: I continue to be in awe over your service.
Reviews.Author: A. Berry
Reviews.Content: Never have I gotten less than extra special service from Amazon.  At Christmas when my order of 2 Kindles wasn't delivered, a replacement was sent at once.  Last week, my Kindle wasn't charging and immediately the rep said a new one was on the way.  This is before the broken Kindle was was shipped back.  Awesome.  Most companies want the other broken one in hand before sending a new one.  When I call for service, the phone rings at once and a live person talks to me.  I use Amazon for publishing as well and enjoy the same stellar service.  I go out of my way to buy from Amazon, I am so pleased with the service.

Reviews.Title: Initial Thoughts
Reviews.Author: tunafish
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Nexus 7 but exchanged it for the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 at my local Office store. The reason is that I found the 7 inch screen to small to comfortably watch movies or do much of anything else. Also, the Nexus 7 had terrible wifi reception for me. I would need to stay within about 30 feet of my router to get at least two bars out of four. And forget about getting any reception once I walked out the front door. The Kindle Fire has been much better. Whereas I was not getting any reception bars just outside my front door with the Nexus 7, I am still getting 3 bars out of four with the Kindle Fire 8.9. I am finding that no matter where I go in my home, I am able to get a good reception. Also, the extra two inches and increased resolution of the Kindle Fire makes a world of difference. I talked myself into thinking that a pure version of android, which the Nexus 7 had, would be great. But I found I only need or would use maybe 30 or so apps. So why on Earth would I need over 700,000 apps, or even have the time to look at that many apps? The only negative I have with the Kindle Fire 8.9 is that just like other tablets, it is hard to use  in sunlight with all the glare. Otherwise, I think it is a very good value.

Reviews.Title: A stable platform for what you need.
Reviews.Author: Charles Ballard "I'll get a better sig when I...
Reviews.Content: Friends,  I am a courier and I got the AKFHD primarily so I could access my company's server for data entry while working.  I ordered it on Friday morning around 7a.m. central time, and requested next day delivery.  Sure enough, it was delivered before noon Saturday.  I immediately signed up for Amazon Prime and ATT 4GLTE service.  I later discovered that you can't access AMAZON PRIME videos from the 4GLTE connection.  Why?  I'd like to know!!!!  You can only access it from the Wi-Fi connection.  Which I CANNOT do when my computer is on (apparently 100% of my ATT DSL speed is good enough to stream Amazon Prime, but 50% is just NOT enough as it kept exiting after about 30 seconds because the vid hadn't started yet.  It wouldn't even BUFFER).  But I have watched vid on it while the computer was off, and it does work fine on my wi-fi connection.  It just needs to be alone.  For the record, I have DSL that is rated at 50X faster than dial-up.  In my area that is the 2nd tier of service, with 2 tiers above it (I believe 75 and 100X faster than dial-up).  The video NEVER exhibited any flaws while I was watching.  I have yet to explore all of the AKFHD's features, but I am enjoying this little black box.  I even found myself "Borrowing" a book from Amazon Prime today.  I have to be honest, I did not think I would be able to read a story that was not on paper, but this has changed my mind.  I won't stop collecting paper books, mind you.  If anything I think they will become much more valuable and desirable in years to come.  But the AKFHD is usable and I will most certainly be borrowing and probably purchasing books digitally.  I hope this review helps someone.  And if I may make a suggestion... if and when you order yours, get the QUICK CHARGER (you'll be glad you did), and get a COVER or CASE as well.  I did not get the case, so now I have to make the big decision.  Decisions, decisions....

Reviews.Title: I LOVE MY KINDLE!!
Reviews.Author: Kate Fredericks "Kate"
Reviews.Content: I have already reviewed the smaller Kindle Fire, so I'm not going to do the two page report like I normally would. Let me just say that one of the reasons I upgraded to the larger tablet is because I want to watch movies on it and not have to watch it on a micro mini screen. The reason I bought the KINDLE as opposed to the Motorola or the Ipad are a bit more involved. I have the Motorola tablet - admittedly an older one - but it was very heavy and it used Windows which meant I had to have a browser - Google or Firefox or whatever. I found it to be sluggish and confusing. Enough said. I refuse to buy into the Apple world simply because they are trying to set themselves up with the snob factor, like - I own a Mercedes Benz, aren't I cool? NO!! You aren't cool when you could have bought TWO really nice Buicks or Hondas for the same price - buy one for yourself and buy one for the poor family in the next, lower class neighborhood who can barely keep their old car running! Oh, I own an Ipad, I paid twice as much as the cool Kindle, but don't I look successful???? NO! You look like somebody who doesn't care that there are people starving and freezing because they can't afford food and oil. Take the extra $300 you paid for the Ipad and donate it to the nearest homeless shelter!OK, I had to get that out of my system because it really is something I do not understand in humanity today. The Kindle - I LOVE the Silk they use. I can move around in my Kindle just as fast as I can in my laptop. I love the book section and spend more than my share of time browsing around. There are a ton of really good FREE books you can get. Plus, unlike the other snobby tablet, you can buy books at other estores, too! Isn't sharing nice? I LOVE the movies. Oh my goodness!! I just got this tablet Tuesday night and luckily, the young lady who took my order had it all set up for me so I just opened it, plugged it in, and there everything was! With the exception of my notepad, which I had to hand type from the old Kindle to the new one. Small issue. Anyway, I plugged in my earphones and flipped into a movie supplier and BOOM!! The sound was outstanding. I cannot tell you how amazing it was. The difference between the sound in this Kindle and the non HD Kindle without Dolby sound is spectacular. I am going to get Titanic out tomorrow JUST for the sound!!! The picture is so clear, honestly is hurt my eyes (I am just too used to blurry pictures, my eyes need to literally adjust to the pure clarity of this larger HD Kindle).So, yes, I LOVE this Kindle. So, why didn't I give it 5 stars? Because, the reason I upgraded from the regular to the tablet HD was that the Keyboard was so wonky, I had trouble ALL THE TIME. I thought it was broken, honestly. But, this one does the same thing. Also? I cannot for the life of me get my email working or Facebook to work. Not a BIG deal since it is fast and easy to get on the web and get there that way, but I just think they could have gotten the glitches OUT of these Kindles by now!!! Those are my two reasons for them losing a star.Another thing I LOVE about the Kindle (in general) is the Carousel. I don't know why it is so easy for me to get around using the Carousel, other than the fact that the things you use most (having Facebook and my email up there would be nice!), books, movies, weather apps, games, magazines, whatever you use most are always right up front on the Carousel when you open it. So convenient! And as for jumping on the web, it's also on a sort of Carousel above the Carousel. In other words, if you want to go to your books section, it is written across the top of the Carousel, along with the movie section, the magazine section, the app section and the web. The web is SO EASY TO USE on Kindle. What I have learned to do is simply leave FB open in a tab (not my email, having had someone TRY to hack it in January), so I go up and hit web and flip open Facebook and voila! There it is! Oh, also, you have the really wonderful Mp3 Amazon Cloud Player which I also LOVE LOVE LOVE!!! Again, not snobby in that you can ONLY by from Amazon, but you can buy from other stores as well (unlike the snobby tablet). I found it easy to use and the sound is spectacular. Again, you can also find some awesome free music there as well.So, yes, I am a Kindle all the way kind of girl. That's my opinion and the fact that this tablet is so thin and light, there is a lot of WOW factors there! One more thing? I want to shout out to the Customer Service Reps at Amazon. Because I am an Amazon junkie, I end up talking to a lot of Customer Service people. Once in a while I get a clunker, but that is rare. I have found most reps to be very helpful. I buy from other sources as well, but hands down, Amazon has the BEST Customer Service that I deal with. So, I HIGHLY recommend, for the money and the experience, getting a Kindle instead of "other" tablets.
