Reviews.Title: Doesn't hold a charge.
Reviews.Author: S. Crumpton
Reviews.Content: It doesn't hold a charge for more than an hour or two. Need to keep it plugged in if watching movies.

Reviews.Title: Great Pad
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: We have several pad at home and this one is as good as any on the market. I use it for books mostly but surfing is good too. Resolution is great and battery life is acceptable. MUCH better than an iPad for the money. All the reviews I read were right, great pad for the money.

Reviews.Title: More than expected!
Reviews.Author: John P. Murphy
Reviews.Content: I have become pretty skeptical over the years so I was pleased when this Kindle turned out to be as great as it is. This is a fabulous product. Internet browsing is a breeze, checking e-mail is as simple as it can be. I joined Prime right away so I had free books, movies, TV, games, apps, everything I could think of immediately at my finger tips. I run a CAD workstation all day and this is a godsend for somebody that does not want to use a computer when they get home. Lightweight, awesome graphics, tons of stuff on it. If my wife doesn't stop borrowing it I may have to buy another one. Really! It's that good.

Reviews.Title: Wish I could give it a 5 star rating
Reviews.Author: jennifer
Reviews.Content: My son got the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 as a Christmas present in 2012. If a few unimaginable, disappointing problems hadn't reared their ugly head just recently I'd give the Kindle a 5-star rating, unfortunately for now, kindle is just mediocre. ;/Let's start it this way... until yesterday I WANTED to <3 the Kindle. I've gotten 3, the Kindle, Kindle Fire HD 8.9 and Kindle Fire HD 7.I was sharing my son's Kindle for reading books until I got my Kindle this month (I have the 7" Kindle Fire HD) I ignored some of the "glitches" thinking I'd take the time to straighten things out once I had my personal Kindle...well no such luck.1) There is no way to keep content from anyone you share an account with, be it a spouse, parent or child. Meaning my horror books are visible to my son, no matter what I do, unless I want to delete my purchased content. I personally like to read and reread books, now I'm forced to waste money and get rid of a book...bummer!! Luckily my son is not a kid to open something that's not his BUT some of the title pages are scary for a young child, so I'm left with only one option. Don't buy, or buy and delete, which still makes the cover photo available while I'm reading the book.2) There is an app for monitoring your children's Kindle activity (Kindle Freetime) but it's a pay for app and the ONLY way to keep adult content, inappropriate content from a child's view. Disappointing! I should be able to block material. This could be a solution to above complaint.3) There is no way to organize your books and apps. For someone who has purchased dozens and dozens of books in 8 months, this is a real pain in the bottom. Considering it's actually available on the earlier and less expensive versions...why leave that option off the Kindle Fire HD? Again, this could be an easy solution to the above frustrating complaints.These are enough for me to be disappointed with the Kindle. I'm considering returning the 2 most recent purchases, and no longer purchasing Kindle eBooks, so that I don't risk my son being exposed to books I'd rather he not see.BTW before anyone comments back the books I'm personally discussing are true crime, mystery, suspense books, nothing crazy, no smut, no triple x, I just don't want my son seeing the cover to Black Dahlia or the likes. My son won't be looking for them but he simply can't AVOID seeing them as they are listed in the cloud ;/There should be a way to organize or remove books from view.Darn Kindle I wanted so badly to like you. Great visual, great sound, fast web...but the MAIN feature you are known for...eBooks...really second class.

Reviews.Title: My Second Kindle
Reviews.Author: Kimyatta Evans
Reviews.Content: I loved my 1st kindle.  After owning it for a few short months I began to have re-charging and timing-out problems.  I put up with it for a few weeks.  Then reached out to Amazon.com who were so nice and replaced it for free within less than a week.  My 2nd kindle is great.  It still times out a bit more than I would like but have not had any of the charging issues I had with my 1st one.  If Amazon.com could resolve the timing-out issue, my kindle would be the best device ever.  I love it more than my smart phone.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 32 GB
Reviews.Author: Tom C
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd one I have ordered. Because the first two were defective. I enjoy the Kindle so much more than the Nexus 7 I had previously and much more than my wife's IPAD 2. But, this 3rd Kindle had a ghost cloud on screen. At first I thought it was a smudge and when it wouldn't wipe off, I knew it was a screen issue. Anyway, it's still better than the others. Don't know if I want to bother returning this one again or say forget it and deal with it. Amazon, immediately replaced the cloud or pixel discolored Kindle the next day.

Reviews.Title: LOVE MY KINDLE FIRE HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: N. Tierney
Reviews.Content: So I had an iPad through work but when changed jobs had to return it.  I decided to get a Kindle Fire instead since I already have a Prime Membership and loved that I could watch a lot of tv shows and movies for free.  I have to say I love this way more than I did the iPad.  My kids have the smaller version and they are so easy to sync (unlike that other program!).  Just press one button and we all can share the apps and books that we want.  The sound is great and the picture is awesome.  The only issue I have is you can't get as many apps as you can through apple...like Candy Crush Saga, I have to use my iPhone to play that :(

Reviews.Title: Keeps getting better
Reviews.Author: CassieH
Reviews.Content: I hesitated about this purchase and since I already owned  the first Kindle Fire there was no rush. When the item went on sale  I decided to gave it a shot and I'm glad I did. I really like the larger screen more than I thought I would. Well worth the price and works as well as my first 2 Kindles. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: I am too thrilled!
Reviews.Author: Kathiega
Reviews.Content: If you love to read and you need a small efficient computer while you travel you will love this Kindle Fire! I would also recommend buying a matching WIFI keyboard and case since it is just great when you need the computer and don't enjoy the touch screen for typing. Ladies, it fits in your purse and you can carry a whole library with you for a few pounds! Make sure you put some books on the Kindle since you do not need wifi to read them but you do if they are on the CLOUD! Amazon is terrific when it comes to giving you free and cheap books!You do not need to be computer literate because Amazon will walk you through everything and they have your back at all times!!!

Reviews.Title: I Like it
Reviews.Author: Allan Alexander
Reviews.Content: I am happy with lt so far. I wish it came with a free usres guide, it cost me to get one online.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 32 GB - Includes Special Offers
Reviews.Author: Christie S.
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this Kindle Fire, and so far, I have few complaints.  This is my third Kindle.  The only reason I bought this latest one is that my first generation Kindle Fire stopped charging (after only having it for 1 year 4 months).  Amazon customer service told me that these units are well known for this issue.When ordering this (via a customer service rep on the phone), I said I wanted a KF without the "special offers".  He said they didn't have any available (?), but I could simply pay $15 to have the ads removed via their website.  Interestingly enough, it arrived WITHOUT the special offers, and it didn't cost me a dime.  Way to go, Amazon!I love the larger screen... the clarity is amazing.  And I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the sound - I don't need to use headphones any more when watching a movie.  I sometimes even have to turn the volume DOWN, it's that good.I don't have the same problem I've seen other reviewers mention... the lagging internet speed.  Mind seems to go lickety split with no trouble.  And yes, the power off/on button at the top is sometimes difficult to find, but I don't think that's anything worth complaining about.The only negative I have (so far) is the battery.  It takes F-O-R-E-V-E-R to recharge it... whether I use the USB cable that came with the unit (and their PowerFast for Accelerated Charging plug), or another similar cable.  My previous KF used to charge in 2-3 hours... now, it often takes 10+ hours to get it charged enough to use it without being attached to a cable.  Seems a tad long, in my humble estimation.The charge also doesn't last very long... I can have the thing fully charged (100%), and it goes down to 25% VERY rapidly - even if all I'm doing is reading a book.  I HATE that.All-in-all, I am reasonably happy with the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" unit.  Would I have been AS happy to stick with my first generation Kindle (if it hadn't stopped charging)?  You bet.  Would I have preferred to replace my non-charging first generation Kindle with a plain ol' Kindle Fire Tablet 7" LCD Display, Wi-Fi, 8GB and save $25.00??  Yup, I probably would have been just as happy with that.  But for now, I'll keep playing with this one, and just hope that it lasts a whole lot longer than the last one.

Reviews.Title: love my new kindle this is my 3rd
Reviews.Author: Lynne Bernier
Reviews.Content: I really love the bigger size, it has a great HD picture,plus it is light weight and easy to read.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle
Reviews.Author: Yolanda White
Reviews.Content: l love my kindle fire. It does everything I want it to do and has added features that I am experiencing which makes it fun. The speed is fast and the graphics are absolutely beautiful. I am always learning something new about my kindle. I thoroughly enjoy it and would recommend anyone that is thinking about purchasing a tablet to get one. You wont go wrong. I give it a high 5.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely love it.
Reviews.Author: lv
Reviews.Content: I have always loved the kindle fire. And now with the upgrade I have bigger screen, better sound, more and more and more of the good stuff. Oh did I mention I can Skype and I can take pictures. Like I said Absolutely love it!

Reviews.Title: Mega Happy
Reviews.Author: Linda K. Shoults "Appy Lady"
Reviews.Content: I treated myself to this kindle and have not bee sorry.  I can check my email, facebook, etc. from my easy chair while drinking my morning coffee.  Reading more books too.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING!
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: I LOVE IT!!! I LOVE IT!!!!! Go for he gusto and get the larger mb Kindle, you can not add memory. Make sure to add a case, the power charger, and an hdmi cable. We watch shows on our tv all the time!

Reviews.Title: Excelent
Reviews.Author: Paola Licon
Reviews.Content: I'm very pleased with my kindle, I'm having the best time with the aplications that it have. I'll buy it again.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: E. Sloan "reader67"
Reviews.Content: Easy to use for multiple tasks.  Love the reading on it.  Easy for me to see and carry wherever I go

Reviews.Title: I can't go anywhere without it
Reviews.Author: Joan
Reviews.Content: Received this as a gift to read the paper (its going digital three days a week).  I liked it so much I gave one to my daughter for her birthday.

Reviews.Title: very nice
Reviews.Author: qualityatagoodprice
Reviews.Content: I wish I could replace my laptop with this kindle...  It has a great feel, just the right size and weight, amazingly bright and crisp screen.  Quick respond and fast navigation.  Add editing for MSFT docs and vpn for corporate intranets and it's perfect!

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Mitzi  Allen "Mitzi Allen"
Reviews.Content: I purchased my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 in May of this year. I absolutely love it. It is everything and more than I expected. After deciding that the Kindle Fire HD was what I wanted, I waited a long time before I made the final decision to buy. I just wanted to make sure it was what I really wanted.The quality is superb. Crystal clear viewing, fast downloads, quality speakers, and  I am extremely pleased with Amazon Prime. I 100% recomend this product.

Reviews.Title: My heart will forever belong to kindle!
Reviews.Author: Katelyn Payne
Reviews.Content: I have used an iPad, a nook, and kindle. The kindle will always my first choice, I love using it and I never have a problem. If I do have an issue I call amazon and they help me, they are by far the easiest people I have ever had to work with! They make life easy! :)

Reviews.Title: Started off great and has declined since
Reviews.Author: Christian Clark
Reviews.Content: I received my Kindle about a week ago and have been using it for school. It is fairly fast and it works great for school and scheduling. I recommend it to anyone. However, there are a few issues. 1. My email says it is "checking email" but won't upload any new messages I have received, so I have to use my laptop (started happening 3-4 days after use). 2. There was one random time with the screen's pixels went all different colors and I managed to fix that (happened on the 4th day and hasn't happened since).Wishlist for the Kindle1. Outside camera, not just the camera for skyping facing the user.2. More customizationOther than that, if you have any second thoughts buying this product, I highly recommend it and even though there are a few kinks still, the quality of the product is very high.UPDATEAfter posting my review, a couple hours later my email began working again!UPDATEThe email has ceased working once again, a few hours after it began working. Also, sometimes letters need a firm press to work.Wishlist: once you hit "space" after using the symbols keyboard, I wish the keyboard would return to the letter keyboard.It still works great and am happy to have it.UPDATEEmail is working again and has been working for the past week. I really enjoy using my Kindle Fire HD and it has replaced my iPod.However, the office app that is pre-downloaded onto the KF is terrible. Only some of the PDF files will actually open and the ones that don't, there's an option to "send error" and I do that. I received an email this morning with one solution, upgrade the office program. I went to do that and the app COSTS $15!!! So, if your Kindle is going to be used for business, you may want to look at other tablets.UPDATEThe "on" button at the top of the device is not working anymore. There is plenty of battery left in the device, as I charged it last night. It will only give me the Kindle Fire start-up screen then go black...UPDATEMy kindle works, however, the "sleep" button will only turn the device off, even if I just tap the button. Other than that it is working just fine.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: It's late so I'm going to try and keep this really brief.CONS:  Bad buttons. There is only one huge con to note. The buttons are tiny and they fit into the sides of the kindle in a way that make it really hard to press them. If you buy this, make sure you get a case that can take advantage of the open/close wake/sleep feature.  No back camera. I don't really care about this, but I know this will likely be an issue for some.PROS:  Perfect size. It doesn't feel like an oversized phone, and it doesn't feel like I'm carrying around a giant cutting board. I like the 8.9 size better than any other tablet I've used.  Battery life. The battery life is great. It's kind of necessary since its main purpose is for reading books, but still, it's worth noting.  Lightweight. It's weight is almost perfect. Light enough that you'll never tire of holding it, while heavy enough that it has substance while you're holding it and using it. It doesn't get uncomfortable, and you won't ever thing about the weight. Definitely a good thing.  Simple interface. The interface is extremely accessible and intuitive at all times. It's simple and doesn't have the usual "dominoes on a table" style interface I've come to hate so much. This is definitely a more personal and subjective pro, but I thought I'd mention it. Just remember that the interface may be a con for some people.  Fast wifi. What can I say? The wifi works well. If I'm not mistaken, it has some of the best wifi technology available at the moment.  Front camera. The front camera is good for Skype. Means I can do video calls when I'm on vacation/not at home. Don't really know what else you'd use it for though.  Auto adjust brightness. This is old news, but I find that my kindle's auto adjust seems to work better than my phone's. (Samsung galaxy s2) This is probably more my phone's than the kindle. The point is if you're not trying to conserve battery, just use the auto. It works well.  Swype. I haven't really kept up with Apple recently, but last I heard, android was the only thing with Swype. Definitely a pro. I wouldn't even think of buying a tablet without it. I'm writing this review on my kindle. It would have taken 10x as long without Swype or a keyboard. That's just what Swype does, allows you to keep your wpm up while freeing you from keyboards. This allows you the freedom a tablet should have. In fact, that's kind of the whole point of tablets. Besides, Bluetooth keyboard are mini sized so your wpm is going to suffer in whatever keyboard size you start using less. Again, not sure, but if the iPad doesn't have Swype, then I'd buy this over that regardless of anything else.  Kindle perks. Kindles get some special perks if your an Amazon prime member. You can borrow one free book a month. It's a bit underwhelming, but free is free and pros are pros.  Amazon integration. This will be a huge con for some and a huge pro for others. I use Amazon for a ton of stuff so I enjoy it. if you have Amazon prime, then you'll also get a seamless integration of Amazon instant video. The kindle also syncs with all of your Amazon cloud data. This makes it really easy to keep up with everything on multiple devices.OVERALL: I think it's pretty clear how I feel about the kindle fire HD 8.9. It's a great tablet for a great price. It's probably worth a lot more to anyone with an Amazon prime account. I'm sure there are a ton of pros that I forgot, and at least a few more cons I haven't really thought of yet, but suffice it to say that I'm very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Adequate but lacking.
Reviews.Author: Kyle D Esala
Reviews.Content: Web browsing is an extreme pain on this device. The browser is laggy and takes forever to display a page. Don't even think about scrolling quickly through a page because all you will get is a blank page for a few seconds before it can catch up. I would think that in our world today, web browsing should be a fairly basic thing to nail down. Amazon definitely has some work to do on Sylk.Otherwise when used as a strictly video watching device for Amazon videos it works perfectly. I have a large library of titles I've purchased and am also a prime member so I have lots to watch.The only other thing that I feel is missing is an actual app for the Amazon store itself. It seems like a no brainer to have that built into the device but it does not exist. As mentioned above about the web browsing, shopping through the regular website is a painful experience.

Reviews.Title: Fire is lukewarm.
Reviews.Author: PageTurner
Reviews.Content: Its........... mmm... good, verging on great.  What it does, it does well.What I don't like... no sdhc port to hook up memory.the touch-screen works well, but if you've large fingers like me, it can be difficult with some menus.worst of all is the CONSTANT advertising or suggestive selling or buying hints with most of the apps available for the Fire.The Fire uses a version of Android, and many of the apps available are written for Android.. but too often they dont' work on the Fire.No input/output from the mini usb port, evidently its just for charging the battery.  I'd hoped to find software that would let me control my Canon sxi camera with, but with no IO port, no can do.So do I like it? yes, reservedly.  Do I wish i'd saved a few more bucks and gone with a Windows RT unit? yeah.. I think so.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Cindy Burns
Reviews.Content: Got this as a replacement for my smaller defunct kindle fire and it's great! Love the larger screen and Amazon was great in their willingness to assist me.

Reviews.Title: Satisfaction Guaranteed
Reviews.Author: S. L. Cooper
Reviews.Content: First purchase I made was the 7 inch Kindle...love it and now love the Kindle 8.9.  I'm not much for reviewing electronic items so I only have one thing to say...a friend has an iPad and the Kindle does everything it does and more at a lower price and Amazon support.  You can't beat that!

Reviews.Title: Above and beyond
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: My children, my husband, nor I can put this Kindle down.  We have downloaded MANY books and games.  It was a lifesaver during swim meets AND during our summer road trip.  Perfect for people of all ages.

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: David L. Green
Reviews.Content: hight deff. is supper clean, fast to run new apps, and you just can't beat the price. batter life is about 6.5 hours if watching movies get the quick charger its a life safer.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: James Felker
Reviews.Content: It does everything we were looking for in a inexpensive tablet. Works great for social media and for the kids to play around on.  More convenient than a lap top and a lot cheaper than an I-Pad

Reviews.Title: One major disappointment
Reviews.Author: James R. Aced
Reviews.Content: Works well.  The biggest problem is that it is not Android or Apple compatible for some APPs.  I guess that I should have looked into this before I purchased.  Once there are more APPs, I will be very happy.

Reviews.Title: great tablet for the price.
Reviews.Author: nanaoftwo
Reviews.Content: We bought this for when we travel with our granddaughters and when it is just us two. It is very clear and fast. Our only problem was when we signed up for at&t; and I didn't get the 49.99 first year, I was told that I had to sign up for 2 years at 14.99 a month and other fees for start up. So your info needs to be clearer.

Reviews.Title: My Fire
Reviews.Author: pxmidnight "Phyllis"
Reviews.Content: REALLY love this! Sometimes I want to just be by myself and watch a program (netflix, HBOG), sometimes I want to play with folks I know (Scrabble, Words with Friends), sometimes I want to read (DUH!). Shoot! I can even skype on this! Love it!

Reviews.Title: Amazon Customer Service ROCKS!
Reviews.Author: R. H. Pass "photosbyrose"
Reviews.Content: after having my Kindle HD for not quite 11 mos. it seemed to have developed a 'shimmer' on dark barkgrounded pages & apps. I  used online live chat to CS and was only hoping for a recommended fix via download. what I got was an immediate replacement! no questions asked, FedExed to me in 2 days (I chatted on a Saturday evening, I had the new one Tuesday Morning). I will never hestitate to use Amazon, and I plan on renewing my Prime Membership this month.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!
Reviews.Author: L. A. Coley "mrchaplaincoley"
Reviews.Content: I have used my Kindle Fire 7 almost every day for hours since I got it over a year ago. So I was happy to get this larger HD tablet because I watch Prime movies off it almost every night. My husband goes to sleep before I do and the TV light is too bright. The light the Kindle gives off is just right for me and not too bright for him. I had games for our grandsons on my smaller Kindle Fire so my memory was maxed out. The 32GB gives me so much more space to play around with plus the extra space on Cloud. Pictures are truly amazing with the HD feature. The HD with movies are so bright. I really didn't think the HD would make that much of a difference but it has. It gives a larger screen to check emails, FB and surf the web. Helps in shopping online. I'm a big Amazon fan so I've been very pleased. With the Prime membership I get free apps on my Kindles, watch free movies so what more can you ask for? I like the Skype ability. If it had a rear facing camera and a scanner app I would be perfectly happy getting rid of my laptop!

Reviews.Title: Wife and daughter love it, screen response not very good
Reviews.Author: clcntx
Reviews.Content: My wife and daughter love it but I hate the the screen response.  You often have to touch the screen several times to get it to respond - sometimes with excessive force.  It helps if you zoom in on the item or word you are trying to select, but even zooming in can take 2 or 3 attempts. Downloads, image quality, browsing, etc. are all great, if they could just improve the touch screen response it would get 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: After a month, I still love it! A OK...UPDATE 10/9/13 and 2/7/14
Reviews.Author: Retired "Retired, and enjoying my free time. ...
Reviews.Content: I have used my KF nearly a month. I still love it just as much as the first day. I treat it carefully as I would any item of electronic nature. I do not use a screensaver, as for me there is no necessity. I surf the internet, A OK...I add Kindle books, A OK...I use Google Blogger app, A OK...I check Gmail, Yahoo mail,  A OK...I do nearly everything I do on my desktop PC. A OK...Battery life, about 8 hours with active use, 6 hours if watching streaming video. Still A OK...Car Charger,  I plug it in overnight,  A OK.  Doesn't drain my car battery to charge KF, A OK...Go to Starbucks, read book for two or three hours....A OK...still on free WiFi so then watch a movie, A OK....go home...Plug in KF, 3 hours later, take KF to bed with me, read a book, watch a movie, A OK....then go to sleep...Get up, wake up, Plug in KF, do my chores, a few hours later, start all over again....It's a good life, I love it, A OK....UPDATE 8/7/2013: I did get the KF HD 8.9 WITH the Ads. I must say, it is not an issue, and would not be worth the money to get the No-Ad version. The ads are more of a screensaver, with a touch and slide to the right to open the ad. To get to my Kindle content there is a touch and slide to the left to open the Kindle. Now either way, you have to touch and slide. To me, the ad version is not annoying at all and I simply view it as a screensaver. So save your money and don't pay for the ad removal.UPDATE 10/9/13: I have had no issues with my KF HD and it continues to perform well. I take it everywhere with me. I also just learned that the KF charger does a fine job of charging my smartphone Droid4, so no switching of chargers in home or car YAY!!. Also the fact that I felt so happy and confident with my experiences with my KF HD that, early September I purchased an identical KF HD 8.9 for my Granddaughter. I have not formally reviewed that Kindle, but so far, it has worked fine and my son is in charge of the usage of my 8 yr old GD. She LOVES reading on the Kindle Fire. DS is using Parental Controls and states it works well. He can completely block the internet, limit the game time, and no limit on reading time. So GD is happy she gets some games with lots of reading.UPDATE 2/7/14 No issues. Works like new. GKs Kindle Fire HD 8.9 has no issues either. I tried to review the GK Kindle Fire, but for some reason Amazon says I've already reviewed the KF. Yes, mine, but not the GKs KF. Hmmm.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Paul R. Nistico
Reviews.Content: There is only one down side to this device - I bought it for my wife a month ago - we haven't talked since............  she never gets off it!All kidding aside, this thing has an unbelievably clear picture EVEN BLOWN UP ON A 48" TV!  The sound is beyond belief.  It sounds like a stereo system, not a 9 inch device.  Very thin, well made.  Lots of fun.  You can read this thing in full sun.  I am very pleased and glad I bought this.  Wow Amazon.  Good job!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Ruby Slippers
Reviews.Content: Only problems ~ not enough storage space and no slots for SD cards or thumb drives.  It should also have USB ports, now that would be fantastic.  Oh and Word 2010 or better.  I love it though.

Reviews.Title: Love the Kindle
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my wife, her second Kindle, she loves it. I love it, I don't have to talk to her anymore, it takes up all her spare time!

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Unit - Makes free time easy to enjoy!
Reviews.Author: Ronald W Bowen
Reviews.Content: Only problem - no AC charger adaptor. For $300 I shouldn't have had to order one post purchase. The Prime is very friendly and useful.

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this.  My brother bought me a Ipad and though I use it I find the kindle so much easier and more user friendly I use it to watch my series when I am running on my tread mill it fits perfect.

Reviews.Title: Fast, Fun and Reliable
Reviews.Author: H. Kane "AV enthusiast"
Reviews.Content: Having owned an original Kindle Reader and a Kindle Fire acquiring this device seemed a natural progression.  It's relatively light and I enjoy reading books, listening to music, playing games and watching movies.  Much easier to read e-mail due to the larger screen and, unlike my Kindle Fire, I'm able to import and play FLAC encoded music.  A very nice device.

Reviews.Title: Worth the wait!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: I saved up for quite a while to be able to buy this Kindle.  I am so glad that I did.  Pictures and videos look fantastic on the device.  I have used the native Kindle reader as well as the OverDrive reader with epub books and both have worked wonderfully.  I've played with many free apps and have yet to run out of things to try.The sound is good, but volume is a bit low.  This only gets worse when I put my case on the Kindle.  Since I don't usually listen to much music I guess this isn't as bad a problem as it might be for some.I love my Kindle Fire HD.

Reviews.Title: Great product.
Reviews.Author: james
Reviews.Content: I got this for my fiancee cause she had the older and smaller version.  She loves it.  Havent heard any complaints, thank god.  lol

Reviews.Title: Great for everything I need to do
Reviews.Author: Mema
Reviews.Content: I use it constantly and don't see why anyone would spend more for an ipad.  Email, games, searches, movies, tv shows and reading!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9" 4G LTE Wireless
Reviews.Author: David Matekovich
Reviews.Content: Love Love Love!!The picture is amazing.  Wireless works great.  Touchscreen works great.  Internal speakers work good, I prefer to use my earbuds.  I wish the charging cable came with the wall adapter, you will need to buy it separately.  I bought the Otter Box to go with it.  I also wish it came with the HDMI cable but oh well.  Overall, this Kindle is amazing!

Reviews.Title: tough to get started
Reviews.Author: Carren B.
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet. I would have liked a manual with it not in it to help get some understanding of the unit - kind of lost after the turn on.

Reviews.Title: A real winner!
Reviews.Author: David W Soelter
Reviews.Content: After buying my wife an 8.9" Fire for Christmas, I decided I had to have one also.  This pad has everything you would want in a format that's easy to work with.  The scroll that features the items you are currently working with is a unique feature.  All in all, this is a great value.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Nancy Larsen
Reviews.Content: This is my third Kindle.  There isn't anything I don't like about it.  The size makes it a little easier for me to watch my movies or ready my books.

Reviews.Title: I'm in love!
Reviews.Author: J. Foster
Reviews.Content: I love this Kindle!  I upgraded from the keypad kindle, and was concerned because this is backlit and the book organization isn't so great.  It won't replace my older Kindle for outdoor reading, BUT it is a great device for travel and might replace my bulky laptop because the keyboard I bought to go with this turns it into an editing and writing machine.

Reviews.Title: Nice addition to lap top and desk top computers.
Reviews.Author: Robin Talley
Reviews.Content: Love the android apps and Kindle apps. Enjoy reading my newspaper on the Fire and favorite magazines and books. Seamless facebook app goes smoothly to external links. Facebook app has a few kinks, such as inability to "like" others comments, but not enough to reduce my rating.

Reviews.Title: Best tablet/e-reader for the price
Reviews.Author: Marc Buy
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire because I was looking specifically for something to use as a reading device, but I wanted something with a larger color screen since I wanted to use it for comics and graphic novels.  The apps and Internet accessibility were nice features, but mainly I wanted something with a nice screen for a cheap price.  The Kindle is easily the best large screen color tablet when price is factored in.  I will offer one slight complaint that I notice some lag when switching apps, or loading content, but it's not a big deal, and again I can't complain when considering the price.  But it's worth considering, especially when devices like the iPad seem to offer a bit speedier response -- but then again, they are more than double the price.

Reviews.Title: Love it Love it Love it
Reviews.Author: Susan Marshall
Reviews.Content: What can I say, I'm a Kindle fan.  Someone tried to convince me to buy a Nook but I just couldn't bring myself to do it.  This is my third and I will never own anything else.  he HD screen is crystal clear and the download speed rivals my laptop.  How can you beat the price for such a great product?  You can't beat Amazon customer service either.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: vera witt
Reviews.Content: Since my hands have gotten to weak to hold the heavy books required to cover the desired subjects, the Kindle is  an invasluable tool, and when  placed on the stand, makes reading a relaxing pleasure.

Reviews.Title: The Kindle is a great gift!
Reviews.Author: Ed
Reviews.Content: I bought this Kindle for my wife as a gift and she loves it.  It's very user friendly, the sound is amazing, and the display is fantastic.  For all the naysayers about the Kindle, please do not compare this product to the iPad.  I agree that the apps are more limited and it may not have some of the same functions, but that is mostly due to the fact that the iPad is different and also that it has been in the market for longer.  For those of you who want to give a gift from which a someone can read email, do some basic web surfing, read documents, watch videos, and play games without breaking the bank (watch out for the cost of accessories) then the Kindle is for you!

Reviews.Title: Wow... a capable tablet at a reasonable price.
Reviews.Author: T. Powell
Reviews.Content: I have been switching to e-books for a while now, and an accident destroyed my 2G Kindle.  So, I needed something to replace it.  I looked at all sorts of tablets (iPad, Surface, ATIV, Galaxy) and they all seemed great but more than I wanted to spend.  After all, I wasn't trying to replace my notebook, just find a replacement for my Kindle.  I settled for the Kindle Fire HD 8.9.I'm impressed.  Ok, so I had to figure out how to use the thing and I'm still doing that.  But this makes a great replacement for the 2G kindle and then some.Having touch makes it so that I am not just limited to paging forward or backward - perhaps this is becoming a genuine student tablet... I wonder.My only "issue" with this tablet is that while it is an Android device (underneath the skin, anyway) it is hard to get apps from sources other than Amazon.  Amazon has a large line-up of apps, but it doesn't have as many as Google Play.

Reviews.Title: Great option to other more expensive pads.
Reviews.Author: Mark Berry
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle 8.9.  Much larger screen makes everything easier to see and apps are much better to see.  I like being able to access different sites that I can't on my phone.  Great alternative to other pads.

Reviews.Title: Struggled making the decision but absolutely NO buyer's remose!!!!
Reviews.Author: The Least of These "Repent and Believe!"
Reviews.Content: I have an old Kindle that has served me well. When I was trying to decide on what to upgrade to, I looked at everything from MS Surface to Nook to the new Kindle. I got the Kindle and I am pleased with my decision. It took me literally less than 10 minutes to open the box, set up the Kindle, and get connected to my home Wi-Fi network. The Kindle upgraded itself and all my books, videos, music, etc where instantly "there!"  The screen is amazing and really makes reading a breeze and a pleasure. I had Lasick surgery done on my eyes years ago and have been wearing "readers" (glasses) when I read. The new Kindle with its improved size, display, and other enhancements (love the yellow highlighting!) have eliminated the need to wear my glasses and again, reading (and I read A LOT!) is a pleasure.Buy the Kindle. The ability to surf the Web, get your emails, shop online, etc. are just BIG pluses!!

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny
Reviews.Author: Dan Hennessey "ktndawg"
Reviews.Content: This is such a nice product; was tempted to spend the extra for the iPad, but I am happy with this product. Form, fit and function follow through is first-rate. Nearly have it replacing my laptop for most of my uses; already makes my first gen Kindle reader seem like a Dick and Jane primer; no comparison.I would have liked the interfacing with "alien" programs (i.e. Google) be FAR more seamless, but it is what it is...Very happy with my FIRE functions and portability, especially for movies. Sound and picture are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Never thought I would love this so much!
Reviews.Author: Debbie 1
Reviews.Content: I love to read but I love actually holding one in my hands. I love the feel and smell of them and love old libraries. My husband loves tech stuff so even though I told him that I didn't want one, he bought it for me anyway.I think it took me about two weeks and now I am hooked completely! I knew that I just didn't have the room for many more books but I couldn't imagine not having all of my favorite author's new books. Well,even though it's not exactly the same,I not only have their books but have found so many new authors that I probably would not ever have heard of now.I also love all of the free books and many of the apps as well! I am so glad that he bought this for me. I still have a great many things to learn but I am enjoying it more than I would ever have imagined. Thanks Amazon for a quality product and keep making it easier to use. You should also include a manual with it as well.

Reviews.Title: Dislike the battery charging set up.
Reviews.Author: Torri Cable "Torri"
Reviews.Content: Just got my new Kindle Fire and can't wait for it to charge, but why, oh why does the plug in cost extra and the usb charger takes so long.  I think it's mean to not include a wall plug in.  What if some poor soul doesn't have a computer, (unlikely, but it could happen) how are they supposed to charge their brand new toy?  If this was about my old Kindle it would rate 5 stars, and maybe this one will in time- but I'll always think it's very poor service to not include the plug in and mean to not have that noted so old timers like me would have the chance to remedy the situation at purchase time.

Reviews.Title: GREAT BARGAIN FOR HALF THE PRICE OF AN IPAD
Reviews.Author: The Queen of Bean Station
Reviews.Content: I've owned Kindles since the first generation.  I sold my first Kindle on Craig's List when I bought the second generation about 6 months later.  I still have the second generation and bought the Kindle Fire when it first came out, mostly because it was in color and was like a mini tablet.  I love the Kindle Fire and just recently purchased the Fire HD 32 GB dual-band WiFi version when my husband said he "wanted a Kindle Tablet" to replace his Sony Book Reader (which is NOT user-friendly at all, requiring you to purchase books on-line, download them to your computer and then sync the reader to the computer....which causes duplicates of the same books every time you sync to download a new book).  I tried to talk my husband into buying a Kindle instead of the Sony Book Reader but he let someone he worked with influence him because they had one, and mostly because at the time the first Kindle had the little buttons for the keyboard and he didn't like the look of that as it was distracting and he liked the concept of just swiping your finger across the screen to turn the pages (on the Sony), which was not available on the first or second generation kindles.Now he uses his Fire HD all the time, sometimes even in the morning to read the newspaper instead of booting up his laptop (again a Sony Vaio which he's even more disappointed in).  He's even using the Fire HD for all his email and recently figured out how to transfer photos from the computer to the Fire HD.  Not everybody can afford the IPads and the Fire HD and buying books from Amazon is sooooo simple!

Reviews.Title: Slam Dunk
Reviews.Author: Foolhardy "A fool and his money..."
Reviews.Content: Full integration with Audible, Amazon Video, and Amazon MP3.  I've been a loyal Audible customer for years and was ecstatic when Amazon took over Audible.  Audible was great to begin with, but Amazon's dedication to customer service is without equal.  When I connected my new Kindle Fire HD to WiFi and discovered that every audiobook, video, and MP3 I have ever purchased was at my fingertips....  I'll just say it was more than I expected from the device I purchased to read books with.Of course, the books are all there as well.  The new Kindle Fire HD is the perfect size for reading--think trade paperback.  It includes several dictionaries in addition to the Oxford Dictionary of English; Spanish, French, German, Italian, etc.  Great product, Amazon, thanks.

Reviews.Title: recommend
Reviews.Author: Deeanne Agozzino
Reviews.Content: Asolutely terrific...better than other products on the market! Would recommend this to everyone.Easy to upoad movies, songs, games etc. Love it!

Reviews.Title: A Tip
Reviews.Author: Inez
Reviews.Content: The one feature that I wish the Kindle had was a LED light to indicate when the device was charging.If Amazon could include that in the next round of updates, that would be great.

Reviews.Title: Surprising number of different uses even for those with disabilities
Reviews.Author: B. J. Barney III "Wheelzup"
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant about this Kindle Fire HD at first but now that I have it I'm quite happy. Being disabled from a spinal cord injury that left me with little use of my hands I wasn't sure if I'd be able to take advantage of its touch features for navigating around it. I took a chance and purchased a stylus so that I could wind it between my fingers much the same way I hold a pen to write and it works quite well for me. I can read, surf the web some and even play a few games. I ended up getting the 32 GB model just to be sure I had plenty of storage space for some of the apps I chose to get.The display is beautiful and streaming movies and videos on it is just icing on the cake. Reading text-books for school is a breeze compared to my original Kindle saving me plenty of room on my desk and not having to fumble around in a book trying to find the information I needed. All in all it does the job and then some. If I had to choose the best thing about it I'd have to say its size. It is smaller and lighter than most laptop computers I have used yet it is still large enough it's easy to read and carry around. It's not a tablet PC but there again I really didn't need one at this time. In a few months that may change but for now it does what I need it to do.

Reviews.Title: Amazed
Reviews.Author: Good guy1
Reviews.Content: The first one I was sent was defective. Amazon worked with me and promptly sent me a new one and it has worked flawlessly. I love the kindle fire.

Reviews.Title: great device
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've had an iPad but needef a second device so decided to try this one. Personally it has been a great device. Sound and wifi connection are better than my iPad.  Love the Free time spp for my 2 year old granddaughter.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet/e-reader
Reviews.Author: Palaver "pixen"
Reviews.Content: I wanted an e-reader and a tablet.  I was able to 'play' with a Kindle Fire HD 7", and was sold.  I have been able to read books, watch movies, and share photos and ideas with friends and families.  All for alot less than the Ipad!

Reviews.Title: meets all expectations
Reviews.Author: Anne J. Mauney
Reviews.Content: Kindle fire HD is  user friendly.  Learning to use was not difficult.  Clarity is perfection. This tablet holds charge for hours as designated.  I have had mine for two months and would definitely purchase again.

Reviews.Title: Great for someone who doesn't like computers.
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: I have multiple laptops (linux and windows) yet my wife never liked even checking her email or surfing the web.  It seemed like there were a few steps too many for her to be comfortable using them.  In addition, she didn't like charging the laptop or keeping it plugged in for her to use it.  Sometimes she would go for weeks without checking her email.Now she can check her email in one step, reads kindle books from Amazon, listens to Pandora and even easily gets to websites she has used recently.She also has Parkinson's, her hands shake and she has trouble speaking.  When she uses Type and Talk she can pick out words without even typing them completely and can press talk and people can easily understand her.

Reviews.Title: excellent buy.
Reviews.Author: Roger Fry
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat hesitant to purchase the Fire because I wasn't' sure how I would use it and more importantly IF I would use it. So.many things today in our culture are fads - here today gone tomorrow - and I didn't want to waste my money. I was given a regular Kindle 18 months ago and after a while, it fell into disuse because I found it hard to read scientific papers in pdf format due to the small screen and the trouble that Kindle had converting pdf formatted papers. I am.pleased to say that the new Fire has handled this problem. I also.like the wireless feature. In fact I have found more and more businesses have free wireless hotspots which allows me more access. I like the larger keyboard and I am thinking about upgrading to a Bluetooth board to further increase my usage of the Fire for my business. Does it have drawbacks? Yes I have found that the user manual isn't very usable for questions that I have but that may be due to "operator" error.  All in all its a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Wow!  it my everything!!
Reviews.Author: Mary Bacon
Reviews.Content: My sister in-law has had a Kindle for a few years and was always singing its praises, I just didn't understand having a laptop was enough,, and if not why not just a  or is it?  Secretly I was holding out for the cream of the crop, the Kindle Fire HD, of course , and she is impressed. The colors on screen, the graphics, reading ther is no glare also the apps, and games,  Facebook, Skype, boy I could go on but you get the idea. It has pretty much everything.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire HD!!!
Reviews.Author: J. A.
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I give myself one big splurge each year at tax return time. My sister has an iPad and I had thought about getting one of them after using hers a couple times, but I do an awful lot of stuff on or through Amazon so I figured I would check out their tablet first. After reading the other reviews, comparing the products (both capabilities and price), I decided that there wasn't anything that I needed it to do that the Kindle Fire HD wouldn't do. I have had it for almost a month now and am extremely pleased with it. The touch screen controls and keyboard are easy to use, the images are sharp, the web pages load quickly (to be fair it is connected to a broadband connection at home and I haven't used it anywhere else yet), movies play well and the sound on it is great, especially for such a small device. I can get any apps, movies/tv, books, music, etc. that I want easily in the Amazon store. The battery life seems to be on par with what they advertise, and with the quick charger I don't have to wait all day to get it recharged.All in all, I love the product and would recommend it for anyone who wants the occasional convenience of a tablet instead of lugging out the big computer or laptop.

Reviews.Title: A Bit like an Ipad
Reviews.Author: TicToc
Reviews.Content: The HD 8.9 is a great upgrade, and well put together. With a detachable Keyboard you have a laptop that does just about anything most of the others do. The features are great, and the color is wonderful. The Charging port is in an awkward place if you are using the system, but you can work around it. The port is where the system sits when you have it in the folio case, so is it a little more difficult to use when charging. Other than that this was a great find.

Reviews.Title: I love this thing!
Reviews.Author: FloB
Reviews.Content: I was resistant as I love my plain Jane Kindle - this opened up a new world.  If I can't do it on the Kindle I prob won't do it

Reviews.Title: Me And My Kindle
Reviews.Author: MaxJ
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire HD because I liked the old Kindle with Wi-Fi and this one offered so many more uses.  The games, movies sound guality, everything advertised on this site really.  I also wanted to see what all the rage over Angry Birds was about plus itallowed my niece and nephews a chance to become familiar with this device.My biggest reason for buying a Kindle was the number of books it can hold.  I am an avid reader and will not let go of my books for love or money and as a reslut, I have a room full of books.  The Kindle allows me to continue my collection but with an ideal storage solution.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Joyce Franklin
Reviews.Content: Kindle Fire HD 8.9 has met all my expectations.  Love the product I am able to do everything I need to do on one device!!

Reviews.Title: Love, Love Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Olevet "I do love to read on my Kindle Fire, ...
Reviews.Content: So much faster than 1st edition fire!, So much more vivid! Great for video's and movies.Love it!!! Self teaching, and uncomplicated. Recieved as a b-day gift yesterday, still learning.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Denise Wullner
Reviews.Content: I was debating between this and the ipad..decided to go with the kindle fire because of the price and it seemed to do everything I wanted the ipad for...so far I have been very pleased with it.  There are numerous apps available for use on here and all of the ones I wanted are there.  Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Jerry in Carolina
Reviews.Content: Still finding neat things about this tablet after a few weeks of ownership.  Beautiful screen resolution and clarity.  Looks almost like 3-D.  Enjoy all the books and mags that are available for use along with the free videos if you are a Prime Member.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: Didn't care for 7" model but love this one. I own Ipad, Xoom Samsung Galaxy and this. Of all the tablets, this one has the best on board speaker system by a mile.  The color is comparable to an Ipad.  Ease of use isn't quite there yet but only a minor complaint and I highly recommend this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Wife Loves It
Reviews.Author: Bolo
Reviews.Content: Never had an ipad so I cant compare to that but my wife loves the Kindle Fire HD 8.9. Bought it as a Christmas gift and she uses it daily for e-mail, shopping, browsing the web etc. Some people complained in their reviews they needed more apps or other functions but the Kindle Fire does everything my wife needs it to do and more. For the casual user this is great and cost a lot less than an ipad.

Reviews.Title: Love my new Kendle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: DJGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Just received the Kendle Fire HD 8.9 and so far so good, really love the larger screen and ease of use.

Reviews.Title: Really great
Reviews.Author: Harold Carvajal
Reviews.Content: I love it..it has all I need for a tablet, love the size and everything about, I will recommend it anytime.

Reviews.Title: Exceeds my expectations
Reviews.Author: Walter "Walterplus"
Reviews.Content: Love my new device, not too heavy and reasonably fast for surfing the web. Love it for reading it`s a joy to use.

Reviews.Author: Laci Ledbetter
Reviews.Content: I'm in love!  The only complaint I have is that I was under the impression that it would come with a wall charger and now that it is dead I realize that it's something that I need to buy separately.  Be warned that the USB cord attached to a computer does not charge sufficiently. If you order this, go ahead and order a wall adapter. I do LOVE it though!!  I'll just have to love it again in 3-5 days when my charger gets here. :(

Reviews.Title: Fire HD 8.9 16GB
Reviews.Author: Janie D
Reviews.Content: I am enjoying my 8.9 Fire HD.  I like having the larger screen.  I like how it provides alternatives re apps and books.  I like the Xray on books you are reading.  I love the audio - it is not so monotone like the 1st Kindle Fire  I look forward to using more of the funcitions, I still need to set up my email.  Also, Love that camera.  Right now I am mainly reading books and utilizing some of my apps. I use my 1st Kindle fire when the HD needs to be charged.  I still use the Kindle keyboard for reading books, can't beat the battery life.

Reviews.Title: Good but not perfect
Reviews.Author: Doug Buirley
Reviews.Content: I bought the kindle fire HD so I can read some books at home, away from the PC, It has a great screen and has an over all nice package. Would have given it a full 5 stars, but the device is incompatible with a title I bought to read. This is unacceptable for Amazon's top of the line Kindle. It should be able to display every title available in the store. I do hope this is rectified soon.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product with a few complaints
Reviews.Author: John B. Sinclair
Reviews.Content: Overall, I have been very pleased with this product. The graphics are excellent. It is relatively intuitive to use, even for a dinosaur such as myself. I enjoyed reading my first novel on the Kindle, although for humongous novels and nonfiction I am likely to stick with hard cover versions due to easier ability to flip back and forth and all around as I choose. Battery strength is great. I use it mostly to read newspaper and other websites. It is very handy to be able to sit outdoors and surf the web with Wi-Fi. I am glad I got the larger size and 4G service when I am out of Wi-Fi range. I now carry it with me every day. Two complaints. I had to return the first Kindle I received due to its inability to receive e-mails on my 3 accounts. The second Kindle is much better though it can be hinky at times at receiving and opening e-mails; it is especially important to trash deleted e-mails to prevent clogging of e-mails. Unlike my mobile phone, I also sometimes get the dreaded "too many tabs open" message on my Kindle when going several pages into a website. This needs to be fixed. But count me in as someone very pleased with my first tablet.

Reviews.Title: kindle
Reviews.Author: G. Pittman
Reviews.Content: My daughter has the first kindle and decided to go this route since I am not a fan of the the ipad.  I love it!!  It does the job and hardly use my laptop anymore.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price but some quirks
Reviews.Author: elizabeth
Reviews.Content: Kindle Fire is great for the price but some functionality issues are annoying. I got this for school readings but quickly found out the file management system is nonexistent and you have to plug it into your laptop to organize your files. Apps to do this exist, but they come with disclaimers and make me uncomfortable that I may accidentally wipe the whole thing. The Amazon app store is also incredibly disappointing.Overall though it's pretty nice if you're going to focus on movies and books.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: joseph eschmann
Reviews.Content: I purchased it mostly for reading books but I really like the ease of use. My daughter  has an ipad and this does pretty much everything the ipad does at half the cost.  I did not get the 4G one and may wish I did in the future for traveling etc... After installing your games,books,videos wifi is only needed for web surfing anyway. I bought 2 of these-1 for my Mom's birthday present.

Reviews.Title: very good product!
Reviews.Author: Isaac Michel
Reviews.Content: This is a good acquisition and it's wonderful to have it. At first I did not know how to change the font to make it bigger. After I discover how to do it I'm so thrilled with my kindle.

Reviews.Title: I had very pleasent dealing with amazon. I am always interested in shoping with amazon. Thanks for your support. Williams.
Reviews.Author: Rajayan Williams
Reviews.Content: I had very pleasent dealing with amazon. I am always interested in shoping with amazon. Thanks for your support. Williams.

Reviews.Title: Better than ipad
Reviews.Author: waynesworld
Reviews.Content: I had the ipad 3 before i bought the this kindle fire and i think the kindle fire is better.  I am not a big app person, so didnt mind that the amount of apps to choose from wasnt as much as an ipad.  The back of the kindle gives a better grip than the ipad, easier to read on the kindle and hold cuz its a little smaller, sound quality is 100x better than the ipad.

Reviews.Title: BEST BUY THERE IS
Reviews.Author: DaShu
Reviews.Content: THis is the best buy ever.  I traded up from my basic Kindle and this is the most impressive buy for me. Compaired to my sons IPAD, I like the KINDLE HD better.  THe music sounds outstanding, the picture and videos are so clear and the price puts Apple products to shame

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: R. Summers
Reviews.Content: I just received this so I am still trying it out. Seems to be an excellent product and I picked it over an Ipad because of the features for the money! I am very impressed with this product and the screen is amazing! I will update this as I learn more about it but as of now I would highly recommend this Kindle Fire!!

Reviews.Title: Everything and More
Reviews.Author: Oz
Reviews.Content: Actually I don't know about everything yet.  But it's a great tablet so far as I've explored it.My only "knock", as a rural user, I have limited bandwidth coming to the house.  The "always on" aspect of the tablets chews it up.  So I have the wifi disabled at home and load it up with books and aps when I'm in town.  Many of the game aps require online access so that's a bit disappointing.  But for those with non-metered bandwidth, I heartily reccommend this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9" 32 GB w/ ads
Reviews.Author: Richard Cortes
Reviews.Content: Love my new Kindle Fire!  The wifi on this thing is great.  It will connect in places where my old 7" Fire wouldn't.  Everything else about it is as advertised.  My only complaint is that the power button on this thing is a little hinky and ambiguous.  It doesn't povide any kind of tactile sense that the button has been pushed and the slight lag time to screen activation leaves you wondering if you succesfully activated the device.  Everything else is great.

Reviews.Title: excellent!!!
Reviews.Author: Gary R. Williams
Reviews.Content: Easy to use .music and video sharp and clean.I bought the 8.9" for myself and the 7" for my wife . Couldn't be more happy with both

Reviews.Title: It is amazing
Reviews.Author: Marley West
Reviews.Content: The KIndle Fire HD is great. I love all of the apps I can find, I love the book layout that it has. The HD screen is great for watching movies and videos.

Reviews.Title: Kindle HD  fire
Reviews.Author: Linda Nash "southern girl  grace"
Reviews.Content: Readed the reviewsThis was a Christmas give to my granddaughter she loves it  no trouble at all easy to set upWell worth the moneyThis is better than a regular laptop and easier to use

Reviews.Title: best value
Reviews.Author: David Lum
Reviews.Content: cheaper version of the ipad, well worth the price,,,, i love this item as it goes where I go,,, Thanks

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: The Beef
Reviews.Content: Glad to have purchased without special offers.  Christmas gift for my wife.  She had me return an iPad in 2011, and is glad to have waited for the Kindle.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: garyh
Reviews.Content: Have had the product for a little over a month and I love it.  The screen is bright and totally awsome, I Pads have nothing on the Kindle.  Do wish you could improve the battery life, needs recharging way to often for peak performance.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: A Sharon Dunham
Reviews.Content: This product far surpassed our expectations.  The price is right, the size is right, the colors and clarity are awesome.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift for our daughter. She really likes it and uses it all the time. It is really versatile and just perfect for her needs. I ordered a Kindle Paper White for myself after seeing how well hers performs.

Reviews.Title: Nice equipment
Reviews.Author: Susan F. Smith
Reviews.Content: As a first time buyer who is learning my way around on this, I like the colored screens and ease of moving around in them.  Reading a book is a snap.  Still exploring the other features offered.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Joe Crosby
Reviews.Content: I love all the things I can do with it.  I took it with me on a trip and watched movies, read and a book and used the WI-Fi.  It has made my laptop almost obsolete.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"  -  WOW !!
Reviews.Author: Linda A., Sager "Stephen Hawking fan"
Reviews.Content: I previously purchased the smaller, black & white Kindle, which I really loved, but this Kindle is a dream come true.  It does everything the Ipad does at much less cost.  Surf the web, read books, watch videos & movies.  Again - Love It !!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: JoAnnC7
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HD it was the best purchase I made the picture is so clear on Netflix. Plenty of room for all my books. I check my email,play Word with Friends. I keep a list of my medicine so when I go to the doctor it's right in my hand. I use it all day and night. A great investment Thank You

Reviews.Title: Love this!
Reviews.Author: Diane Hill
Reviews.Content: This is better than any tablet or kindle I' 've owned. I have always had my kindle desperate from my tablet and my Amazon prime videos on another device hooked to my tv, but now I have it all in one. I would recommend to anyone who love books, movies,tv, and apps.  It does it all in one device. Love it!

Reviews.Title: I Love it, Just one problem
Reviews.Author: Mary "health nut wantabe"
Reviews.Content: I cant tell when its charging, and all of the accessories are very expensive. I also think that the Kindle Fire Hd 8.9 should come with a power brick and a sleeve case and a better looking box. But other than that i love it!! Its really fast

Reviews.Title: Like it - wish it had a manual for dummies!
Reviews.Author: MPat
Reviews.Content: I would give it a "5" however, I wish the instructions were in hard-copy format so I could flip to pages I want to use while still on screen.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase
Reviews.Author: Jamie P.
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this tablet to anyone. We have enjoyed it for reading, games and internet. Much less expensive than the ipad and as far as I can tell has many of the same features.

Reviews.Title: I Love It
Reviews.Author: Bantry Bay
Reviews.Content: The only complaint I have is that I would have liked a manual to come in the box.  Some times I have a hard time figuring out how to work things, good thing I have a son

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Natec
Reviews.Content: One of the best.purchases I've ever made!! Love it & it's very user friendly. Would highly recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: sherryweinstock
Reviews.Content: The color is so bright, it almost looks 3D. Easy to use once you get the hang of it. Have to hide it from my Husband, because he loves to play games on it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Janeene Petersen "jan gran"
Reviews.Content: I enjoy having my "stack of books" look so nice and work well too.  I am still learning al the features

Reviews.Title: Loving my new kindle hd
Reviews.Author: E. Mccurry "saved1979"
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased with my new kindle hd, i love the larger screen, it makes using the apps more enjoyable, the reading, which is my number one thing is so much better on this kindle versus my smaller one. Loving it, would highly recommend to anyone..

Reviews.Title: fabulous
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: prefer this to my old one which was smaller and had far fewer features, great picture quality and so easy to read with all the different font sizes and choices

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: krbbrk
Reviews.Content: I love, love, love my Kindle Fire. I have used the Nook previously, but that lost my interest when it became apparent Barnes and Noble aren't as adept at pricing and software as Amazon is. I take this with me everywhere and use the wifi as needed. It's excellent. I do have an issue once in awhile with it freezing, but it doesn't last long. I know it's software related. Overall it's a fantastic gadget to own. Amazon is doing a great job with pricing and I love the fact I can get free apps each day just by visiting their website. Excellent range of books and movies and music. I'm an avid Amazon user and now I'm a huge fan of the Kindle. You will love this product and it's great for children too. They have an app just for them to use also so you can share it. It's worth every penny and you will enjoy this very much. Excellent gift idea. Don't forget to get a carrying case, because you won't want to put it down.

Reviews.Title: Thrilled!
Reviews.Author: Pamela R. Briggs
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablet and was NOT sorry!!  So many people said not to wasted my money on the HD because it wasn't worth it but I took a chance because it was what I wanted and I have not been sorry.  The picture is crystal clear and so real and I love the extra size.  I love the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablet and highly recommend that everyone get it!!

Reviews.Title: Overall very pleased.
Reviews.Author: GoingLoopy
Reviews.Content: Pros and cons of HD 8.9" vs. Original 1st Generation Fire:PROS:Clearer display with way less glareLarger screen, so magazines are a lot easier to see without going to text-only modeCameraFaster processorSuper-fast downloadsRecommendations - I actually like that it will suggest things similar to what you just read or watched or played.  It's not obtrusive due to the size of the screen.  It might be less awesome on the smaller version, though.Better speakers (it still sounds better with headphones, but the speakers are usable if, for example, your cat chewed through ANOTHER headphone cord and left the pieces on your pillow, as a gift).CONS:Power button hard to see/find and it doesn't have a light (so unless you actually open up the case, you can't make sure that it's actually plugged in.  See prior note about cat and delicious, delicious cords).A little heavy for holding in one hand, especially in a case.Still more glare than I would like...not impossible to use in daylight, but not great.Battery life is longer?  AHAHAHAHAHA.  Surprisingly, movies/tv seem to suck the least juice. Reading eats the battery, and playing games (like Angry Birds and Cubistry) kills it.Formatting issues with some books and games.Generally, I am very pleased with it.  I find that I watch a lot more movies & tv shows because of the larger screen.  Also, I can set the text size a little bigger and not have to turn pages as often...as I am rapidly approaching the Age of Reading Glasses, I like this feature. I just wish the power button had a light like the 1st gen. Fire, and that it was slightly raised and not flush with the case.  The display is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire - Love it!
Reviews.Author: mommom
Reviews.Content: We got this to share as a gift to ourselves for Christmas.  We really love it and it is easy to use. We considered getting one last year but held off.  We're glad we did because we love the bigger size.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Elke Hill
Reviews.Content: I just received my Kindle as a gift and I'm still learning how to use it but so far it"s great. It does just about everything a computer does. The picture is spectacular, so clear, the sound is great also.  I am reading my first book on it and am enjoying that also.

Reviews.Title: Amazon does it again!
Reviews.Author: Moultrie
Reviews.Content: Well it is no iPad and I suppose it isnt meant to be. Everything that an old Kindle is and more. If you are a reader and movie watcher this is for you. If you want something to compete with and iPad buy and iPad for 700 bucks. This fills the gap that Apple fails to address and is a much better product as far as I can tell. Additionally the customer service for Amazon and Kindle is the best I have ever had and that is worth more than gold to me.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!!
Reviews.Author: BeBe Marie
Reviews.Content: I had no intentions of buying this because I already had the 1st generation fire.  But, then I read the review by Michael Gallagher, and he said that he liked it better than his ipad.  That's what sold me, I ordered mine immediately.I received mine the week before Christmas 2012.  I love it and the new larger screen.  It's thin light weight, smaller than the ipad is what I wanted, I think they are too big and heavy.  Thank you Michael!

Reviews.Title: My Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Tom Allen
Reviews.Content: I really like my Kindle Fire HD. My nephew had gotten one for Christmas and I played with it and loved it. It is great for games, Skype, and your emails.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with my Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Tiffany Fodero
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet so I don't have anything to compare it with but I will say that I absolutely love it. I am hopelessly hooked! I bring it with me everywhere and do everything on it. I shop, connect to Facebook, Email, download books and music, watch movies and TV shows etc.. Its very lightweight and easy to carry around. It's also very easy to use and understand even if you're not tech savvy. It's very fast as well, much faster than my PC. I also love Amazon's Standing leather case for Kindle Fire HD 8.9. It too is very lightweight but still really protects the Kindle. I definitely recommend the Kindle Fire to anyone looking to get a great tablet. I'm so glad I did.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 16 GB
Reviews.Author: John A Scarpantonio
Reviews.Content: Kindle Fire HD 8.9", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 16 GB. Purchased this as a Christmas present for my wife. She uses it every day for reading, Email and Web. Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: I DO Love it!
Reviews.Author: Joan Doe
Reviews.Content: I couldn't decide between the bigger kindle or the smaller iPad, but I am so happy with my choice!Much better value for the money.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: fificlark
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with my Kindle HD 8.9" dolby Audio dual-band WiFi 16 GB it makes me feel so tech groovy

Reviews.Title: The Best Tablet Around!
Reviews.Author: BigMomma
Reviews.Content: My husband has an iPad II, and my KFHD 8.9" is MUCH BETTER.  The responsiveness of this little gizmo is just as good as the iPad, and the shopping on Amazon can't be beat.  Web surfing is a breeze, and the price is affordable.  I have been really thrilled w/my purchase decision!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 8.9
Reviews.Author: rldominik
Reviews.Content: I had the original Kindle Fire, and bought the 8.9 for my husband and myself for Christmas presents, we both absolutely love them, they are easy to use, download books, games, music, pictures.  We take them with us wherever we go. We highly recommend them to our friends and people who see us using them when we are out and about. We are glad we bought them.

Reviews.Title: Super Sized
Reviews.Author: L. Glenn
Reviews.Content: I loved the original Kindle Fire, and this one is even better.  Items are large enough so I canselect with my finger rather than a stylus, and all the images are big and beautiful.  The onlydrawback is the increase in weight, but given the advantages, it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: Going Small
Reviews.Author: Over 60
Reviews.Content: I have always avoided tablets because I like a big monitor.  I love my knidle Fire 8.9".  The wireless allows me to take everywhere unlike a PC.  I have hesitated being dragged into the 21st century, but glad I finally made the leap.  There is a small learning curve when it comes to the cloud versus the device, but It is a nice option if you don't won't to pay for more memory.  The picture quality is excellant.Some of the cons are all the extras you should buy that don't come standard with the kindle (charger, cables for uploading music from computer, and cover).  The pros definitely out weight the cons.  I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: gf loves her kindle
Reviews.Author: Andy
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure about this for my gf for Xmas. Rest assured she loves the kindke. I didn't want to jump on then apple bandwagon.  The resolution is amazing, sound is acceptable. For streaming videos this is perfect!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: S. Shortridge "Matty's Mommy"
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle!!! You can do everything from reading books (of course), to checking email, browsing facebook, listening to music, and watching netflix or even skyping. I use the Kindle most of all to play Sims or Solitaire. Whatever you use this Kindle for, the sound is awesome and the picture is amazing. One last thing, you can access your video library (plus others) on your Kindle from your Amazon account. I purchased a movie months ago, that I watch randomly on my computer from time to time and the sound always seems awful even though my ear buds are Sony. However, I watched that same movie on my Kindle Fire (with the same ear buds) and the sound was astonishing!!! Amazing buy!!!

Reviews.Title: favorite gadget!
Reviews.Author: Mamma bear
Reviews.Content: I use my fire all the time and I don't know how I managed without one!  Great for travel too!  I can do almost anything on my fire than I can on my laptop.  The picture and sound are very impressive.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Peggy
Reviews.Content: Product came fast delivery and as expected. Good supplier. no problems at all with this product. very happy and good price

Reviews.Title: Great Device - Far More Than Just An E-Reader
Reviews.Author: I'm Wolfies "imwolfies"
Reviews.Content: I received the Kindle Fire HD 8.9", 32 GB, without the special offers,as a Christmas gift in December 2012.  It's been great to be able to download various books and search the web.  It's been quite efficient with the various apps that I've installed.  I haven't spent one penny on a book yet.  In time I will, but find it not necessary at the moment.  Another great advantage is that I am able to access my college course materials, via the web, and not have to wait until I get home to study or lug around a bunch of books all the time.I am new at using a tablet type electronic but am getting familiar with it.  I never knew that there were so many free books.  I'm sure that I will keep adding to my collection.  Love to read, but don't have the time to do so every moment of the day.  However, it's nice to have a personal library close at hand. I personally like the large screen, for it makes reading quite enjoyable and not as tiring as reading a traditional book.  I hope that Amazon keeps improving their product and may there be many more happy readers in the world.

Reviews.Title: 5 stars
Reviews.Author: E Perry
Reviews.Content: I got this to bridge the gap between a tablet and ereader and it is that and more. I do not have a smart phone, do not want to pay a lot of money for a data plan, so this really fits the bill. I looked at an Ipad, but too much money. I still have not signed up for the At and T deal but I will soon. That was another reason I got this, the At and T deal for a year is a no brainer. Also I really like reading books on this screen much better than my Kindle keyboard. I like being able to adjust the background. Amazon prime membership also is a good deal for all the video screening shows.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Marcia
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my husband. He loves it. He has trouble reading books, because his eyesight has gotten bad. The Kindle brought the enjoyment of books back into his life. It also helps with his church scriptures.

Reviews.Title: Perfect.
Reviews.Author: George Z.
Reviews.Content: Took about a month to make my mind up. I compared the Kindle, Nook, Nexus and the iPad mini. I was looking for an e reader that wasn't just an e reader. This fits the bill perfectly. If you want to read books, stream or download movies, browse the internet or look at pictures its excellent. I read reviews that said how good the screen and speakers were and they were right. But in the end my view doesn't matter, it was a present for my Wife and she loves it.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Denise Daly
Reviews.Content: This Kindole was a Christmas gift to my husband.  Shortly after he fractured 3 ribs in a go-cart accident and has been using the Kindle ever since.  He can access email, watch videos, look at the Internet "news" and just occupy himself all day.  He likes the larger screen, the vibrant color and the easy to use features.  We are low tech people but he's figured most of it out without help.

Reviews.Title: Brenda
Reviews.Author: BRENDA
Reviews.Content: This is by far the most universal piece of technology that I have ever owned. I have many other pieces and they have taken a back seat to my Kindle Fire HD. I have done so much with this device. It goes everywhere I go. My life consists of family, friends, work and play. The Kindle is a part of all four.

Reviews.Title: More Impressed than I expected
Reviews.Author: Heather A
Reviews.Content: My Kindle Fire HD 8.9 came a few days ago and wow! I'm very impressed with this little machine. I've had an iPad2 since release day and use it daily. I had no need for anything else, but decided to purchase the Fire to use mainly as a digital wifi picture frame.
