Now that it's here I have a feeling I'll be putting my Kindle Keyboard away and using this for my main reading device... especially since I now know how to get whispersync working on non-Amazon, non-DRM books and documents via Amazon's cloud, between all my devices using the Kindle apps.So why do I like this? For one is the price... I got it for $250 which is a fair price point for this device. I don't think I'd love it as much at $299 and would probably have bought an iPad mini at that point. Needless to say, I'm glad I didn't.The screen is gorgeous! I don't have a retina iPad so I'm comparing it to my iPad2 and Macbook Pro. I love it.The build is substantial. It feels like a quality product... not a cheap tablet... and it looks beautiful.The packaging is very Apple-like. Simple and sleek. Felt very nice to open and reveal the toy inside.The Amazon integration is wonderful. If you have Prime this is a no-brainer.What I don't like... it has a bit of a lag and feels slower than my iPad. Not quite as responsive, but not bad enough to make the device seem unusable.I also don't like the location of the charging port. Being on the long-side of the device made it a little tricky to find a stand that would accommodate the longish stem on the included USB cable when docking horizontally. I was able to get around this by finding a micro-usb cable with a very tiny head so there's a bit more clearance between the KF and the table when set in a generic tablet stand. I'd be much happier if the charging port was on the short-side of the device. Charging while watching a movie, or in my case using as a photo frame, is sometimes a necessity.So far those are the only cons I've discovered with this little tablet. I've only had it for about 3 days so that may change, but I all-in-all I'm quite impressed... and that's saying something as I'm quite an Apple fan girl and never expected to own any tablet other than an iPad.I would recommend the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 to anyone considering a tablet on a budget... especially if you are a Prime member. The integration is wonderful and the ease of use is nothing to sneeze at. You won't feel like you "settled" for a cheap Android tablet, you'll feel like you scored a deal on a nice tablet you'll enjoy using.

Reviews.Author: tammy
Reviews.Content: We are very happy with the fast delivery of the Kindle Fire HD's.  We love them :D...............Thanks So Much :D

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up and even easier to download new books.  The resolution is amazing and easy to return to the place you left off if you can read the whole book in one sitting.

Reviews.Title: A few things I miss
Reviews.Author: Megan
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire. I had an Kindle ereader that I love, but i received the Fire for Christmas. It is infinitely easier to browse and buy books on the Fire, however there are a few  things I miss about my Kindle. I loved the screen of the Kindle, and it hardly seemed like I was reading on a computer at all. The feature that I miss the most though, is the ability to organize your books. It's much more time consuming to look through my books now because they are all in one big list. Before, I could look under young adult fiction or historical fiction and find what I wanted. I wish Amazon could make an update or something to make this possible.

Reviews.Title: kindle # 3
Reviews.Author: naomi
Reviews.Content: this is my third kindle and i love it . i passed  my first on to the grandkids but its hands off on the tablet. the color is great i use this all the time we have in our home two computers, one laptop and a notebook and the kindle is my drug of choice.

Reviews.Title: Amazon Kindle Fire HD 8.9" Review
Reviews.Author: Dr. Who
Reviews.Content: The Amazon Kindle Fire HD 8.9" is a fantastic tablet that is affordable on any budget. Unless money is not a constraint, you can save over $250 by purchasing the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" instead of the iPad 4.DESIGN:Although the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" is cheap, the chassis feels solid. It's not the aluminum build that you'll find on an iPad, but it's well-constructed nonetheless. The Volume and On/Off buttons are not as flush with the body as they are on the 7'' version.PERFORMANCE:The iPad 4 and Nexus 10 offer smoother performance, better processors, and a better web browsing experience. The Kindle can't compete in these categories. Nevertheless, the Kindle Fire HD has a very responsive interface in its own right. Do not expect glitch-ridden, shoddy performance simply because of the low price.SCREEN AND SPEAKERS:Picture quality on the screen is sharp, clear, and vivacious. It is a joy to read or watch anything on the Kindle Fire HD. Amazon fused the touch sensor with the LCD display to reduce screen glare. This is crucial for people who like to use their tablets outdoors or in well-lit conditions.Most tablets use a single speaker to simulate stereo sound. The Kindle Fire HD actually uses two speakers that are visible externally. The result is that the sound produced by the Kindle Fire HD is incomparable among tablets.PORTS:I was able to connect the Kindle to my projector via the micro-HDMI port, and the results were outstanding: 110 inches of HD content on my living room wall, originating from my Kindle Fire!FINAL WORD:The Kindle Fire HD 8.9" is an amazing tablet at a very affordable price. The tablet boasts a mesmerizing IPS display, booming sound, and incredible battery life. Sure, the Nexus 10 ($399) and the iPad 4 ($499) have better processors and higher resolution screens, but they also cost significantly more. If you sign up for an Amazon Student account, you can buy the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" for $249 today!For a more detailed review, please check the comments below.

Reviews.Title: After Santa delivered this, my son has not played with his other Christmas toys!
Reviews.Author: Michael D. King
Reviews.Content: The Kindle was recommended by a couple of Computer savvy friends and I heeded their advice. They were so right. This is a great product with unlimited potential. Son's can play games, get on the Internet for school projects, download music or just sit and read a book. One of my best investments.

Reviews.Title: love my fire!
Reviews.Author: Pierre B.
Reviews.Content: my new 8.9hd is an awesome thing! so entertaining i can hardly put it down. the improved screen resolution, the speed and added software features make it my 5th favorite companion after my wife and kids.

Reviews.Title: As others are saying!
Reviews.Author: ToP Sue "ToP Sue"
Reviews.Content: We bought the Kindle Fire HD with high expectations for sound quality, quick interaction with the web and the visuals expected on the screen. We were not disappointed! The dual antenna must be the trick to quick response time.We are still in the exploratory stage and are looking for more interesting apps to add. We are fans of amazon.com, so the ads are not an issue for us.This is ending up in my husband's hands, as I will prefer a smaller size. I am looking forward to having my own 7" version, that will fit in my purse.

Reviews.Title: I Love "MY" Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Barbara
Reviews.Content: Heaven knows, I don't have anything to add that hasn't already been said.  What I can tell you is that I am an older woman and I enjoy my Kindle.  Yes, I wish it had a camera .. but I can take my pocket one along.  And yes, I wish it had voice recognition, but when I want to ramble on in an email I am going to use my Laptop.  But other than that, it does everything I want -- the price point was wonderful, I can easily find the on off button, I don't mind tapping twice if I have to --- it is easy to use, intuitive and fun.  I would have bought it sooner, but I had to think about what I could use it for.  Did I really need it?  I have 2 laptops, an Ipod, an ITouch.  I needed a reader but wanted something that had more functionality.  I had looked at my friend's IPads and thought they were too big and too much money.  I had seen the smaller Fire's and thought I would like something bigger.  So, I finally decided to go for this -- and I have found many uses for it. It really makes my life easier.  I love the many uses of the Apps I have downloaded - this is small enough and easy to take along yet big enough to use in lieu of my laptop at home.  I really really enjoy this device.

Reviews.Title: Buy it!
Reviews.Author: Raiderphan2
Reviews.Content: For the money, this can't be beat.  HD is awesome, speed is awesome, ability to navigate awesome.  Basically..... awesome.  Love it.

Reviews.Title: i bought it for my girlfriend and one for my mom they just love them!!
Reviews.Author: Unknown
Reviews.Content: this is a GREAT all around gift!!!my mom and girlfriend just love theirs!!i highly recommend this to any one for a gift.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value, gorgeous display
Reviews.Author: S. Losch
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9 is my first tablet. I also have a Kindle keyboard e-reader. I got the Kindle Fire to use mainly for e-mail and web surfing while traveling, but find I enjoy using it a lot at home, too. I got the larger size because I thought it would be better for web browsing and viewing video content. The touch screen is sharp, beautiful and very responsive. The Kindle Fire HD is great for reading magazines, cookbooks and picture books, but I still love my Kindle keyboard for reading regular books. I enjoy playing puzzle type games on the Fire, too. I've only run into a couple things the  Silk web browser wouldn't open, so it isn't a problem for me, but I definitely prefer typing e-mails on a laptop or desktop computer. Haven't watched any movies or tv shows on the Fire yet, but probably will when traveling. The Kindle Fire HD is an excellent value, fairly easy to learn to use and suits my purposes very well.

Reviews.Title: Needs a 6th star!!!
Reviews.Author: Steven Swann
Reviews.Content: This tablet is so amazing. Screen, sound, playing games, etc...  I cannot say enough about it.  It was worth every penny spent on it!!!!

Reviews.Title: The perfect gift or personal purchase
Reviews.Author: jovita Carol Rowe
Reviews.Content: The person who received this gift from me had truly enjoyed it. He is techy challenged, but Kindle has made it easier for him to grasp. I had fun playing with it too.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Elsje
Reviews.Content: Was everything I expected. Easy to get started, easy to read and like the brightness that it has. Watching videos are good.

Reviews.Title: HD Kindle 8.9
Reviews.Author: Paul Torres
Reviews.Content: Have a previous 2 year old Kindle paid $189.  This new Kindle is amazing and so easy to operate.  I don't know that much about computers and downloading, but I figured everything out with the help of the Amazon web-site.  Very happy with my new Kindle, makes my old Kindle so out dated.

Reviews.Title: GREAT PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Burge
Reviews.Content: THIS WAS A CHRISTMAS GIFT FOR MY SON AND HE'S HAVING A BLAST WITH IT!  IT KEEPS HIM OFF MY COMPUTER AND GIVES HIM TOTAL ACCESS TO EVERYTHING HE NEEDS.

Reviews.Title: Love this kindle
Reviews.Author: MCC Nursing Student
Reviews.Content: My son left my kindle for on top of his car and drive off... It fell off his roof an got run over. He had to tell me the news and I responded with "that's ok, you can buy me the HD and he did :) it's awesome!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I would write a long review on the Kindle Fire, but it would all come down to the same thing...I love it! The display is amazing, the processor is very fast, the audio is excellent. I have had it for about a month, use it every day, and have not found anything that I do not like.

Reviews.Title: Super Size!
Reviews.Author: Karol
Reviews.Content: I have been absolutely pleased with everything about it. I really thoroughly studied  & compared over the internet & in the stores before I made my decision . The size is perfect. I have a few friends that got the IPad and after seeing mine said they wish they had bought the Kindle because they felt theirs was too bulky & not convenient to tote aroun d(not to mention the huge price difference) .& were also as  pleased as I was with the gorgeous color & clarity. It is also very easy to get to all the features such as mail, internet,movies,books & the magazines are a perfect size-display very well on that size screen. Lots of great apps. I don't understand people saying that there aren't that many apps as some others.. Good Grief how many do you need?-they have a wonderful variety!As you can see by the above ,  I would highly recommend it to any first time buyer or anyone who wants to move up to a bigger screen as I did.

Reviews.Title: First of Many
Reviews.Author: Erin
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet ever. Although I have played with a few that my friends own this is by far the best one. The picture quality is awesome, there are 1000 things I can do with it, and I am learning new things every day about it. I am not a techy person so I can't get into any kind of debate over the megabite details and so on, but for the novice person who is not interested in spending $600 for a tablet this one is the way to go. My husband has an iPad at work, once he played with my Kindle he went out and bought one literally the next day.

Reviews.Title: More than I expected for the cost
Reviews.Author: Danny Tompkins
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas present for my tech challenged wife. She loves it. I spent a lot of time comparing it to the Ipad Mini. Main considerations for the Fire HD 8.9" compared to the Ipad Mini1. Cost .2. Size3. Weight, ease of handling4. Screen definition.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire  8.9 inch
Reviews.Author: Dennis Kafka
Reviews.Content: I only have very positive good thoughts about this new Kindle. I mostly use the 7 inch model, but I bought this larger tablet as a gift for my wife. Due to the fact that we both have grown to love the Amazon Company with their excellent supply of products, I saw no reason to change to any other tablet brand. These newer Kindle Tablets are a bit faster and have several other improvements over the very first model. The optional touch screen pens that simulates your finger is a must have item for us.

Reviews.Title: KINDLE FIRE REVIEW
Reviews.Author: CP1
Reviews.Content: I LOVE EVERYTHING ABOUT MY NEW KINDLE FIRE 8.9 INCH TABLET FROM THE VERY CLEAR 1080P SCREEN TO THE DOLBY DIGITAL  SPEAKERS.IT IS VERY EASY TO USE AND THE SOFTWARE THAT AMAZON HAS ON THIS TABLET MAKES IT VERY EASY NAVIGATE TO THE CONTENT YOU ARE INTRESTED IN,THE EMAIL  CLIENT AMAZON USES HOTMAIL, GMAIL ECT. MAKE CHECKING READING AND SENDING EMAIL A BREEZE,THE SCEEN IS 1080P AND IN MY OPION JUST AS CLEAR AND SHARPE AS THE LATEST IPAD OFFERING.THE CONTENT THAT AMAZON HAS TO SELECT FROM  WHILE USING THIS TABLET IS SECOND TO NONE ,THEY HAVE NEW RELEASE MOVIES  BOOKS MAGAZINES MUSIC AND TV SHOWS AND YOU CAN ACESS THE PRIME INSTANT VIDEO SERVICE THAT AMAZON OFFERS FROM THIS TABLET.THE BATTERY LIFE LAST A VERY LONG TIME WITH CONSTANT USE.IT CHARGES VERY FAST WITH THE AMAZON POWER CHARGER SOLD SEPERATLY BY AMAZON

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Buzzard
Reviews.Content: Very easy to set-up email, Netflix, Pandora, Skype, etc, and of course, Amazon.  Wireless works great from anywhere in my house and even from about 50' outside.  The screen resolution makes everything really pop and the stereo speakers sound great.  With headphones, it sounds even better.I purchased 2 micro HDMI to HDMI cables for it.  One 15' to use at home connected to my TV and a 6' to take with me when I travel to connect to the TV in the hotel.  It's great to have all my streaming content from Netflix and Amazon wherever I go.  I did sideload the Dolphin browser and a version of flash that works with it, so that I can watch other video formats.The APP store is really overloaded with games for kids.  I guess people must use their devices as babysitters.  But I did find some useful free APPS.  I recommend YOUZEEK, which seems to have all the music on youtube in categories, by artist. I am a guitar player, so I can plug my Kindle Fire HD into my PA, fire up YOUZEEK and jam along with my favorite artists while I watch the video (if youtube has the video). I also recommend the PBS video APP, Flixter, Urbanspoon, IMDb, Norton Mobile Security free APPS.I purchased the powerfast charger with my Kindle and it works great.I also bought a rooCase for it which is a great value.  It puts the Kindle to sleep when closed and wakes it up when you open the case.  I also control the volume from the dropdown menu, so I don't have to deal with the hard to locate on/off and volume rocker buttons.  Those buttons are the only thing I would change about the Kindle Fire HD.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Nancy J. Graham
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy the size of the larger screen and the HD is great. I am very pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: great Tablet
Reviews.Author: james obeng
Reviews.Content: Its awesome and I'm really loving every minute of it,I think it definitely is in the same class as the IPADS and Galaxy Tabs,but for me this is the best

Reviews.Title: It's a Keeper
Reviews.Author: barbara cates
Reviews.Content: Love my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" .  I can almost as much on it  as I can my Ipad. there a few appts that I wished it had. As far as getting on the web and surfing the net or checking my email, or Skype it is excellent

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Cat lover "Cat lover"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my new Kindle. It's so much easier to turn off, No holding a switch to turn it off and it's way easier to remove unwanted books from your device or even from the carousal display.

Reviews.Title: Great product at a great price
Reviews.Author: GARY R HART
Reviews.Content: Wasn't totally convinced on purchasing this item, my son-in-law talked me into the Kindle.  Now that I have it, I love it, an awsome tool with amazing capabilities.  Don't know what I would do without it now.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Efrain V
Reviews.Content: Very cool. The wife loves it! Very user friendly. I would def recommend this product to anyone interested in purchasing a tablet.

Reviews.Title: My second Kindle
Reviews.Author: movie fan
Reviews.Content: Fantastic smooth flawless operator... but what else would you expect from Amazon after all I even buy my under ware here!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Mary Weiler
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this Kindle!! I love it and I love all the things it can do. Wish I would have purchased it sooner.

Reviews.Title: my Kindle
Reviews.Author: Cory Campbell
Reviews.Content: Love it, Love it. Awesome tablet, picture and sound are unbelieveible. I have the 32G and it is very fast, no buffering.Streaming is fast and easy. Movies are just like using your Blueray player at home.

Reviews.Title: Love The Convenience
Reviews.Author: Richard Schaefer
Reviews.Content: I've thought about getting a eBook reader for quite a while and finally opted for the Kindle. It gives me just what I wanted. I did not like the fact that within a week of my purchase Amazon offered the same item for $50 less. I felt a bit ripped off by that. That is not a problem with the Kindle, but with Amazon's marketing strategy.I would recommend a design change to put the connection ports on the side. With the Kindle in a cover, the only way to close the cover is to position the Kindle with the ports along the lower edge. This means they hit you in the stomach if you use the Kindle while lying in bed. Connections on side would solve this problem.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Landy
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet, not overpriced and not any functions or features you will never use. The Kindle does what a tablet is meant to do very well, books and video.

Reviews.Title: Novice
Reviews.Author: Ruth Pauline Green "Knitbugmouse"
Reviews.Content: This technology is very new to me. But now I can buy all the books, games etc I want with no storage problem.  I have a large stash of hard cover books taking up way too much room and want to downsize and this is a very good investment towards that.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!!!
Reviews.Author: Confused Shopper "Carolyn B"
Reviews.Content: What a great product.  I can surf the net, listen to my music, read a book and not have to drag around a laptop or be stuck at my desk top.  It fits conveniently in my bag and my oversized purse.  I guess the only con, I would have is that I was it had a front and rear facing camera.  I am not that vain, where I take a lot of pics of myself so unless I am skyping or video chatting, I really will not use camera.

Reviews.Title: A great Tablet!
Reviews.Author: James L. Frear
Reviews.Content: I have one of the origional Kindle fires and this baby is defintley a superior inprovement.  It takes some training and study before you can really use it though, and I am an eperienced computer user.  As you can see I highly reccomend this product, especialy after checking every tablet out there except the iPad.  However, I don't reccomend this product for a senior or novice to computers except one wiling to study and read about its capabilities.  Given that: Get one and have fun!!

Reviews.Title: READ AWAY
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: The wife loves it.. easy on the  eye's no glare as with other products. User friendly and just the right price.

Reviews.Title: This is my 4th Kindle
Reviews.Author: bottomdollar
Reviews.Content: I have been unable to find anything I do not lie about it.  The added usb and hdmi ports make this the BEST buy I believe of all the tablets. I ahve approx 225 books, 60 movies and a lot of music on it. I go no where without it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire H>D> 8.0"
Reviews.Author: Michael J Gormly
Reviews.Content: More than adequate for my needs for a tablet.  Been looking at all of them, comparing and balancing my needs and what all had to offer.  For the money I am very satisfied. Easy to use once I got the hang of it.  I have been slowly adding things, apps, etc as I get use to it.  I am retired and the learning curve is a longer process for me.  But the display if outstanding, the response is great.  I like it

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet, Wonderful Performance, Great for Families!
Reviews.Author: Shibby23
Reviews.Content: I spent countless days researching a great first tablet for the whole family, and had it narrowed down to the KFHD 8.9 and iPad Mini, based on size, price, and available support. I went to a nearby store to test the actual product, and walked out shortly after that with a Kindle Fire HD 8.9, and immediately fell in love. I have an Asus Transformer Prime rooted and ROM'ed, but the kids don't do so well with it's large size. My three year old gets especially frustrated trying to play a game on the Asus. I got the KFHD set up with FreeTime, and he went to town with it, no frustration.The screen is worlds better, although it's over an inch smaller diagonally. Still not as bright as the iPad mini, but pound for pound, on par with the best displays on the market today.I opted to buy the 32GB WiFi only tablet, and the price was hard to beat for the included hardware. I was a little sad to see a lack of SDHC expansion, as my Asus has over 40GB full already.Battery life so far is great. Out of the box it went over six hours of continuous use before it needed charged up. I charged it overnight, and have not put it down in the last 8 hours. I watched a full movie, set up some new apps, played Angry Birds, and the processor got quite warm. It currently is holding a 40% charge. Not bad.The WiFi speeds coupled with the powerful dual core CPU clocked at 1.5ghz make for a super responsive and smooth experience during use.I was able to use WiFi hotspot on my Sprint phone to allow the KFHD 8.9 an internet connection while in the car last night, and I must say, it works so much better than the Asus ever does. I suspect the KFHD Dual Band Dual Antenna may be the difference.I was also ecstatic to learn that students get an Amazon Prime membership for only $39 PER YEAR. And with all the features that come with Prime membership, this is one of the best deals.The only disappointments I have are the lack of Google Play Store, and that the non-slip back will not allow my company's vinyl sticker to adhere. The volume of apps available from Amazon makes up for the first, and finding a case or cover will solve the latter.Bottom Line: Great product. It is not an iPad or true Android, but in many ways it is better. And I walked out of the store only having spent $400. Five Stars all day.

Reviews.Title: Really Really BIG HIT!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Betsy Willey
Reviews.Content: Wonderful device. Friends are jealous and envious of the size. The person I gifted this to is very very happy. Well done on the choice of the size and price on this device. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift
Reviews.Author: kenneth
Reviews.Content: This is my wifes sencond kindle. I thought she loved the 7" fire but this one is so much better. I am the Christmas hero this year. Thanks for the great product and the speedy shiping. Might even upgrade to Amazon Prime. Thanks Again!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire H D  8.9 Dolby Audio, Dual - Band  WI - Fi, 16 GB
Reviews.Author: Debra Brown
Reviews.Content: I'm really enjoying this tablet still learning how to use some of the features.So far it is everything that I need and more. I would recommend this tablet to anyone that is talking about getting one.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: Monica M. Payne
Reviews.Content: Love it. I would recommond this tablet to anyone. Easy to use and has everything in it that I need. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: Monica M. Payne
Reviews.Content: Love it. I would recommond this tablet to anyone. Easy to use and has everything in it that I need. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Best gift for my wife.
Reviews.Author: Skip Reilley
Reviews.Content: My wife is a voracious reader, and years ago I had gotten her the original Kindle, which she loved. But she also loved our Android phones so much (they operate very similarly) that I finally upgraded her to the K-Fire and now she's reading several books at once. It's a brilliant machine - beautiful to look at, easy to operate, and surprisingly good battery life. I'm not as much a reader as my wife is, but I have to admit to being a little jealous not having a Kindle Fire of my own.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: David Shaak
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my husband for Christmas as he is disabled and enjoys reading.  He got quite excited at the different types of books. Very clear pictures.  On button a little hard to find at first but he now has the hang of it.  thinking of getting one for myself instead for easy of access to fb etc instead of setting up the laptop.

Reviews.Title: Great! Though takes getting used to.
Reviews.Author: Leha
Reviews.Content: First, this is not an Android tablet. This is a Kindle with most (but not all) capabilities of a typical Android tablet. Having said that, it is better than most of them. Give it some time and you will love it.

Reviews.Title: Great, but not perfect ... which is intended
Reviews.Author: K. A. Young "youngka"
Reviews.Content: My summary is that I'm very satisfied with the product, though it's not perfect.DISLIKES:It really comes down to media/content management as the biggest downer, and this is something that Amazon did on purpose.  So, yes, there is definite intent on Amazon's part to create an imperfect device.The first content managment issues is GAMES.  The Kindle has this wonderful menu bar on the top that separates Games, Apps, Videos, etc.  And, as long as you acquire your media from Amazon, it places the media in the proper location.  If, however, you're inclined to upload your own media, the Kindle will not allow you sort into the proper location.For example, I already own the Angry Birds Star Wars game.  I'm not going to buy it again, just because I've changed devices (just like I wouldn't re-purchase a song just because I upgraded an iPod).  Fortunately, it's easy to migrate media through a process called "Sideloading."  You tell the device through an easy setting that it should allow installations from non-Amazon sources.  Voila!  You can bring in those games.Unfortunately, since the game didn't originate from the Amazon store, it won't be recognized as a "Game."  It just goes into the generic "Apps" menu.  So, I end up with only half of my games in the "GAMES" menu, rendering it useless.  I only use the "APPS" menu which has all of my games, but also all of my non-Game apps.  Irritating not to be able to use the full menu structure.The lack of recognizing VIDEOS is also irritating.  Again, if you purchase a movie from Amazon, it will show up nicely in the VIDEOS menu.  If you rip a DVD and put it on your device, it will not show up.  You'll have to use a file explorer app like ES Explorer to find and open the video.  Same with home movies, so this isn't a copyright integrity issue ... it's purely a decision to cripple the device when working with non-Amazon-originating material.  Anything that did not originate from the Amazon store will be dead to the Kindle and you'll have to find a back door to locate and view it.Frustrating not to be able to go into the VIDEOS menu and look at my son's pee wee football highlights.  Nope, got to go through an explorer menu tree to do that.CAROUSEL is also annoying.  Anytime you use anything, it goes into the carousel.  Delete it from the carousel.  Use that app again and it's back there.  Just adds a bunch of clutter.  There is a separate Favorites function, but it would be nice if the carousel were a bit smarter.  In its current incarnation, it's just useless clutter.The included Cloud storage is useless, excepting the music portion (250 free song storage/stream).  Not only does it not allow anything to be streamed, but it won't even allow you to access files you store there.  Just a pointless mess.  This has been discussed ad nauseum, so I won't repeat.  Dropbox, Box, and countless other online cloud storages are much better and have good apps to use.So, the biggest disappointment is clearly the media management of this device.  Amazon intentionally crippled the device and made any non-Amazon media use/visualization very cumbersome.LIKES:Video is amazing.  Read the other reviews, but it is crisp.  1080p source material is just awesome.Sound is also crisp.  Watched the opening sequence to Expendables 2 in 1080p Blu-Ray transfer as my test for video and sound.  Wow.  As mentioned, the video was insane.  The audio was wide and expansive.  Really nice simulated surround treatment.File manipulation is easy. Things like YouTube, which are "missing" from the Amazon app store, are easily sideloaded onto the Kindle.  Putting files onto the Kindle is easy.  Using them and Kindle's native management of those files is crap, as mentioned above.Responsive touch pad.  Check out YouTube vids from back in Sept 2012, when the 8.9 Kindle Fire HD was being demoed at various shows and events.  The touch pad looked pretty clunky in those reviews -- unresponsive, unreliable.  Ouch.  Made me nervous.  Whatever those bugs were in those prototype units were apparently solved prior to shipment.Great linkage to Prime for streaming content.  Surely, it would be nicer to get more movies from this century (most are from the 80s and 90s), but there are some good titles in the mix (Thor, Transformers, Rango, e.g.).  Still don't know why it costs 5.99 for a physical DVD to be shipped to my house, e.g., but to buy an electronic-only version of the same movie costs 9.99.  I hate to be gouged, and so I haven't bought a title, yet.  Rentals at 3.99 for most newer stuff is still expensive enough to keep me a RedBox customer ... much better than the DirecTV 5.99+.Ads.  Yes, I like the ads.  I like them, because it lowers the cost.  I can choose to pay more to remove the ads, but I don't.  I love the idea of being able to choose a lower price.  People who hate the ads can choose to pay more to remove them.  What a great system!  How could you ever complain about that?  (this refers to the lock-screen ad.  The "what others bought" ads that appear below the carousel can be turned off without cost.)It's a great tablet.  I would buy again.  Amazon already figured this, which is why I expect they're fine intentionally crippling various aspects of media management.

Reviews.Title: Well Designed Jewel
Reviews.Author: F. Wallace "Will Wallace"
Reviews.Content: I love this product.  The main reason is it is much more intuitive than the iPad. It is also far more visually appealing. Kindle really understands their users, their market. I love using this product, interacting with it. It is graphically stunning with wonderful sound. It is lightweight and slim.  Silk, the browser, really surprised me, it is so well designed. My only complaint with the product is that the power on button is sometimlyes hard to find, over recessed on the side.  That said, buy this product, you won't be sorry.  Get the larger size too!

Reviews.Title: This is the greatest tablet!!
Reviews.Author: Linda C. Collins
Reviews.Content: I had the previous 7" Kindle Fire.  This 8.9" Kindle Fire HD is sooo much better.  I like how fast it comes on with the automatic cover.  The Wi-Fi is easier to get to and connection time is really fast.  Everything downloads so much faster.  And ... I really like the larger screen.  I've been recommending it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Well,,, its GREAT
Reviews.Author: Ashley Lova Dearest "Ashley"
Reviews.Content: My mommy and daddy got me one 4 new year and i really love it!!! Especally playing games and taking pictures.. Im 8 and i really enjoy rhis kindle!!! (ashley wrote this 4 mi lil sis<3) but i also enjoy it , it keeps her quiet 4 dahh whole day thank ya lawwd!!! Ohh and its NEW YEARS!!!! Happy new years guys L0L im off topic but oh well!!!!!!~

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Amy G. Divel "amyd"
Reviews.Content: This is the first tablet I have had.  It does everthing I expected it to.  Very easy to use!  Love it!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: VJAW
Reviews.Content: Keep this new Kindle at your fingertips to enjoy the massive variety of apps, color and and internet look ups.  Does not limit my curiosity.

Reviews.Title: Loved it but...
Reviews.Author: Kindryll
Reviews.Content: I had to return it. I have arthritis and it was just too big for me. However it was perfect except for that! Wonderful color apps, so easy to use right out of the box. I got the smaller size and its perfect, I never leave home without it! If you are looking for a larger tablet you can't go wrong with this, it's wonderful!

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: J. Rodarmel "jim"
Reviews.Content: I was never much of a reader, but I am now.  I love reading on my Kindle.  I find it hard to put down.  I've downloaded several books, and a couple of movies too!  I strongly recommend this!!

Reviews.Title: Great video quality
Reviews.Author: Luke2080
Reviews.Content: To be clear, I use a tablet for two reasons: reading books and watching movies.  Thats it.This thing is light, and the video quality is great.  Already a good addition to my laptop bag on flights.  And I can play Angry Birgs on a big screen.  So maybe three reasons I use a tablet.I plan to test out skype and some other features, and I'll update as I do.  For now, very content with its ability to let me consume content.  :-)

Reviews.Title: my hubby likes it
Reviews.Author: shielateodoro36
Reviews.Content: Got this as a Christmas gift for my hubby and he really likes it.  But, there's not a lot of cases available in the market for it so he's wary of taking it along on trips.  And I didn't order the fast charger with it, so USB charging via his laptop is a SLOW process.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9" Review
Reviews.Author: Vicki L.
Reviews.Content: Wow I am so busy learning all I can on the Kindle Fire and will take me some time to get it all I want it to be. I just love my Kindle reader, will have to update that soon.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Carl Riley
Reviews.Content: Love being able to read books and magazines without lugging them around. Never thought I''d say that, since I was always steadfastly against it. It'll help control my magazine collection, instead of having them all around, cluttering up the house.It's a bit slow to boot up, but otherwise, it is great!

Reviews.Title: Great gift
Reviews.Author: Linda (the purple one)
Reviews.Content: As a reader and writer this is a great resource. Looking forward to exploring all the new options.  Reading a book electronically will be a new experience.

Reviews.Title: Christmas gift,  my husband just loves it.
Reviews.Author: pauline georgakis
Reviews.Content: The fire can do so much, stream movies, watch tv programs, besides the books.  It even shows the cover of allThe books you have read so you can find previously read books easily.

Reviews.Title: Kids love it!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We bought each of our daughters (10 and 12) a Kindle Fire 8.9 HD for Christmas and they love it.  They gave my wife back her iPad and have not asked for it since.  My only complaints are: 1. The lack of a wall charger - the USB charger takes over 10 hours to charge it from a PC or MAC - way too slow, AND, 2. its lack of USB and MicroSD ports.  I know Amazon does not want to allow storage expansion to force more folks into using the Cloud, but it is still the major problem with these devices,LOTS of apps available now - my girls were able to find most of their favorite iPad games and at lower prices.

Reviews.Title: Big and Bold
Reviews.Author: Debra Miller
Reviews.Content: Very lightweight but lots of power. I love this so much more than my first Kindle fire.Crystal clear screen and vivid colors

Reviews.Title: A really good tablet
Reviews.Author: Carl
Reviews.Content: I have the Kindle Fire HD 8.9, 32 gb for a few weeks now - it's really good.  Don't compare to other tablets like IPad's.  I bought this to suit my needs such as reading books. entertainment like watching movies, TV shows which all can be done through Prime, HBO GO, and downloading APPS to read newspapers.  Sure, the number of APPS are less than other devices, but there are plenty to satisfy.  The screen is very sharp and clear, was really easy to set-up.  And for all the reviews that say no FLASH on this device, that's the standard now for most all tablets - by the way, there are great ways to get flash on this device if you want(Just google it and then it will tell you how you will have FLASH.  Just know what you want in a tablet.  I use it mostly for reading books, newspapers, E-Mail, play games and watch movies and TV shows - suits all my needs.  Also I find it to be fast and responsive.  Also, if you want a really good warranty on it, buy from a retailor such as Best Buy, Staples... and call SquareTrade and you can get full coverage including accident coverage for under $100.00 !! - for 3 years!!(ask for a discount coupon code - they gave me one for 35% off) Can't beat that

Reviews.Title: LOV IT!!!
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: I love everything about my new Kindle Fire HD!!! It has great color and sound. I am still learning all that it can it do. Amazon has had excellent customer service when I have called with questions. The only downside I have found is that Amazon should include a house charger for the Kindle.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Wanda Binz
Reviews.Content: I am loving my kindle fire. It is so versatile. The color is so brilliant I can't believe it is a kindle fire HE.

Reviews.Title: Really Impressed
Reviews.Author: Norman R. Thompson
Reviews.Content: I am really impressed with the quality of this product. The video screen is very clear and is down loads quickly. Will be using for a long while.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Donna Maria Welch "Maria Welch"
Reviews.Content: This was perfect for the need.  Gave 2of these to family which did not need an iPad but needed similar functionality and less expensive.  Set up was easy, loading apps quick, graphics fantastic. Both were excited and enjoy was they received. Sine most of the pictures are stored on the cloud, the space was not an issue. I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: The best budget tablet out there.
Reviews.Author: Thomas Briggs
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations for the Kindle Fire HD 8.9.  I've owned an iPad 1 since it launched, and while I love it, it's recently slowed down and isn't compatible with iOS 6.  So, I had been considering moving on to a more current tablet.  The newest iPad was an obvious choice, but when I considered what I primarily used the iPad for - reading books and comics, surfing the internet while on the couch, watching video - I realized that I didn't necessarily NEED to live within Apple's ecosystem.  Sure, they offer a ton more apps, but I don't use enough of them to justify another $500 purchase.So, I looked to either the Nexus 10 or Kindle Fire HD 8.9.  Ultimately, I chose the Kindle Fire HD because of its integration with the Amazon store.  I'm already a Prime member, I have a vast library of Kindle books, and I use they're Cloud music player because it works with just about any device I'd want.I'm glad I went with the Kindle Fire HD 8.9.  It's a good, not great, device.  When I first received it, and put it through its paces, I was a little disappointed.  It doesn't run as smooth as the iPad, and again, few apps are as polished.  And then there's Silk... the world's worst browser.  It's slow, clunky, and doesn't do anything better than any other browser out there.  Fortunately, the more time I spent with the Kindle Fire HD, the more I learned about it and came to enjoy it.When you get past the fact that it's not the iPad, you can appreciate the Kindle Fire HD for what it is - an amazing e-reader that also happens to be an adequate tablet.  Seriously, this is the best Kindle experience you'll find.  Books are baked seamlessly into the OS, the Kindle UI is excellent, X-Ray is cool, and the text to speech feature works amazingly well.  Not the Audible option, mind you, but the standard text to speech option available on any book.Besides book integration, the Kindle Fire excels at delivering all Amazon content, which should be obvious.  Movies are quick to load, music stored in the Cloud work perfectly, and photos are easily synced with your Facebook account.  Again, it's just a darn good personal tablet.  The fact that it's $200 less than an entry level iPad shouldn't be ignored either.Outside of seamless access to Amazon content, the best reason to own a Kindle Fire HD 8.9 is its beautiful screen.  As someone who owned an iPad before it had a retina screen, I can tell you the difference is staggering.  Everything is clear and crisp.  Reading is enjoyable, and movies have excellent black levels.  For an avid comic reader like myself, the Kindle Fire HD is a godsend.  Even though the size of the screen is slightly smaller than that of an actual comic book, everything is perfectly legible because of the high resolution.In short, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Kindle Fire HD 8.9.  It's not an iPad, but really, you shouldn't have expected it to be.  It's a great reader (books and comics) and video player, and has an adequate number of tablet apps.  Is the lack of specialty apps worth the $200 savings?  I'd say so.  Especially if you're already knee deep in the Amazon ecosystem.  If you're a Prime member, and also use the Cloud Music Match service, it's close to a must buy.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9" Review
Reviews.Author: Margie Burns
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the Kindle Fire HD 8.9", but I had a hard time operating it at first, have gotten better but just wish that there were better instructions on line.  I like it enough to keep it though.

Reviews.Title: I love it so far!
Reviews.Author: J. Fortner "jennfortner07"
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle so far. I was a little disappointed in the one book a moth prime sharing. Somehow i didn't know it was one a month. I read a book in a day! I was disappointed in that. I have found that you can link to your public library and get free books to check out. I would recommend this to anyone who loves to read and use the internet.

Reviews.Title: Enjoying my Kindle Fire!
Reviews.Author: Ann J.
Reviews.Content: I like the size and ease of using my kindle.  I have had it for a month, I do not use my laptop anymore.  It exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire 8.9
Reviews.Author: rowdybob
Reviews.Content: This tablet is outstanding, but amason is more outstanding for their customer service. I have never dealt with a company so customer friendly .

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD Love
Reviews.Author: Gail Johnson
Reviews.Content: Broke down and added another kindle to our family of kindles.  Love this 8.9 Kindle HD.  The display and sound are much better for streaming video.  I really enjoy the 'larger' screen.  I have not noticed any problems in streaming.  Actually think its much better than my 7".  We love all our kindles, every one of them.  The only odd thing on the new Kindle is the front facing camera if used for anything other than skype.  We are a kindle family and love each and every one of them.

Reviews.Title: Lovin' it!
Reviews.Author: Rita L
Reviews.Content: I haven't had a whole lot of time to play but have done some reading and the bigger screen is great. A couple of new features to get used to but that's fun as well. There have been so many in depth reviews on this product already that I'll just keep it short and say I love it!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Jane E. Borsick "ScorchedAngel08"
Reviews.Content: Great item.  Was very pleased with the product and what it can do.  The functions area could be made a little easier to read/

Reviews.Title: KINDLE FIRE HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: SHIRLEY TERRY
Reviews.Content: Love it & very excited when I received it.  Have not had much time to play & learn things but thus far no complaints.  The size is just perfect & I can carry it my purse anywhere I go.  Woo hoo!!!!!

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Domingo Ordaz
Reviews.Content: excellente product was what I expected, I loved it, hope to buythank you very much, all very well, immediate response

Reviews.Title: super fast!!!
Reviews.Author: william seiger
Reviews.Content: great tablet .surfing the web, playing games, watching videos ,it's just a great value. I didn't want to spend a lot of money

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: bmd3427
Reviews.Content: I am totally happy with this tablet.  The picture is great, the sound is great, the ease of access to the internet, apps and all features make this tablet amazing. Really gives iPad a run for its money, and no iTunes, the worst operating system.  The android market is easy to use and you are able to find most apps on common with iTunes.  There are vert very few short comings, such as the need to purchase an app to use the built on camera and no rear facing camera, but all in all, amazing product and amazon staff is so helpful and always readily available.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 32 GB
Reviews.Author: Bonnie
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd. Kindle!!!! I am very happy that I purchased the Kindle Fire HD 8.9.I never was a reader before, but now I'm always reading, thanks to Kindle!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: New user
Reviews.Author: L. C. Marschall
Reviews.Content: I like it; however, there are no directions and when I go to help sites & check on line - what instructions there are don't explain procedures completely for someone who is brand new to a Kindle.  Furthermore, I've new had a device like this - not even a cell phone.

Reviews.Title: bluetooth
Reviews.Author: teddy
Reviews.Content: i see that kindle fire supports bluetooth - instead of using the touch keypad, simply purchase a bluetooth keyboard - microsoft makes a gorgeous mini that comes with a cover that acts as a stand for a tablet!

Reviews.Title: you get what you paid for and a lot less than you expected
Reviews.Author: Andrew Edmundson
Reviews.Content: Since the only thing that Amazon seems to be able to dream up in their marketing is that kindle fire has a lower price than other competing products it should be no surprise that it is an inferior product. It is a mediocore performer as a reader and Silk is a joke. Constantly crashing with even the simplest browsing.Amazon should be embarassed by quality and performance of their product and even after a few years of many complaints  from users offered no update to improve Silk.Over a year of frustrating attempts to use my Kindle Fire and still Disappointed .

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Tere
Reviews.Content: I've had people come and ask me what I have.  Can you say green?  People who have other mini-laptops are so green!  I feel sorry for them.  The HD is crisp, the audio is great -- even without headphones that I recommend be used to get the full enjoyment.  As I am a member of Prime, I can tell you watching movies on this is just an incredible experience (especially when husband is asleep next to you and you wear headphones!) and I love it.The ONLY problem I have is wi-fi just SUCKS up the battery charge.  I haven't bought the FAST battery charger yet -- next payday -- but you'll want one.  And probably a keyboard, if you prefer to type rather than using a stylus.  I use this to take notes in class, and it is wonderful!  (See my review of the HP wireless printer, the HP 8600 Premium Pro -- I can print my notes right from my Kindle!)I thought about the HDX, but heard the rear camera wasn't all that great, I can't advise to that.  The special ads I've already learned to overlook them; they aren't that intrusive.  When I bought my model, it wasn't available without the ads, so I just got it. I'm not sorry I saved the money, LOL.  There are more apps than you'll ever need (be careful to read ALL the reviews and take heed as I've bought a few that just don't work!).  If you don't need the rear camera or the "Mayday" key (I don't) then buy this.  Also highly recommended is the extra two year warranty plan.

Reviews.Title: We were lied to and misled
Reviews.Author: B. K. Wallen
Reviews.Content: The kindle is not a bad book reader. Having said that however, anyone with children BEWARE!  First, the default is one click purchasing.  This will usually cost you around $50 if you catch it quick enough.  Much, MUCH more if you don't.  No kid can resist instant gratification with a single click, consequences down the road.  GAMERS BEWARE!  Most free games have many, many add-ons available for PURCHASE (think 'one click' ease).  Recently our device completely reset itself (Amazon blames us). Guess what happens to every purchase (other than books) ever made.  THEY COMPLETELY DISAPPEAR!!  No problem, you purchased these via Amazon one click so they can be restored. Right?  WRONG.  Amazon advised they keep none of this.  Try going to each individual 'developer' of these apps to try to restore your purchases.  We are not sure how to figure out exactly who each developer is as the purchases are listed simply as 'Cuddly Puppy' and such.  No developer info is given and we are not sure which game each add on goes with or how the developer will be able to go back through amazon and provide this for us.  Will their customer service be like amazon's?  Hope not.  No more add on game purchases and NO MORE KINDLES for us.  We are extremely disappointed in Amazons business model for the Kindle.  Apparently it is just an income producing shopping conduit for Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Very disatisfied customer!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Art Liberatore
Reviews.Content: Total BS, you pay close to $300.00 for the equipment  to get, and it comes with a cord and no plug.  If that's a way of doing business, trying to squeeze even more money out a consumer then I want no parts of any anything this company sells.  If I could of given no stars, I would have.  I will tell all my friends and family about this and recommend they go else where!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Donna Lynch
Reviews.Content: I am a faithful Kindle owner, also have several friends I have encouraged to buy a Kindle, so it pains me to say I am disappointed with this purchase. I bought this as a Christmas present for myself. I went with the bigger size, but opted for just the HD because of the price.First off, the larger size makes it hard for me to hold in the palm of my hand (and I have big hands, really).It's really, really, really HEAVY!!!  I knew it weighed more than the HDX (kinda wonder why that is?), but figured it couldn't be THAT heavy...it is.I didn't buy the charger plug, thinking I had just bought a new one and it should work...wrong.  So, I am forking out another $20 to buy the plug, based on reviews I've seen here. Wondering why this wasn't included without the full charger.  Like buying a car without a gas tank.It takes FOREVER to charge, and on top of that it no way stays charged for 10 hours, more like 4.Now I know why I saved $70 on this purchase. Amazon is trying to get rid of this lemon of a tablet.Extremely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: I'm disappointed.
Reviews.Author: Jacquelyn Briggs "carb queen"
Reviews.Content: It freezes constantly and I have to restart.  Also, it doesn't support  flash, which I had on the original 7" Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE Kindles......when they work
Reviews.Author: Motherskiss "PROUD AMAZON ADDICT"
Reviews.Content: I have had 4 Kindles. The first time I received the Kindle Fire (1st gen) I knew the charging design was flawed. Sure enough not 6 months later...charging problems. by that time the 2nd gen was born. I was hopeful all would be well. Nope charging problems. So I am sitting here having gone almost two weeks without my Kindle. I requested a replacement the moment the screen flashed out never to turn on again. That was almost two weeks ago. I have been calling Amazon everyday since. Finally yesterday they agreed my replacement should have been here by now, so they sent out another. Hopefully it wont take a week to get here. i had to actually pick up a paper book to read. Made my earth footprint just a little bigger.

Reviews.Title: Love this Kindle!!!
Reviews.Author: Jorge Salinas
Reviews.Content: I had bought my wife a kindle fire before.  She loved it very much and got great use out of it.  I had no idea what to buy her for her birthday and saw this advertised on your website.  After a little bit of research, I found this would be an ideal gift for her.  At first she was taken back by it being much larger than her other Kindle, but she quickly adapted.  I hardly see my wife anymore, to be honest.  She is lost in the world of kindle.  :)

Reviews.Title: wifi connectin issues.
Reviews.Author: barry massey
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle fire hd and all you can do with it...except for the wifi issue. The device will not stay connected to the wifi. I have to go in and turn off wifi and then turn back on every time I use it. Otherwise it is a great product.

Reviews.Title: Personally, it works for me
Reviews.Author: L. Semmel
Reviews.Content: I have had my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" 16G for roughly 3-4 months. I originally did not want a tablet; I already had a Kindle 3G (which I love) and a smart phone (which I hate) and my desktop computer for internet when I needed to do something online. I have been pleasantly surprised. I am not technologically dumb, or especially tech-savy, but contrary to many reviews I read I found the Fire to be pretty easy to use. Maybe because I took time to figure it out and had no preconceived notions or expectations? I don't know.Short versioin: Do I like it? Yes! Could I live without it? Yes. Are there things I would change? Of course. But I like it! :DLong version:-Physical features. Heavier than I expected, but manageable. Occasionally I turn it off without meaning to, usually when I'm trying to adjust the volume and hit power instead. I wish the power button lit up when plugged in to let you know if it was fully charged or charging. Its kind of wierd that the speakers are on the back of the device; the sound can either be amplified or dampened depending on where and how you have it sitting. It does not come with a charger, only a USB cord, which I think is stupid, but since I already had one from my Kindle 3G it wasnt as big a deal as it would have been. It does charge a little slower than I expected, and the battery only lasts about 8-10 hours, less if you're playing a game.-Readablilty. I like that I can adjust the screen brightness for interior light. BUT the screen glares horribly outside, even in the shade. If I know I'm going to be outside, I take my Kindle 3G instead. Otherwise, I have no problems.-Ease of use. I don't know how other tablets are set up, since this is my first, but I find it fairly easy. The carousel holds all of the content you have accessed recently so you can scroll through and find what you want. There are also tabs at the top marked games, books, apps, etc so that you can search by media type. There is a search bar above that, but I haven't used it at all so can't say whether or not it's good. When away from the home page, a bar at the bottom offers home, back, search, and favorite buttons. You drag down the top bar for settings, which is where you go for parental controls, applications, security, etc. Books in the carousel tell you the percentage you've read at the top corner, but I do wish I could sort my books into "read", "new", etc, like the regular Kindles. Overall, I think it's pretty simple.-Preloaded content. The HD comes preloaded with a few things I find helpful, such as Skype, Facebook, Pandora, and an email management program that allows me access to multiple email accounts from one location, which I really like. It also comes with Kindle Free Time (which my kids are mostly too old for), OfficeSuite (which I'm still trying to figure out if I even need) and IMDB (which for me is a waste of space). You cannot remove these from the device. Why must this stuff take up space if I am not going to use it, EVER? They are not necessary, so why are they there? That's that much more space I could have for books! But then again, they only bug me when I notice them, which is not very often.-Silk browser/WiFi. I had a bit of trouble connecting to the internet at first, but a 15-20 minute phone conversation with tech support got the problem (my router, not the Kindle) sorted out. I have taken my Kindle all over and had no problems with the WiFi anywhere that has a signal, even a low one. Even out in the boonies. Silk browser works fine for me, have no problems with speed unless my internet service is being wonky. It comes with Bing.com as the default search engine, but you can change this in the settings. Absolutely love that I can use it for recipes without having to drag the laptop to my tiny kitchen!-Movie/sound quality. I have only watched YouTube and FB videos so far, so no movie opinions yet. YT and FB seem to be fine, relative to the quality uploaded to the site. Sound is better than my laptop, not as good as my iPod. Again, wierd that the speakers are on the bottom.-Camera. I dislike that the camera only faces one way. To take pics of something other than yourself, you have to turn it and look at a wierd angle. Pic quality was not great, either, but that might have been operator error.-Shopping. The Fire HD has two quick-links to Amazon shopping; the "Shop" tab at the top, and the "Shop Amazon" widget in the carousel. My biggest complaint is that when shopping for books and apps the page is a little hard to navigate. In all fairness, I'm comparing the "computer store" to the "tablet store", but it seems that some categories available on the computer are not available on the tablet. I can still find what I'm looking for, but it takes longer, especially if just browsing.-The ads. A lot of people have a problem with the preloaded ads on the Kindle. If an ad doesn't interest me, I don't pay it any attention, just like tv. The recommendations at the bottom of the carousel also don't bother me, and if they do, I can turn it off. If you think they will bother you, then either get the more expensive one with no preloaded ads, or pay the $15 or whatever to have them removed.

Reviews.Title: I love the larger tablet size
Reviews.Author: Joan M Robbins
Reviews.Content: My previous Kindle Fire was stolen so when I went to replace it, I once again went with the Kindle.I like the video capability and with the larger screen it's even easier.any apps are great.As always, reading on my Kindle and with Amazon Prime I have so many options, is so much easier than carrying books aroundIf only I could take it in the tub with me, I'd be a truly happy camper.

Reviews.Title: Made her day
Reviews.Author: Glenn Whitworth
Reviews.Content: Her old Kindle HD 7" would not charge any more.  Oh me!  I called customer service, wow!  That was a very good call.  They hooked me up with the newest Kindle, gave me almost what I paid for the old one, we had had it for 2 years I think.  And shipped me the new one that day.  My wife loves the new one even more than the old one!  And if she is happy, I am happy!

Reviews.Title: Love my new kindle!!
Reviews.Author: Melissa M
Reviews.Content: I will try to make this review short and sweet. Why did I buy the Kindle Fire HD 4G LTE?Reason number 1  -  my husband was always on our Mac.Reason number 2 -  I have an older  Kindle Wifi  (not a tablet) with a  number of books I had downloaded and still wanted to read.Reason number 3 - It was cheaper than an IPAD and wanted something reasonable in price.I'm very happy with the device. Very easy to download any applications, my 4 year old twins love watching movies and looking through photos.  I carry this device with me in my purse while commuting to work I check email, FB, read, order groceries etc.Overall very pleased with my decision for buying this product.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful and Useful
Reviews.Author: Kat Orman
Reviews.Content: I bought a Kindle Fire HD 8.9" back in February I wanted to wait a little while before reviewing it to make sure I could cover everything. I LOVE my kindle fire!!! I'm a student and having access to course websites or reference pages has been absolutely invaluable when I'm on campus but even my netbook tended to weigh down by backpack with everything else I have to carry on a regular basis so this was the perfect solution. It has all the functions I seek in a netbook but at a much better weight.True it's only 16 gb of memory but for me that wasn't an issue. I have an iPod for music so I didn't need to clog this up with downloadable music, though it is possible to use this for such. I mostly use my kindle for documents, internet access, games, and Netflix.Touch ScreenThe screen has always been very responsive, never had any issues with it.DocumentsThe document system is a little different at first because you have to email things to your kindle account but it's very easy once you figure it out and the things you've sent arrive quickly! Just remember to add your email to the safe list on Amazon so it knows to receive.InternetI've never had much trouble with the internet myself. One page I routinely visit doesn't work properly on the Kindle but that same site also doesn't work when I try to access it from a smart phone. There have been times when the silk network has had to restart usually because too many tabs are open and the system is a little overloaded, my fault.AppsThere are tons of apps, and plenty are free so there's no shortage of stuff to amuse you when you have some downtime. Lots of games and it does work with Netflix if you have a internet connection.I've used Netflix a few times and its streams absolutely beautifully on the Kindle Fire. Amazing HD quality and the audio is great too.Special OffersThese are not intrusive to your Kindles functions. I have them on this Kindle as well as an older kindle with a keyboard and they have never been a bother. They just pop up on the standby screen and go away once you unlock.ReadingI personally do not use this Kindle for reading too often because I prefer the graphite e-ink of the older models myself but I have used it for some textbook use and its been a wonder compared to lugging around the large books.CameraI rarely use the camera, this is probably the one thing that has been the least impressive about the Kindle Fire. The camera's quality is not great it seems almost as if the camera was an afterthought on the system. Added because people can use things such as Skype but certainly not made for major usage.MiscThe box comes with a basic computer USB charger. If you have a cell phone or MP3 player that uses a USB optional wall charger then this will plug in and you can charge it through a wall as well. If not you will need a computer to charge the kindle and it is a low power charger so if you're actively using the kindle at the time it will remain alive but not charge. The wall chargers I've used seem to charge the system MUCH faster than when I leave it hooked to my computer off.There is no screen protector or case that comes with the basic purchase so if you're concerned for the safety of your Kindle definitely consider ordering those as well.

Reviews.Title: By far the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 Tablet is the best Android Tablet on the market
Reviews.Author: Tablet Seeker
Reviews.Content: I have been very pleased with the quality and speed of the new Kindle Fire HD. The screen is gorgeous and the build quality is exceptional. The only thing lacking in any way for my taste is the keyboard which can lag at times, but even this I can live with. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this tablet to friends and family members.

Reviews.Title: not as expected
Reviews.Author: worldwriter "worldwriter"
Reviews.Content: While I love the graphic display and can (FINALLY) adjust my pdf. files from school so that I can read them easily (my small Fire is not very good at this), I am really disappointed at the recurring problems with the WiFi. The WiFi connection at home (and everywhere else) constantly needs the password reentered; not only does it do this when I shut off the machine and restart it, it does it all by itself as I am using it!  I also was hoping I would be able to read my magazines on it--on the small Fire I cannot read most magazines because the magazine appears to control the size of the print, and it remains too small for me. On the large Fire, I can read the magazines, but again, they often don't increase in size as much as I would like them to, the way the books and pdf files do. Can't Amazon do something to correct this problem? I have not bought the Fire, small or large, for several older relatives because of this very problem.  In addition, the speed of the unit on the web is disappointing. I use a laptop as well, and the same WiFi connection is speedy on that, but arduous on Kindle Fire 8.9". I have largely stopped using it for this, and am wondering if I should have gone for an I-pad after all. We are a family with a bunch of Kindles of various types, and generally love them as e-readers, but this one is mostly just another pretty face, I think.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Lloyd
Reviews.Content: I have only had my Kindle Fire HD for over an hour, and I am just blown away by it. The super sharp pics and graphics are unreal. I am really happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Enjoying my Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Shopper Girl
Reviews.Content: Easy set up and great screen.  Good for reading books and answering email.  Only problem that I had was with Verizon, which is not always compatible, but fortunately other Kindle users that had similar problem, helped me out.  Great device for supplementing an older smart phone.  I would like a manual included with the purchase, still trying to figure out all that it will do.  Disappointed with the camera feature, but that was not a criterior for my purchase.  Lots that I still have to learn about using the Kindle Fire, but so far, so good.

Reviews.Title: Really, really great!
Reviews.Author: Alicia Brown
Reviews.Content: For my birthday two years ago, I was given a first generation Kindle with the keyboard, no touch screen. I had been looking at them but I preferred the smell and feel of the actual book although I hated the idea that I killed trees every time I bought one. However, I quickly fell in love with my Kindle!I decided to splurge when I got my tax refund this year and bought the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" with 32GB of memory. I hated to give away the birthday Kindle or to just put it away and not use it because it's still a very good Kindle if all you want to do is read. I do have Scrabble on it and I loved playing that. So it's on loan to my youngest sister indefinitely. Call me sentimental but I don't like to part with gifts given to me by loved ones.Anyway, I love my new Kindle but I do have two little complaints. One: Um, where is Scrabble for the Fire HD? I'm waiting... Two: No rear camera. I did resea

Reviews.Title: Works for me
Reviews.Author: Malcolm Nunes "gownupgeek"
Reviews.Content: My wife has and ipad and she put it down to take over my kindle for the first week I had it.  Can't add much to that.I will also congratulate the product development guys - the kindle HD got me to upgrade to amazon prime.  The extra content that I can view, and the HDMI out to my TV just made this well worth it.

Reviews.Title: Great Value but could be more functional for users
Reviews.Author: STLFRADTWEWRTPAPRG
Reviews.Content: We bought the Kindle Fire HD to have for the kids to use instead of the iPad and for the HDMI out to watch video on the TV.  On the positive side, it is a great value and operates smoothly.  The HDMI output to the TV is sharp, though sometimes experience slight delay in the video.  Disappointments include not being able to use Google apps like YouTube and in general the much smaller number of apps available vs the iPad.  Our kids still end up using the iPad most of the time due to being able to find more apps they want.  The Kindle Fire is definitely configured to ease your shopping needs with Amazon, but to take it to the next level, Amazon needs to give the user more freedom to use the device as they want.

Reviews.Title: Nothing special
Reviews.Author: john
Reviews.Content: Ive had the origanal kindle for a year now and this doesnt seem much different. The One negitive i find is the speakers do not live up to the hype. My cell phone sounds better.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Bettye Isbell
Reviews.Content: Wow.  Now I know why this Kindle Fire is so great.  I had big problems with the first one thatI received and after receiving the replacement, it was so easy to add my wi-fi, facebook, email,etc that it almost scared me. I love reading and now I have something that I can take with meeverywhere (except the doctor's office where the wi-fi does not work). Thanks again for the great product!It arrived in perfect condition and I received it exactly on the date I was told it would be here! I am soexcited about having this Kindel that it is hard to put into words!  In fact, I love it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: I use my Kindle Fire HD more often than I use my laptop.
Reviews.Author: Marsha Holloway "Fast reader"
Reviews.Content: Since getting my Kindle Fire 8.9" 4G I very rarely turn on my laptop computer.  I can surf the net, read books, pay bills and generally do everything I would normally do on another computer.  And I can easily take it with me and use it anywhere.  I also like that I can take pictures with it.  I would like the camera lens to be on both sides so one could easily snap pictures of the kids performing in school or church plays.  However, after some trial and error, those events are recordable with the screen facing away from me.

Reviews.Title: E-Reader Great - Tablet Lacks A Workflow That Works for Me
Reviews.Author: Brian Moellers
Reviews.Content: I was going to avoid writing this because the fatal flaw in this is that I like to create a workflow on a device that works for me.For most normal people that just want a basic UI that they can adjust to, this is actually a great product.First, let me say that I knew this product had its own interface and that it differed from Android. I was okay with that, the main reason that I bought it was for reading technical software books that lose a lot if the code samples are not shown in color and on a larger screen. I still planned on reading my normal books (Physics and Sci-Fi/Fantasy - Yes I am a geek) on my Kindle Touch.The Kindle Fire works great for the purpose and my software books are wonderful to read in full color.The second reason that I purchased it was for the Amazon prime integration. I have prime and the lure of having the tablet play the free movies helped me go this route instead of a regular Android tablet with the Kindle App. Actually I was at first impressed with the quality of this and so were my coworkers. The trivia app is actually cool, but then I began to realize the only time I sit down and watch movies is when I am flying and have really never played with it again. I also found that there is an Android Prime application for the PS3 and so this feature became unimportant real quick. Still a beautiful feature if you are going to use it.So finally, why did I rate it as a mediocre product? Simple, as noted in the previous comments, I am a tech geek and a software developer. I don't think that the interface is bad for the basic user who is not someone like me where I take every device I have and make a workflow that works for me. However this device has no way to do this.An example: My Android Phone. On my phone I lay out my pages by how I use them such as a section for the calendar and a section for games. This is actually similar to the way the Kindle lays out its own pages. The difference is the "home" page. On the Kindle it is a non-useful scrolling of the applications in the order of last use. On my phone, the first thing that greats me is the weather for the day (as I am also a runner/biker/dog walker) and then my work email, personal email. On the Fire, I cannot display the weather but I can get an App for it, go to the apps page, and then load it and then it will be added to the list on the front page in front of my work email. Basically there is no way for the Kindle Fire to greet me with the information I require on first use. So I cannot use it for my daily needs, it becomes a reader.Even the pages that are like my normal workflow have no customization that I can easily find. In the apps, the order on the page is whatever the device decides so finding the weather app is not as easy as if I could put it at the top of the list.The final lack of customization is that you can view photos but you cannot change the screensavers. Okay I am being very picky but customization of the screen saver makes me feel like I own the product and makes the product easy to identify from others. Lay my Fire down with 10 others and I would not be able to identify it quickly at all without buying add ons.In the end I use this as an E-reader for texts that require color for more understanding. I use it maybe once a week since I busy with other work right now. Compare that to my phone which is almost hourly and my Kindle touch which I use to read at home to unwind daily, and this purchase may have not been the best for me. Perhaps a different customizable tablet with the E-Reader app would have been better.However for the general user that doesn't want to bother with the advanced features, I would probably have rated it at a four or a little higher but it just does not meet my life's workflow.

Reviews.Title: Buyers Remorse
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: Overall it's good product, but I should have completed a little more research on the availability of certain apps I expected to be available on the Kindle.  I'm sure it's been addressed by hundreds of people by now, but if you are an Economist subscriber DO NOT expect to be able to read the Economist on your Kindle.  I don't know the details of why Amazon does this (probably to tether all customers to Amazon), but they have an Amazon special Economist program that cost about $10 a month.  Not a bad price for the magazine, but you have to pay for it even if you have a hard copy subscription.  For the extra cost you would be better off buying an iPad.  A little more expensive, but they have free Economist App for subscribers.  There are many other a little things I just expected to be able to download Yahoo sports apps, google maps, etc.  Otherwise technically seems to be a great tablet.  Movies are clear, sound is really impressive, etc.Before you buy it, take a moment to write down all the apps you currently use or think you would like to have access to on your tablet.  Then see if they are actually available on the Kindle.

Reviews.Title: Meh
Reviews.Author: Kiameshya Britt
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Kindle at the request of my employer for trade shows. I am already an iPad owner and if I have to compare the two, I think the iPad is much more user-friendly. The resolution is okay, but if you're looking for an all-purpose tablet, I would just fork over the extra bucks and get an iPad.

Reviews.Title: Ex Toshiba Thrive owner
Reviews.Author: Wilson
Reviews.Content: I am what you might call a tech geek, and having had 4 other tablets I must say I am very happy with this Kindle, the response time is amazing, the app selection is great and the Amazon prime availability is awesome, for $70.00 a year you can watch all kinds of new TV shows and older ones as well, and the movie selction is pretty good...I tottally recommend any one who wants a awesome tablet for a great price to get this one..............

Reviews.Title: It is Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Gwen Davis
Reviews.Content: I bought my 5 year old grandson one for Christmas and enjoyed playing it with him so I bought me one!  I love it!  It is easy to use and setup.  I use it for reading books, playing games, watching tv episodes and movies and checking email.  It is light weight, fits in my purse and I can connect it to wifi anywhere!

Reviews.Title: Geat Product
Reviews.Author: Pablo
Reviews.Content: This tablet is about $100 cheaper than an I-pad and just as good, if not better! I have recommended to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: rita diaz
Reviews.Content: The item arrived almost a week before the promised date! The item was securel packaged and its origonal packaging was intact.

Reviews.Title: One of The Best Kindle Devices Purchased
Reviews.Author: Delores Garner
Reviews.Content: Love it!  Love it!  Love it!Better than I expected.  Great Video and awesome Audio.  The larger display screen is just right for videos.  Super battery life in comparison to the First Generation 7" Kindle Fire.However;  today, I did experience one small glitch.  While watching a movie, there was buffering at least two (2) times at the beginning of the resumption of this movie which I had been watching previously on TV.
