This buffering only took a few seconds.  Afterwards, it was smooth sailing.  No problems encountered.  Hopefully, this is not the norm.  This is the first movie I have watched on this device since purchasing it December 10, 2012.  l will be able to make a better determination after watching a few more movies.  Maybe this is normal.I have yet to use all the features available on this  device.  Many more features offered than on the the First Generation Kindle Fire.  I am still in the learning stage.Overall I am very pleased with the the performance of this Kindle Fire HD 8.9".  Also, the price was very reasonable.  I would highly recommend this device.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Glenda
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle Fire HD 8.9 4G LTE Wireless.So far everything works great.I read a lot of books and I can't seem to put it down for very long.Used other features like email,music,etc. and so far all is great.Only problem I have is  to use ATT for the special promo of $49.99  for first year doesn't tell you you have to go with one of their phone plans before you can have this promo.My phones are with T Moblie and they have similar plan and I don't have to change everything to get 4 G.So its not told to you in the Promo so beware.....This should be told up front...

Reviews.Title: It is what it is
Reviews.Author: robert alan cold
Reviews.Content: I could get really wordy here and am going to try to force myself to be brief. I have read a lot of good and quite a bit of bad. Let me do what I can to dispel some of the reviews that I found to be wrong. First, I am NOT paid my Amazon nor am I compensated by them in any way, nor do I know anyone who works for the company, okay? The product is outstanding for what it is ... it is a media consumption device. This is NOT a tablet. If that is what you want, then go buy an IPAD. For those of you who dislike this product because it is not an IPAD, well, guess what? This is NOT an IPAD. If you want to watch video, play games, and read ... this product will do all of things and do them well enough to stand on it's own feet (forgive the anthropomorphism). Okay, let me dispel a couple of those wrong reviews: 1) You cannot use the device and charge it at the same time. Um ... yes, yes you can. I do it all of the time as do my sons, who both have 7" devices. 2) The speakers do not work well. Really? I'm a little hard of hearing and I have no problem. 3) It takes hours upon hours to charge the devices. Mine all charge in pretty short order I think. Speaking of charging ... it is true ... the Kindle Fire HD does NOT come with a wall charger (REALLY Amazon? No charger???). 4) The quality of the device leaves much to be desired. Really? I have three and each one performs top notch. 5) Amazon's Customer Service is horrible. Yeah, I know this has nothing to do with the device, but I have called these poor people several times since buying the Kindles and each time they have been great, not to mention patient. I figured I HAD to rate them somewhere. Okay, anyway, so much for not being wordy, right? Look, the device does what it is designed to do well. Very well. Would I buy another? In a minute. So why four stars and not five? The power and volume buttons leave a little to be desired. I like that they are almost flush because they do not stand out too much. The problem is that they blend in a little TOO well. I often find myself putting the device to sleep by accident.

Reviews.Title: Fire Baby!!!
Reviews.Author: Orange Lady
Reviews.Content: I have owned a 2nd generation keyboard since 2009.  Now I must say i loved that kindle to no end.  Matter of fact couldn't even fathom replacing.  My sisters have the the Kindle Fire HD and i toyed around with theirs for awhile and decided i just had to have one.  I absolutely adore it.  I love downloaded apps and being able to see my screen without any lights on.  I am a Kindle user for life...

Reviews.Title: What's not to LOVE!
Reviews.Author: Kelley L. Smith
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying I am a huge amazon fan and as much as I was tempted to get an iPad, I just didn't want to give up my kindle environment!  I have owned the kindle keyboar, kindle touch, kindle fire and now, the kindle fire HD 8.9 and I think this shall be my last table purchase!  I love the ease of accessing all of my content - for all of you itunes junkies, yes, you can upload some (if not all) of your music with the amazon cloud player and it is way easier to share with your family than Itunes!  My ownly complaint with the fire platform is that you cannot save books in collections or mark them read....so it does make it a bit difficult to keep track....at least I haven't figured it out!  I am so glad I opted to upgrade to the Fire HD instead of buying an ipad...I'm sure you will be too!

Reviews.Title: Yippee
Reviews.Author: Dee Blatt
Reviews.Content: I can now see my child overseas without getting out of bed and going to the computer, this is great!

Reviews.Title: AMAZING!
Reviews.Author: Giff
Reviews.Content: To call the display "remarkable" would be an insult. The WiFi is fantastic! The operating system is smooth. It holds a charge ridiculously well, and using the "kindle powerfast" I was able to fully charge mine in a little over 3 hours. I' 've been using it for about 4 hours now and still have 72% battery left. The carousel is great, and the overall interface is extremely user friendly! The only flaw I've been able to find is that the autocorrect is imperfect, but that' s true of any autocorrect. This device is simply amazing, and I highly recommend it to anybody and everybody!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 32 GB
Reviews.Author: Gary Ahrens
Reviews.Content: All that I could ask for.Only bad thing is power switch is so smallThese words ar to fill the stupid minimum

Reviews.Title: Great Value for the Money
Reviews.Author: Malinda
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire is a great product.  The resolution is wonderful and it does run a lot of apps.  The only problem I've encountered thus far is with Skype.  The audio works great, but the other party must download Skype for Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: SO FAR
Reviews.Author: Pamela
Reviews.Content: As stated in the subject line so far I am very pleased with my new HD Fire purchase....I am very capable as far as using software which I am familiar with but very cautious with any new software...my goal is to use any particular piece to it's fullest and thererore patienetly move forward and learn about said capabilities....I have found the help provided with the new "FIRE" most patient and accommodating.I am also becoming very excited with the latest "state of the art"  capabilities available to me through the new "KINDLE FIRE HD" I believe the price is most fair when compared to other devices and to date would recommend this as a very serious consideration to purchase.If in the futurue I find any real problems that I can attriubte to the actual device I will most certainly update my review.At the moment I am very excited (my 6 year old granddaughter is totally enthraled with the "FIRE") and am sooooo looking forward to the endless possibilities it may provide.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Hynes
Reviews.Content: Worked as expected, worth the money. Definitely worth the investment. I haven't had any issues with WiFi, even on my work network. Even my iPad friends are jealous

Reviews.Title: Awesome device
Reviews.Author: shayfurk
Reviews.Content: Being a technology addict, I have a number of different devices, such as a Nook, a smart phone, laptop, a couple of desktop pc's etc. After having this new Kindle Fire HD 8.9" only a couple days, I have to say that I'm impressed. I have a wifi router that is located in a large building, quite a distance from my office, and on a different floor. This device gets far better wifi reception than any other device that I own, including my laptop, smart phone, and Nook. At even this distance from the router, Netflix streaming is seamless, with no buffering at all. Web surfing, downloading apps etc. are also relatively quick. When I am closer to the router, speed is lightning fast. Graphics are very nice as well. I'm very happy with this purchase. About the only thing that I don't like is that every app that I use is automatically added to an onscreen carousel. I really like to keep an uncluttered screen, and manually removing these apps from the carousel is somewhat of a pain. There may be a way in settings to disable this feature, but if so, I haven't found it yet. I do like the favorites feature which is easy to use. Having this feature is a better way of accessing what I want quickly and the carousel of recently used apps seems redundant. To me, it would be far better to only add things such as most recently read books to the carousel. That being my only complaint, I would definitely recommend this device to others

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS KINDLE!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Kat 65081
Reviews.Content: WOW Blown away by this Kindle,-  Kindle Fire HD 8.9", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 16 GB - Includes Special Offers  ,  I have an Ipad and Love this so much better and so do the Grandkids, they are 31/2 and 5 yrs old.. SO had to get another for Christmas, took advantage of the $50 off yesterday :)...............  WE ARE HAPPY HAPPY!!!!

Reviews.Title: My Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: R. Graves
Reviews.Content: I really like this kindle.  It is like having your desktop computer in your hands.  The picture is so clear and sound is awesome.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Norm
Reviews.Content: Love it! Use it everyday for my email, games, photos ....nice big screen and leather case fits perfect...just need hdmi cable.

Reviews.Title: Meets all expectations
Reviews.Author: F. Macli
Reviews.Content: Have used the HD 8.9 for three weeks and it has met my expectations. Vast improvement over Fire 1st gen. Only downside is the slow performance of the Silk web browser. Have side loaded the Dolphin browser to get around this issue. Hopefully future software update will address it.

Reviews.Title: my Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Mary Lundrigan
Reviews.Content: I choose this one because i have the regular Kindle Fire and was very happy with it....I love the H. D. and the speakers are nice...Love to watch movies on it!!!I would recommend this to everyone! So easy to use the color is brilliant! You will love it...

Reviews.Title: exactly what I was looking for
Reviews.Author: tizgirl
Reviews.Content: I have previously owned several kindles, from the second generation kindle, kindle keyboard and kindle touch, plus the original kindle fire.  The only things I wasn't thrilled about the original kindle fire are fixed in this one - a larger screen available, 4G option, and other upgrades make it very worth the upgrade.  This new kindle fire is exactly what I was hoping it would be.  The screen is amazing, very responsive to touch.  As usual all of my previous amazon purchases (books, movies, aps and music) were easily downloaded from the cloud to the device.  And am thrilled to finally have access to 4G so I can take it with me more places.  I have an ipod touch and love it for something small, but if you use amazon and especially if you have amazon prime this tablet may be for you.  I will probably always prefer reading on my Kindle Touch, but for magazine, games, movies and internet this is a wonderful addition to the Kindle family.

Reviews.Title: My second Fire - still ambivalent -  update 4
Reviews.Author: dd9000
Reviews.Content: Kindle Fire HD 8.9 - 32 GBUpdate 4: more information about the keyboard, touch screen, appsN.B. This is written for people like me: your first tablet was the original Kindle Fire, and you are trying to decide if you should upgrade to the HD and, if so, whether you should go for the 7" or 8.9"  model.  I assume that you are familiar with the technical specifications (from Amazon, Amazon customers, or other review sites).This is a long review so here's the get-to-the chase summation:1. One cannot comfortably hold a tablet this size in one hand.  This will be obvious to anybody who has a large tablet but for newbies, or those used to a 7" model, the difference is much greater than one might have expected.2. If you decided to get a second Fire rather than one of the alternatives because you figure all your content will be there and you won't have to learn anything new, you will be disappointed.  Anything with a userid/password must be set up again (which would be true if you switched to a different vendor).  Only Amazon content is saved to its cloud.  So if you have books you downloaded from other sites, or applications you have side-loaded, you will have to do that by hand (also true if you change vendors, except you will have to recreate everything). And applications that ran fine on the original Fire may not run at all on the HD.  Also, there are enough differences between the interface on the HD and the original Fire that I think the learning curve is probably just as great as if, say, you switched to a Nexus.3. UPDATED:I thought the original Fire was the deal to end all deals.  It has its limitations but, for the price, I don't think there is a better bargain on the market.  The new HD models are another matter.  These cost "real" money, and I can't unequivocally recommend this tablet. But, I want to be clear here, this is not to say that the HD is a bad device.  It is, simply, that while I could excuse Amazon's pitiful App Store, and UI issues, for a device that cost me $200, I am not willing to excuse those deficiencies for a device that cost me $450 (plus tax).Background:The original Kindle Fire was my first tablet, and I was satisfied with it, in spite of some shortcomings, from Day 1.  I have rarely, if ever gotten so much bang for the buck with a tech purchase.  During election season, I and the Fire rarely parted company.So, why did I buy the HD 8.9 WiFi tablet?  Three reasons: First, although I've been very happy with the Fire, I've run out of application space (something that truly surprised me) and have been shuffling apps in and off the device.  And tablet technology generally has improved in the past year.So, why didn't I just get the 7" HD?  Because, second, after listening to iPad users assert for months (until the mini came out of course) that 7" tablets weren't "real" tablets, I wanted to try out a larger tablet.Third, I wanted to see if magazines, like The New Yorker, and web pages, would look better on a larger tablet. And it seemed to me to make sense to stick with Amazon on the theory that the learning curve would be short.Initial Reactions:After adding in the $15 to get rid of the ads and the $20 for the AC adapter, we're talking $400. Add in $55 for the Amazon cover, and we're up to $450. (See my review for the cover; I am not happy with it.)Is it fair to include these extra costs?  Yes.  According to Amazon, if you charge this tablet via your computer's USB, it will take 14 hours.  Right, 14 hrs.  The "fast" charger does the job in 5 hrs. (about half the battery life, 10 hrs., cited by Amazon.) But Amazon considers the "fast" charger to be an optional accessory?  It was excluded from the base price for the same reason that Amazon charges extra to get rid of the ads: to hit the price point it wanted to hit.  The AC adapter should have been part of the price.  As for the ads, I think Amazon should have offered the ads as a way to reduce the price rather than the other way round.UPDATE:I have had the 8.9" for 7 days now and I may update these remarks, but, in general, although I am not as disappointed as I was at the end of the first day, I am still not thrilled.  As I said before, my threshold for satisfaction re a $450+ device is higher than for a $199 device and perhaps it was too much to expect that I would love the 2nd generation product as much as the 1st generation product.Size:iPad owners are nuts.  A tablet this size is no doubt better for watching videos than a 7" tablet.  But it is only marginally better at displaying web pages. (I'll get to magazines in a moment.).  It feels heavier than the original Fire, but the main problem is simply the size, at least for somebody my size.  It is, quite simply, too big to hold comfortably with one hand, and if one needs two hands, well, then one has to make some kind of adjustment.  NOTE: I am not blaming Amazon.  I obviously knew I was getting a large tablet and bought a large tablet on purpose.  If you have a 7" tablet and are thinking of getting a larger size, I can't emphasize enough that the experience of holding a large tablet is very different from that of holding a smaller tablet. So think about how you use your tablet.  To read books, surf the web, watch videos?UPDATE:  With both Fires next to me (the original 7 inch and the new 8.9 inch) which one do I automatically reach for?  The 7 inch. It is simply way more comfortable to hold in one hand.  And I can throw it in a backpack or messenger bag to take with me.  If I keep the 8.9 inch, it will be for home use only.User Interface:Amazon does not make good use of the added real estate.  When you turn on the HD, you get the carousel, absent the physical representation (the icons sort of  "float" on the screen), on top of "suggestions" which change with the items on the carousel.  I found that annoying, so I turned off the "suggestions" in the Settings.I had assumed, naively, that with a larger screen, I would be able to see more items.  But Amazon chose to increase the size of the icons rather than use smaller ones to fit more on a screen.  This design decision exists throughout the software: books, videos, web, everything.  Amazon has simply increased the size of the icons so one doesn't get any more items per screen than on the 7".  The ones on the carousel, on the opening screen, are HUGE. If you have vision problems, you may appreciate this decision, but I wish Amazon would offer a resize option. UPDATE:  Under Bookmarks (Web section), you get 3 screens of 3 broad icons showing the top of your web pages.  On the original Fire,  you get 12 thumbnails showing about ¾ of the web page (bottom row shows about ½ of the web page).Amazon has also introduced a number of changes in the UI, from how to get to the settings, to the way you get to the home button, to the options in Silk - well, I could go on, but if your primary reason for buying a new model Fire is because you assume it will be easier than learning the interface for a different vendor's product - you are in for an unpleasant surprise.  Yes, vendors are always changing the UI, but I have yet to find a change that makes using the HD easier than using the original. So for me, so far, the changes come under the "why on earth did the vendor do this?" category.The most annoying change for me is the list of options at the top of the first screen.  They are, in order, Shop, Games, Apps, Books, Music, Videos, Newsstand, Audiobooks, Web, Photos, Docs.  Notice what the first is? Shop. And if you want to get to the Web, you have to swipe left because the first page display ends at Newsstand.  Yes, you can use the carousel or favorites to get where you want faster, but Amazon, please, pretty please, let us organize the sequence to match how we use the HD.UPDATE: The touch screen on the original Fire has always seemed to me to be way too sensitive.  Stuff launches, scrolls, etc. when I've barely breathed on an item.  The touch screen on the HD seems much less sensitive.  Sometimes I have to press quite hard for an action to occur.  No happy middle, I guess.Externalities:Others have mentioned that it is hard find and distinguish between the external volume and on/off button.  They are different sizes, however, so I think most people will get "trained" to recognize which is which.  Still I suspect we will always find ourselves running our fingers from the edge in because there is no way to "see" either button.  And since it is awfully easy to accidentally turn off the HD while you are feeling along the edge for the volume button, if you are right-handed and go in from that edge, it is probably wise to teach yourself to move in from the left edge for volume, right edge to turn off.  UPDATE: I am no longer accidentally turning the HD off, but I do still need to "search" carefully with my fingers to find the right button.There is no charging light (red/green), so the only way you know for sure that it is charging, or to see if it has finished charging, is to turn the Fire on, pull down to get the options, select more, choose device, get battery usage. Or get a battery monitor and make it a favorite.  This is just foolish beyond words.The USB and HDMI connectors are now in the middle of the long edge.  UPDATE: This was not a good idea.  First: you cannot reorient some games (this includes Angry Birds) in landscape mode.  And the position they like is the one with the USB connector on the bottom.  So you cannot play one of these games and recharge the HD at the same time.  I tried a video and it did re-orient itself properly but in Amazon's cover, the HD still can't be used while charging because of the way Amazon designed the "stand" part of the cover.  Also, I find it disconcerting to have the USB cable right where my hand is (vertical orientation, either side) when I am using the HD while it is charging.  With the original, which I always use "upside down", the cable is at the top so it doesn't matter whether the electrical outlet is to my left or right.  With the HD, it does matter.BooksThere is STILL no way to organize your books into genres.  You can only sort by name, title or most recent.  No doubt Amazon wants people who read a lot to spend $250 for the latest Paperwhite Kindle.  That's the only excuse I can think of for treating reading on the Fires differently than reading on the non-Fires.UPDATE: With Amazon's cover/stand, there is no way that I can find for charging the HD while reading if you want the book propped horizontally so you ccn read while lying on your side. (The cable gets squished.) And reading is also just far more comfortable with the 7 inch, which is pretty much the size of a largish paperback.Applications - UPDATED Nov. 25.A couple of the applications I depend on, like Dropbox and GoToApp (which I think is essential for anybody who has more than a dozen or so applications), did not work on the day I got the HD.  I was able to sideload Dropbox and SugarSync, which I prefer, is in the App Store. The paid version of GoToApp now works on the HD and I have bought it.  There are still other applications that don't work, but they matter much less to me.  Your experience may be better or worse.None of the Angry Birds games I bought (the original, Rio or Seasons) will run on the HD.  They do not even show up in the "cloud' when viewed from the HD.  In a way, this is irrelevant since Amazon doesn't save your games to the cloud.  So, even if you could downlad them, you'd have to start all over.  But it is still irritating to find out that games I paid for, and bought from Amazon, will not run on the HD.  (I have applications designed for Windows 95 that run under Windows 7 without change.)I haven't yet tried all my apps. To get them to your new device, you must download each and every one which, given the number of apps, and the speed of your WiFi/ISP connection, may take a while. And all of those downloads turn up on the carousel so then you will waste time deleting them from the carousel. This is a minor annoyance and one for which there is no good solution, so file it under "need to know/plan for".I sideloaded Firefox 14 but it simply crashes.  I have been able to install Dolphin and Opera but not Maxthon.  Why another browser?  Because Silk not only has its old flaws (like the lack of folders) but has a somewhat different interface.  And those bookmarks and history you've got?  Forget them.  There is no way to transfer either to a new Fire or to keep two Fires in sync.  Silk has also hung badly several times on the HD, something that rarely happened on the original.Amazon has created 3 sections for its Web access: Starter, Bookmarks and History.  You cannot set it so that, for example, Bookmarks or History is the first section.  Starter is the new screen that always pops up first if you're not going direct to a web page from the carousel.  And what does Starter consist of? 3 "shelves":  Most Visited, Trending Now, Selected Sites.  Because the icons on the shelves are HUGE, you can see only 2 ½.  Yes, that's right, in vertical mode you get to see 2 1/2 items (5 ½ in landscape mode).  There appears to be no way to set, for example, Bookmarks as your entry point, nor does there appear to be any way to get rid of the Trending and Selected Sites under Starter. These extra shelves may not bother you.  You may find them useful.  For me, they are a waste of screen real estate.  (And another example of Amazon's well-publicized policy of using the hardware to entice buying.)NOTE: I really, really, really do not like icons, especially very large icons,  I would much rather see just text whether I'm looking for a web site or a book or an application.  Just a simple text list that I can order the way I want. Nothing is worse than the way Amazon displays, in all versions of the Fire, videos which is, as far as I can tell, purely random.  It, quite frankly, hurts my eyes so much to keep scrolling dozens upon dozens of unorganized title icons that I usually give up after a couple of screens.  If you are looking for something specific, the search box works fine.  If you are just browsing, it's a pain.The New Yorker UPDATE Nov. 25: This was the most unpleasant surprise.  It works fine on my original Fire, contrary to the experience, I know, of many.  But I could not access it on the HD.  I suspected the problem was with the HD's autocorrect. Somebody should tell Amazon that userids and passwords often do not resemble real words.  My id and password for The New Yorker certainly do not, but Amazon's spellchecker kept "correcting" my entry and I wasn't even able to delete the incorrect characters.  I had to close the Sign In box and start over.  I finally got the spellchecker trained to accept my user name, but I suspect the reason that the app couldn't authorize me is that the spellchecker was somehow changing my password which consists of letters and numbers.  Finally, I went into More/Settings/Keyboard and turned off Auto-correction, Auto-capitalization, and Next word prediction.  Voila!  I was able to sign into the app.(UPDATE NOV. 26: The first New Yorker edition I downloaded, Dec. 3, was 255MB. More than twice as large as the largest edition I downloaded on the original Fire. The download for the original Fire was 165MB. I'm assuming/hoping the large size is due to the inclusion of an opera video clip.)NEW & UPDATED Nov. 26: KeyboardIf you are having any kind of trouble typing, I recommend that you try the same thing. "Next word prediction" seems to be particularly perverse.  For example, I wanted to type "A link" in Plume (Twitter client) and could not type the "l".  Literally, could. not. type. the "l". I turned off "next word prediction" and the problem disappeared.I don't know what kind of dictionary Amazon uses, but even with the original Fire, I have found that the words it knows are occasionally more obscure than the words it doesn't know, and that it seems deficient with respect to internet and other acronyms.The keyboard on the 8.9 HD is, of course, larger.  But there have ALSO been changes in the format.  The <-X (backspace) key now reads "Delete".  If you press and hold down the ",kb icon" key, the keyboard will split in two, which may be useful in landscape mode.  Press and hold again and the full keyboard will appear.  There are a number of other differences which, for the most part, I like but it does make typing a bit confusing since I use both tables (original and HD).Conclusion: UPDATED Nov. 25, 2012.Will I keep the 8.9" HD?  Yes, but I am still extremely ambivalent about it.  (In contrast, I liked the original Fire from the first day; within a week, it had become part of my life.) I have asked myself what I would do if I returned the HD.  Would I try the 7" HD? Or, say, the Nexus 7". I have part of the answer to that: I would not look for another large tablet.  The larger size is definitely better for watching videos, but I don't watch enough videos to make it worth the price. If I did, the larger size in addition to the improved video and sound quality would probably count more for me.Bezos emphasized the importance he placed on pricing a full-sized tablet right: the best features for the right amount of money.  It is time that he paid attention to the App Store which continues to be in a very, very distant 3rd place to Apple and Google, the need for synchronization (on demand) of bookmarks and browser history for people with multiple Fires, and ways for users to personalize/change the way the UI works.Musings which may not interest you:In short, I recommended the original Fire without hesitation to anybody who had never before used a tablet.  I stand by that recommendation.  But we are now into Generation 2 Amazon.  Our standards should be higher because the price is.  Assuming the only difference between the 7" HD and 8.5" HD is the size, would I recommend the 7"?  Probably, if it is somebody's first tablet and that person is an Amazon customer.  But otherwise, well, the playing field is more level now.  I'm not an Apple fan, to say the least, and don't want to be part of its ecosphere. But I'm beginning to think that, at these higher prices, Amazon's ecosphere imposes too many limits on the user so the tradeoff between price and functionality is much more complex. Especially for a second tablet.My original Fire works fine.  It's only real problem is the lack of application space, but I can get around that by keeping only the most important apps on the 7 inch, and running the others (the ones that work) on the HD.Finally, I've decided to postpone until next year any decision about getting a second 7 inch.  But I will not automatically choose a Fire.  This time I will take a good hard look at the 32 GB Nexus 7 inch.Bottom Line:If you take one thing away from this review, it should probably be the fact that the 8.9 HD has not convinced me to get a 7 inch Fire HD should I want upgraded features in a smaller package.

Reviews.Title: Open it to more Android Apps
Reviews.Author: Douglas D Snyder
Reviews.Content: great for video and music, good for reading, disappointing for web browsing and email.Biggest problem is the unavailability of so many popular, useful Android apps.Silk is a big let down. It simple doesn't function with a couple of my frequently used web sites. I have to go back to the phone for those.Edit: After several more weeks, I can only say that I wish I had spent more for an Ipad. It really seems that Amazon is working very hard to frustrate its users. The unavailability of apps continues to be a frustration as does the poor performance of Silk. When I really need something, it's back to the phone because I know the Fire is unreliable.I'm also very disappointed with Prime. The biggest complaint here is that none of the video is available for download. If I can rent (pay) for content and download it for viewing away from wifi... why can't I do the same with content from Prime? I've already paid for it beforehand with the subscription.The problem really isn't the Kindle Fire as a device. The problem is Amazon and their desire to strangle their product in its infancy.

Reviews.Title: I thought I wanted this, but I did not
Reviews.Author: BPM
Reviews.Content: I bought this initially because the price was right and I wanted a portable media device/reader/movie watcher...at least I thought I did.  The more I played with it, the more kept trying to figure out how to make it do more work related stuff than media stuff.  The screen is indeed beautiful but I felt the UI was laggy, sometimes "froze" a bit before catching up, but seemed friendly to navigate.  Once I started trying to figure out how to root it I realized that I was trying to make this something it is not, so I returned it.If you want to watch movies and read books this is the way to go.  However, I though the app store was lacking in the tools I usually use for work, which made me feel cheated in some way.  And the apps that did work were glitchy (facebook didn't work, flight sim game kept flipping over when it wasn't supposed to).  This was more APP problems than device problems, but clouded my interpretation of the experience.  Again, you can 'sideload' and all that jazz, but thought I didn't need the hastle and most of the apps I sideloaded were interfaced yet through another app, etc etc.The tablet is really cool but just did not serve my needs.  Wish it came with free previews of magazines and newspapers, as well as books.

Reviews.Title: I have not even considered the next generation - very pleased with this one
Reviews.Author: Rob C
Reviews.Content: Great product.  Was worried about functionality and possible app deficit next to droid or Apple.  Have never regretted yet.  Love the Amazon product and the functionality.  Was not sure if at first I would like a pad versus BlackBerry and Laptops I already owned.  Sometimes have them all going at once!  Each doing something different.  Don't think I can go back to pre-pad and two device days.  The pad makes it very easy to access the net and various apps while staying mobile within my wireless range.  Chose to work in Wifi only, didn't buy another mobile service.  Rely on the BlackBerry for texting and mobile phone services.  Use the pad for e-mail, internet, mobile apps, etc while watching TV or sitting poolside.Have installed various browsers and apps much to my liking.  Use Silk (Amazon's browser), Dolphin, and file managers, print managers, Adobe viewer, etc- akin to having a flat and simple laptop without all the complexities of a die hard laptop.  I love the Fire!

Reviews.Title: Kindle good, iPad better, laptop eh!
Reviews.Author: C. Detloff "Typeone"
Reviews.Content: We own an iPad and the kindle fire hd, both are very good, but the iPad is much better than the kindle! We use one just as much as the other, yet the iPad has better and more features. To the person that said they didn't want to spend the money on an iPad for the same price as a laptop, because the laptop was more versital, that's so wrong the iPad has many features that are better, it has a 10 hour battery life(find a laptop with that good of battery life), they are more portable, light and easy to work with! Tablets are much better than a laptop! The Kindle Fire's battery does not compare to the iPad at all! Our laptop gets minimal use, because of the tablets!

Reviews.Title: Got it for the Whispersync
Reviews.Author: Chris C.
Reviews.Content: My son is deaf with an Advanced Bionic Cochlear Implant and we have been reading novels together with audible.com books,  following the written word to the audible words so that he can train himself to listen to English and remember the pronunciation of words.  The whispersync function that hi-lites the words of the e-book as it is being read enables him to read novels all on his own and build up the memories of the pronunciation of the words.  It works great!  He connects his Cochlear implants Bluetooth to the reader and has the audible book pipe right into his CI's processor.

Reviews.Title: Frozen games
Reviews.Author: patricia mcgee
Reviews.Content: The games seem to freeze when you play it for more than 30 minutes.  It's very frustrating when you pay to play and then the game freezes.  Too bad you can't get a refund on those games b/c that's money down the drain.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD Review
Reviews.Author: Judy Miller
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 tablet, the size is great for emails and games.  The size of the keyboard is actually advisable and useable with or without using cheater glasses.  The graphics are great and there seems to be an endless supply of free games.

Reviews.Title: kindle vs iPad
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: If you are deciding between a kindle fire and an iPad, I would choose the kindle every time. Having to deal with both support techs the kindle crew is hands down the BEST.

Reviews.Title: Wanted to try the bigger Kindle to see if it was any better than the smaller size. Was happy with both.
Reviews.Author: Pamela Gauvin "family girl"
Reviews.Content: Wanted to try the bigger Kindle to see if it was any better than the smaller size. Was happy with both. Would buy again if I needed one.

Reviews.Title: good kindle
Reviews.Author: Doris F Eash
Reviews.Content: I enjoy  the Kindle Fire 8.9, it is the most amazing thing I ever had.I take to work and read my books. thank you

Reviews.Title: You claim for this to take pics and it doesn't . That's not really nice . It's called false advertisement . That was one of the
Reviews.Author: Tricia Jumper
Reviews.Content: Why sale false advertisement . I paid for a high quality  kindle and what did I get a great kindle. However you claim it takes pics and it doesn't . That was the biggest of all dissapointments . The most thing I loved about the kindle fire was that I could have tons of pics of my family and granddaughter . You should of followed up on all your adds you displayed .Sincerely ,Dissapointed Customer

Reviews.Title: Great tablet at very affordable price.
Reviews.Author: Q. Dong
Reviews.Content: The certified refurbished Fire HD 8.9 tablet is virtually new. No sign of wear at all. The high defination screen makes reading really a joy. Very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Lousy Browser
Reviews.Author: William Wild
Reviews.Content: If not for the Silk Browser,  Five Stars.  Constantly hanging up, crashing.  Bummer.  Everything else about the Kindle is great.  'Cept the @&!!#$ Browser.

Reviews.Title: Amazon service A+
Reviews.Author: Beverly Grenz
Reviews.Content: This was a replacement for the same model that I purchased a year ago that failed. So far so good! I do love the kindle when it is working properly. Amazon lived up to their reputation by a prompt replacement

Reviews.Title: SHould Have Invested in A Samsung Galaxy or an Ipad.
Reviews.Author: Kenroy Green
Reviews.Content: Freezes too often...battery doesn't last long and its so slow, this is also a replacement I had so many problems with the original and the replacement is no better. I must say my very first Kindle Fire was great, I gave it to my sister and upgraded to the Fire HD 8.9 and its just a mess been having problems after 2 months of usage.

Reviews.Title: Would not recommend to a friend
Reviews.Author: Edward Barrett
Reviews.Content: HD is excellent but browser is quite slow and often stops working in the middle of something.  I would probably go to a IPad or Samsung tablet next time.

Reviews.Title: Getting to Know the Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Edward Wilkinson
Reviews.Content: I am still learning how to use it. I can share with you that it has a very short battery life by comparison to other tablets. I have to charge if every 10 to 12 hours. I find that not the case with iPad. Could there be something that I could be doing to reduce the battery drain when not in use.Get back with me in another 60 days

Reviews.Title: Refurbished Kindle Fire is Great, just like new.
Reviews.Author: Anne Belot
Reviews.Content: I like the larger size, and so far it's great, I haven't really checked everything out yet. Easy to hold on your lap and read horizontally.Not as expensive as an Ipad.

Reviews.Title: A lot of room for improvement.
Reviews.Author: John Wilson
Reviews.Content: No SD card slot. Small screen.  No forward-facing camera.  A sharp edge all the way around which can make it uncomfortable to hold when reading.  The  carousel interface is a pain and there is apparently no way to change it.  The Avia Media Player app will interface with Google's Chromecast, but won't play Amazon Prime videos, so if there is a way to send Prime videos to Chromecast, I haven't found it yet.  There is an HDMI jack so it is possible to play the Prime videos on your big screen tv set, but that is much less convenient than Chromecast. Cannot interface with home network via wireless.  Must be plugged into another computer using USB port.On the plus side: Video resolution and sound quality are great. The touch screen is sensitive and accurate.Considering all the drawbacks and the fact that it has a lock screen that screams "Spend money" every time you turn the thing on, it is way overpriced.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working right after my mother opened it for Christmas
Reviews.Author: adrakephoto
Reviews.Content: The Kindle started powering off for no reason, wouldn't update.... amazon was nice enough to take it back and send her a brand new one though so I am grateful.

Reviews.Title: Perfect size for me
Reviews.Author: Jerry Helsing "jlhelsing"
Reviews.Content: My wife has an iPad and loves it but I always found it to be a little bigger than I wanted while the 7" Fire was a little small for me.  When Amazon had a deal for this, I jumped at it and am glad I did.  I can watch shows and movies on it without having to squint and I can read my kindle books on it without having to wear my glasses.  My kids like it because it is a great system for them to play games on.  Even my wife likes its size better than her ipad although I would have to pry the ipad out of her dead hands to get her to make the switch.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Michelle Graber
Reviews.Content: I was really excited for my new Kindle. Unfortunately, I'm not impressed. It's slow and apps crash consistently. The battery drains extremely fast even when video isn't being used.

Reviews.Title: The Kindle Fire is a great little tablet.
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: You can pretty much do anything with the Kindle that you can do with a computer. You can even put in a password so no one else can use it.  You can hook up to libraries, music, games, and there are lots of sites for downloading free books. Amazon Prime lets you read one new book a month.  My only complaint is the way the charge port is made.  According to the Geek squad at Best Buy, the charge port isn't braced like those in a tablet or laptop so it cannot move, and the contact points are easily broken just by plugging it into the charger.  They said the charge port is the main reason people bring them kindles, and it's not something they can fix..  I would advise getting an extended warranty if you buy one.  If yours is one with an easily broken charge port, and you have an extended warranty, Amazon will replace it.  Right now I'm on my 3rd Kindle Fire, because of that charge port.  And if the charger goes out, you can't get any personal information, like credit card numbers and passwords, etc,. off the Kindle before it is sent off to somewhere to be repaired and sold again.  If the maker put something around that charge port so it couldn't wiggle and break, I would have no complaint at all but they would probably charge more for it then.  Also, the last charge cord sent with my Kindle is impossible to get in the Kindle without maybe breaking that fragile charge port inside the Kindle, so I don't use it.  I use my old one instead.

Reviews.Title: Silk issues
Reviews.Author: R. Ng "Happy camper"
Reviews.Content: I truly hope the developers for Kindle is reading this. I've owned the Fire Kindle for about a year now, and have a few things to say about it. The following are glitches which I believe can be fixed by a software update:- The silk has been unstable. After surfing the net a little checking out stocks, and reading business news; together with 3 or 4 tabs opened, it freedzes up. If you wait for it to unfreeze, it'll eventually give you the option to 'wait' or 'exit' (i.e. crash out of Silk). This is often frustrating since it happens during breakfast and I'm press for time.- Next, it is just lame Silk cannot play YouTube videos. I'll leave it at that.

Reviews.Title: Im glad i jumped.
Reviews.Author: D M Davis
Reviews.Content: Checking my emails and noticed the opportunity to purchase a refurbished kindle fire 8.9 For fraction of the cost. I had been doing my research and chosen this.model. it was either this or a smartphone. Smartphone was going to continually cost me whereas this was a one time purchase and give me more. No brainer. So far it has been working great. Will continue to critique it's performance.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: don howard
Reviews.Content: Got this for my wife and she loves. Nice upgrade from her original Kindle Fire. Just like new right out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Works very well.
Reviews.Author: Scott Antonio "Scott Antonio"
Reviews.Content: I would recommend buying a reconditioned Kindle since i have had it a few months and its seems to be perfect, just like brand new.

Reviews.Title: Great gift!
Reviews.Author: Andrea
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mom to use during her dialysis treatments because she gets so bored.  Now she is able to keep up with her Facebook friends, play games, or read without carrying around a bulky laptop or books.  She loves it!  I wish I had ordered another one for myself.  It was a steal when I got it.  You can't get any kind of tablet that size for the price!

Reviews.Title: Love My Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Ruby A. Jenkins
Reviews.Content: I love it, I just hope it doesn't shut down on me like the first kindle.I am unhappy with the glare even after I bought a non-glare screen saver.

Reviews.Title: Browser Crashes All The Time
Reviews.Author: IICAPN
Reviews.Content: Ended up returning twice. Bummer. I like the Free Time thing for kids and the overall look and feel is very good. The layout of the apps is not very good. Transferring between apps sucks. The Silk Browser sucks. I don't understand how CNET and others give such good reviews. I gave it 2 tries.

Reviews.Title: bigger size
Reviews.Author: P.S.
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a 7" to a 8.9". I'm still undecided whether it works right or not. Other than the bigger screen (which I love) Sometimes I have to keep touching it and nothing changes or works, then I shut it down and restart it. Even when it does work, you seem to have to push harder and over and over a few times.

Reviews.Title: Defective software and charging takes all day
Reviews.Author: Dave Klug
Reviews.Content: Consider a tablet that does everything great prior to considering a kindle.This Kindle has great hardware for the price. However the software will limit you. The Kindle operating system is very limiting. This software, by design, limits you to an Amazon eco-system of shopping Amazon or e-reading.There are plenty of tablets that are great all-in-one tools. So if you want a powerful tablet, avoid Kindle products. I personally like my device to be highly usable, and Kindle was designers to limit it's user.I just received my Kiddle and it's already bugged. There is no way to turn off the device when you charge it. It takes all day to charge and since the screen is bright, its annoying to have it charging at night.There are either tons of bad design choices, or lots of software flaws, either way, the device poorly delivers a meaningful use.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Angeldove
Reviews.Content: I upgraded when my 7" Kindle locked up on me. Glad I did as the larger size is much better for my 'old' eyes!

Reviews.Title: Sorry I bought it.
Reviews.Author: Alan Cogliano
Reviews.Content: Things were fine until after only a year and a half. Now the battery will not charge. That's not a long time for an investment of nearly 400 dollars.I know, I know there is an extended warranty you can also purchase. seems Like amazon is aware of the battery issues as they have a topic in their help section related to batteries and problems with them.Maybe an I-pad or another tablet is the answer.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: LAURINDA G SHOPE
Reviews.Content: I love it. I can read without turning on a light to disturb my husband.This is my first Kindle so I am very impressed.

Reviews.Title: Horrible product
Reviews.Author: MaryAnn Kapacs
Reviews.Content: I wanted to give it no stars.  Constant freezing. Must be rebooted.  Customer service has you reboot...like you didn't try that first.  No battery life. Plugged in most of the time.  Dirtiest purchase I ever made...sorriest ...Danny spell check comes up with stupidest substitutions.  Do not buy this.

Reviews.Title: Happy Birthday To ME !!!
Reviews.Author: Judy T Smith
Reviews.Content: I have been watching the price of a kindle and size and decided to buy myself a early birthday gift.  For a first time user I am so impressed with the ease of use.  Great price for the 8.9. I have put my old laptop away and carry my kindle instead adding the case was real plus!

Reviews.Title: great device
Reviews.Author: Brian Bausch
Reviews.Content: all of the applications that are available for this device along with the battery life and thin body construction is amazing and very well please

Reviews.Title: just like brand new
Reviews.Author: sharlene
Reviews.Content: I love my refurbished kindle.  It's just like if I purchased a brand new one.  Only thing is that it doesn't come with a charger.  If I didn't already have one I would have had to order a new one

Reviews.Title: Would love my Kindle if it would only hold a charge.
Reviews.Author: Paperbackwriter
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad you asked for my feedback, but I'm not sure you will be. Unfortunately I am terribly disappointed in Amazon. First time EVER! I love Amazon normally. When I received my Kindle for Christmas I was thrilled but almost immediately discovered it would not hold a charge. In about an hour and a half it would be totally depleted of energy. The Amazon employee I spoke to on the phone was great. He told me to send it back and they would immediately send out a new one. (And he offered to email me a shipping label. I explained that my printer was broken, so he said to pay the shipping myself, and Amazon would quickly reimburse me.) Sounded like a plan. I took my defective Kindle to Fed Ex. had them professionally pad and pack it for me, and shipped it to reach it's destination within four days. That was on February 25th. This is March 31. I still have not heard back from Amazon. The four day shipping, with packaging and insurance cost me $75.04.(I was shocked myself, but fortunately I have the receipt.) The final blow is that my new Kindle does not stay charged any better than the first one. BUMMER! Hate to complain, but you asked- so I have to be honest.Now, I would give the features, and the Kindle's ease of use, 5 stars. (Also love the leather case that allows it to stand on it's own, and having Prime.) Even the customer service dept. that answers questions regarding setup, wi-fi, etc. is excellent. So I have to say, I would absolutely love my Kindle, if I had one that would hold a charge. And I would totally love Amazon (again) if they would contact, and reimburse me.

Reviews.Title: I just love my new Kindle
Reviews.Author: Tara Autin
Reviews.Content: It is even better than I thought it was going to be, it does so much more than I thought it would. Wish I had gotten one a long time ago! The seller turned out to be a great EBAYER! AAA++++

Reviews.Title: Returned Immediately
Reviews.Author: R. Mabry
Reviews.Content: Didn't like the operating system at all. Could not download most of my favorite games that I have on my original Kindle Fire. Froze up a lot too. The screen size a great though and it is very light.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Screen, Woefully under-powered
Reviews.Author: casey
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this review brief.The screen is wonderful, its beautiful, bright, and has a dense pixel-per-inch ratio.The kindle/android operating system is pleasing to look at and use.WiFi and bluetooth both work quite well.There isn't nearly enough memory (ram) for a tablet with this screen resolution. With less than 1gb of ram available total, there often is less than ~200 mb of memory for apps like silk (the web browser) to use. This makes browsing websites with graphics very painful, and in my case, it often freezes the tablet where I'll have to do a hard reboot (holding the power button down until the tablet turns off).Games that fully utilize the resolution of the tablet will also often play at unpleasing speeds. That being said, games like angry birds, cut the rope, or candy crush will do just fine.Ultimately the tablet suffers because of how beautiful the screen is. If I were to purchase again, I'd suggest saving up an additional $100 and getting the HDX or even a windows-based tablet.

Reviews.Title: Amazon Needs to be a little more open. Lack of apps kills the experience.
Reviews.Author: Shawn D. Medeiros
Reviews.Content: Amazon playstore just isn't as good as Google Play. No Youtube, no Google maps. no Hangouts. Can't use Chromecast to cast tablet to TV. These are deal breakers for me. The lack of good apps is the reason I wouldn't buy or recommend one of these.  It is too bad because the Hardware is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire HD!
Reviews.Author: Nina
Reviews.Content: I got this last Christmas from my husband! It is fast, easy to operate, has so many apps, and a clear, high quality screen for videos or whatever! It is cheaper than iPad & just as good in my opinion!! Now my only problem is getting my husband to stay off of mine, so I will be buying him one asap!

Reviews.Title: five star review
Reviews.Author: gene niekamp
Reviews.Content: My wife loves it she can read her books and get on the internet she does the banking and she likes the size as well

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 8.9" - Worked well first few weeks, then browser lags/stalls
Reviews.Author: mohd rosle
Reviews.Content: I'm using it outside the US, fully aware of its limitation vis-a-vis accessing content in Amazon's ecosystemand had bought it mainly for Net surfing as it was best value @ US$229 deal.But lately, the Silk Browser has been acting up, not responding followed by prompts to quit.Don't think it's my ISP or modem issue. As a non-US resident with no local repair service, it a calculated risk purchase.Two thumbs-up for the first few weeks of usage, one thumb down now.

Reviews.Title: I love it.
Reviews.Author: Lucille Hummel
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle Fire HD - it is better than my IPad.  Easy to use.  Sorry I didn't get it sooner.

Reviews.Title: Nice graphics
Reviews.Author: S. Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Nice screen, really best for watching movies and reading books if you need a business type tablet this is not it great best for fun stuff but for business stick with apple, asus, or galaxy tab products

Reviews.Title: I love the size and read ability of this Kindle.
Reviews.Author: Allean Stewart
Reviews.Content: Only problem was a defective battery that would not hold a charge. Amazon replaced the kindle and were very responsive to my needs.

Reviews.Title: so far
Reviews.Author: Valder
Reviews.Content: this is my first refurbished kindle I received.  and I have 6 different kinds of Kindles now. it seems like it's brand new.  not a scratch bump or dent. anywhere.

Reviews.Title: NOT as good as new!
Reviews.Author: Gus Shella "CrossWalker"
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? Probably at the gross fingerprints all over the screen. Okay, no big deal. When I turn on this refurb, it's "flashy". Not something I experience with my other Kindles. Right out of the gate it is telling me that almost all the space is used up. Huh? All of it in apps which aren't even there. Something fishy here. There's a side app installed too. (An app from a source other than Amazon) I can't figure out what it is for except that it may be for testing. Many apps have names but no icon above them. Many apps I've deleted on previous Kindle now showing up on this one. Again....Huh? Still can't figure out why it says I have little storage left. It's going back. Fail.

Reviews.Title: Not great.
Reviews.Author: Agatina
Reviews.Content: It's hard to hold & hard for me to use.  I'm not fond of the buttons which are hard to find on the side & there are not little lights so you know if the battery is charged.I bought it to play games in color & the Phase 10 Game, for example, is nice & red but the cards & words are very small.  I still choose to play it in black & white on my Kindle Paperwhite (which I love).Also I wanted to use the camera & it's not coming clear to me what to do there either.Some of it is me, but some is the Kindle Fire I think.  Not as User Friendly as I'd hoped.

Reviews.Title: Love it !
Reviews.Author: Bonnies Day Care
Reviews.Content: I have wanted a tablet for some time now, but could not afford one that was dependable and one of the quality of the Kindle Fire HD. I have always been a little computer illiterate. Perhaps due to my age of 66years young, but although I am no WIZ , I am learning. I like the speed of the Kindle and the Definition is Crystal clear. MY wife has a 7" tablet but I wanted something a bit bigger. My last point is that Warranties it like a new tablet and you would aware that it is. The price was certainly right at $199.00.

Reviews.Title: seriously no power cable!!!!
Reviews.Author: hilliard
Reviews.Content: I bought this after selling an older IPAD and it has worked great except for the fact there is no power cable provided when your purchase it and it is not very customizable. Would be nice if you could choose what menu items you want to see, what you want on the main screen, and add a personal desktop and lock image.

Reviews.Title: Local Girl Goes Krazy Over Kindle Fire hd
Reviews.Author: dixie leavitt
Reviews.Content: love, love, love my Kindle Fire!  It just does everything & is so clear & bright.  I don't have a computor anymore, but with all the word processing & print apps, don't really need one.  PLUS, what it was really designed for (reading books) is awesome and the price of Kindle books is very reasonable.  Best investment since I bought my Kuering coffee maker!

Reviews.Title: Great Screen and Sound, but not the Best Tablet in the World
Reviews.Author: R H
Reviews.Content: Bought the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 to get access to my Amazon Instant Video library on the go.  Here are my impressions.Pros:~The screen is beautiful; easily one of the best looking HD Displays i've seen on a tablet so far.  Kicks the pants off the Galaxy Tab and Surface Screens.~Watching a video without headphones?  Or wanting to play some music in a room without having to lug the device around?  The sound system built into the thing is really high quality.~The integration with Amazon's Video, Music, and Book Library is seamless.  No need to run a bunch of separate apps.  It's all right there.Cons:~App selection is poor.  A lot of apps that I was attempting to use on the tablet were out of date compared to those found on the regular Android marketplace, which caused some issues during use.~Even when the apps work, this device is not exactly the best at multitasking.  I had several instances where Silk would crash Skype or Facebook, or the tablet would decide to close certain apps randomly.~Swapping between applications was not very easy off the bat.  Unless I was missing something, you had to go back to the home screen carousel, and then open an app that you already had launched from there.~You cannot... repeat... CANNOT disable Swype, and if you're a screen typer like I am, you'll often find yourself adding unnecessary spaces and screwing up the swype's autocorrect quite a bit.  User error maybe, but not even an option?Conclusion:It's a good tablet.  A MUST if you are tied at the hip to Amazon's content and services.  Want something that's a little more diverse?  That offers more apps?  Better app management?  Etc?  Look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: seriously no power cable!!!!
Reviews.Author: hilliard
Reviews.Content: I bought this after selling an older IPAD and it has worked great except for the fact there is no power cable provided when your purchase it and it is not very customizable. Would be nice if you could choose what menu items you want to see, what you want on the main screen, and add a personal desktop and lock image.

Reviews.Title: Local Girl Goes Krazy Over Kindle Fire hd
Reviews.Author: dixie leavitt
Reviews.Content: love, love, love my Kindle Fire!  It just does everything & is so clear & bright.  I don't have a computor anymore, but with all the word processing & print apps, don't really need one.  PLUS, what it was really designed for (reading books) is awesome and the price of Kindle books is very reasonable.  Best investment since I bought my Kuering coffee maker!

That offers more apps?  Better app management?  Etc?  Look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Review for my kindle fire8.9" 4GLTEWireless  64GB
Reviews.Author: patricia wilson
Reviews.Content: I have been really happy with the purchase of my  kindle fire  it's amazingly easy to navigate . I have  only one complaint  and that is the lengthy of battery life which is markedly shorter than  promised at time of purchase,that is a huge problem for me and why I gave device a rating of four stars not five.

Reviews.Title: For $129, well worth it
Reviews.Author: D. F. Marin
Reviews.Content: I needed bigger than my smartphone to watch Netflix, Hulu Plus, and Amazon Prime  while I ran on the treadmill.  For $129, a no-brainer.

Reviews.Title: love it so much
Reviews.Author: kanye rips
Reviews.Content: I like reading and watching movies, this is perfect for me. The most important thing is the price. Very reasonable!

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd 8.90" audio
Reviews.Author: Ted Thach
Reviews.Content: kinlde fir,e hd 8.9" Dolly Audio brand is very very good excilen ,work clear ,fast  I realy like this item.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle
Reviews.Author: Ms. Annette Arnold "nucie 50"
Reviews.Content: I love the HD Kindle. Everything is so much clear and the color screen is great. The sound is nice and clear and you don't need to add speakers to hear it. I have a 1st generation kindle 7 inch screen and glad I upgrade to the HD.

Reviews.Title: great buy!!!
Reviews.Author: Shawnee Chacon
Reviews.Content: Can not beat the price on this one. Picture is very clear and Dolby sound is great.Bought one for a gift but I will be getting myself one next.

Reviews.Title: Not my best purchase.
Reviews.Author: Thelma Selvey
Reviews.Content: The battery on this does not hold up like I thought it would.  otherwise it is OK.  I have done better before this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love my new Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Joanne
Reviews.Content: I am new to the Kindle Fire.  Computer and flip cell phone have been my world.  I am learning, but so far I love it.

Reviews.Title: i like it, special offers is rediculous and should be eliminated
Reviews.Author: douglas wyatt
Reviews.Content: opt out of special offers...this is a stupid thing that makes a good purchase into a bad purchase....every time i reset the device even after i PAID MONEY, i have to figure out how to get the dam screeen to normal...BAD AMAZONELIMINATE SPECIAL OFFERS AND ALLOW ME TO PUT MY OWN PICS ON MY LOCK SCREEN..AND I WANT MY 15$ back for the trouble you cause me..but i wont hold my breath

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Tiffany
Reviews.Content: If you like to read books, such as used to read 500 paged books in one day, Kindle is the way to go. I read on it all the time, and love watching amazon prime on it. I occasionally play games on it too. Also, I like buying items refurbished by amazon, they work just like they should and come in good to great to like new condition.

Reviews.Title: Something I always wanted.
Reviews.Author: Susan Glenz
Reviews.Content: It is working well as I learn how to use it.  It will be fun to discover all it will do.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Howard L. Dickens
Reviews.Content: so far I have only used it for reading, and really enjoy that I can have several books ready to read

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire HD with Dolby Audio, and Dual-Band WiFi
Reviews.Author: Sue
Reviews.Content: Hello!  I purchased my first Kindle Fire HD after trying out a friend's Kindle. I checked the local stores' prices, but I got a much better price by calling the Amazon Kindle-Sales Representative. He was able to get me a better Kindle model for less than the local stores' prices. He also found the magnetic RooCase cover which I wanted; you can turn on your Kindle just by flipping the cover open! He found me a basic-priced stylus, a protective film-cover for the screen, and he told me to try out my Kindle for 2 weeks before buying the separate Damage Warrenty. He gave me the Damage Co's. phone number, and I later did have them start the Damage Warrenty after I decided to keep my new Kindle. I had a good friend come over to help me connect my new WiFi device and get my new Kindle registered. Now, I thought I had purchased the same size Kindle as she had, but it turned out that I had gotten the larger 8.9 model. I had gotten the sizes mixed-up after handling store models without covers. My friend was impressed that I got my larger Kindle 8.9 model and all its items for just $50.00 more than her 7" Kindle HD alone had cost her at a local store. She was impressed.  I will add that having the Kindle Support phone number is great!  Any time I had a question, a quick phone call to a service rep solved the issue.  I am also glad to say that Amazon stands behind its own Manufacturer's Warrenty, too! We live in a rural area and when my Kindle 8.9 was having issues in January-February of 2013 receiving emails, one of the service supervisors reviewed my Kindle's history. She learned that I used my Kindle every day for several hours due to personal disability issues that make traveling difficult. So my Kindle was one of my main methods of entertainment and of emailing friends & family.  She saw the Kindle's email delivery problem reoccured over and over after several service reps had tried to restore that app on my Kindle. She said she felt my Kindle needed to be returnef to Amazon. However, she said not to worry at all as they were sending me a new Kindle to replace my original one as mine was still under full warranty for one more month. So, within two days, my new replacement Kindle arrived. A great service rep walked me through the steps of 'moving' all my items from my first Kindle into my second Kindle. We had put my RooCase cover onto the new Kindle at her suggestion so that I could tell the two Kindles apart as we had to have both devices sitting side by side to complete the transfers of my apps, past book & movie purchases, etc. Finally, we had the new Kindle registered and running well...my older Kindle was completely back to "factory settings". It had nothing of mine left on it at all, which is how she said a Kindle needs to be when it's returned. She actually thanked me for being so patient and following all her instructions! I felt She was the one who had done a wonderful job in walking an older lady through all those steps! My new Kindle works very well with no problems at all. So, I  would recommend getting your Kindle and any parts from the Amazon Store. They do stand behind their products! -- Sue

Reviews.Title: Terrible Wifi in this model
Reviews.Author: John Kiblin "(Laura)"
Reviews.Content: I, and many others if you google the problem, have a serious issue with the wifi. It constantly stops working even though the device has a strong signal. Amazon has been no help...they just keep giving me their scripted responses. I have had the unit replaced but still have the problem. Even had new internet installed. I have been a loyal Amazon customer and am upset that they just don't seem to care about this issue. I am close to going to the iPad.UPDATE. 3/9/14...I wrote this on the wrong model. This kindle model is fine. Please see me one star review of the 9" HDX.

Reviews.Title: what happened?
Reviews.Author: Thomas Weaver
Reviews.Content: this kindle always freezes up after about 5 to 10 minutes of use I have to shut it down rebooted my old Kindle was flawless

Reviews.Title: Get it!
Reviews.Author: Leticia Alcantar
Reviews.Content: exceeded my expectations. It's fun and very entertaining.  We share it and my daughter gets her UC Berkeley books on it and now only carries her Kindle around instead of all those heavy books!

Reviews.Title: Good graphics and speed
Reviews.Author: Timothy Kelnhofer
Reviews.Content: I love using it and use it daily for both reading and playing games.  It is programmed a little differently than my old Kindle Fire, so I still have a small learning curve, but I love the product.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Wifi in this model
Reviews.Author: John Kiblin "(Laura)"
Reviews.Content: I, and many others if you google the problem, have a serious issue with the wifi. It constantly stops working even though the device has a strong signal. Amazon has been no help...they just keep giving me their scripted responses. I have had the unit replaced but still have the problem. Even had new internet installed. I have been a loyal Amazon customer and am upset that they just don't seem to care about this issue. I am close to going to the iPad.UPDATE. 3/9/14...I wrote this on the wrong model. This kindle model is fine. Please see me one star review of the 9" HDX.

Reviews.Title: what happened?
Reviews.Author: Thomas Weaver
Reviews.Content: this kindle always freezes up after about 5 to 10 minutes of use I have to shut it down rebooted my old Kindle was flawless

Reviews.Title: Get it!
Reviews.Author: Leticia Alcantar
Reviews.Content: exceeded my expectations. It's fun and very entertaining.  We share it and my daughter gets her UC Berkeley books on it and now only carries her Kindle around instead of all those heavy books!

Reviews.Title: Good graphics and speed
Reviews.Author: Timothy Kelnhofer
Reviews.Content: I love using it and use it daily for both reading and playing games.  It is programmed a little differently than my old Kindle Fire, so I still have a small learning curve, but I love the product.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Travel Junkie
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD is fantastic. I had been using a DVD player whenever I traveled.  Often times the DVD player would lock up  or the disc would crack while packed in my carry-on.  Now, I can download my movies, games, etc., not worry about discs and not have the weight and excess stuff that I had with the DVD player. The video and audio qualities are very good, it is lightweight and compact.  I really enjoy it. To my lovely wife who got it for me:  THANK YOU!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Refurbished Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Simone Cook
Reviews.Content: Bought this refurbished unit to replace a Kindle Fire 7" unit that became unusable because the charging port was faulty....was loose in the housing and I assume that caused the wires inside to break off....very poor design.Have had the new unit for about a month and everything seems to work well.  The larger screen makes it easier to use.  The charging port on this one seems to be installed more securily and hopefully will not be a problem.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd 8.9
Reviews.Author: Debbie Macaluso
Reviews.Content: Nice tablet. Clear screen. However, it freezes up quite often and needs to be rebooted each time. This is quite annoying.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 8.9 inch
Reviews.Author: George
Reviews.Content: This product has meet my expectations.  It has all the functions needed, then some and we will probably never use everything available.  However, I do not get to use it often as my wife has hung her ownership sign " Hands of this is mine".  The quality of the monitor is great, The 8.9 inch size is great for folks in are age bracket (80's).  The price was OK, but a cover/stand accessory bundled in would have been great. I am not a technical person so can not speak concerning the technical aspects of the Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've not been impressed at all with the Kindle. My first Kindle lasted several months, everything was fine. I could play games, read all sorts of books and use the web browser. Then suddenly my Kindle started locking up and freezing or just restarting itself. After resetting it to factory default (and having to start over on everything that wasn't on the Cloud, which is quite a bit) It continued to lock up and freeze. Amazon customer service was great and quickly replaced the Kindle. The next Kindle that came was dirty and had obviously signs of pre-use. The battery would only last a couple hours and all apps and books would lock the Kindle up constantly. As long as I restarted the Kindle 4 to 5 times a day and cleared the cache on all apps and web browser several times a day it was somewhat useable.  Back to customer service, restore defaults, hard reset the Kindle, turn the screen brightness down, turn the volume down and the battery still only lasted a couple hours and I still wasn't able to read books on the device. Insert Kindle number 3... Again Kindle number 3 had some sort of grease marks on the back and finger prints on the screen when it came out of the box. The power button only worked half the time and something wasn't working properly with the WIFI..... Kindle number 4 locked up upon the initial setup and got stuck in reboot mode until the battery died. Now Kindle number 4 cannot do anything with Silk without it restarting the device. Some apps work, most do not and reading books is very laggy (it could take several seconds after you turn a book page for the device to catch up).Meanwhile customer service tells me they just don't understand, that these are fantastic devices and should be able to run anything I want to do with them. I just want to read a book or play Tetris without the device freezing and restarting on me. That shouldn't be too much?If I had known all this in advance I would have spent a little more and gone with a Samsung.

Reviews.Title: would not recommend
Reviews.Author: Rosemary Bryant
Reviews.Content: Purchased my first one in November Started having issues of freezing and getting very hot, so hot it could be felt through the cover.After contacting Amazon I returned for an exchange. I received my second kindle in December. By Janruary this kindle was having the same issues. I contacted Amazon and tried the solve the issues just like they did with the first one. No sucess, so I asked if I would get a full refund if I sent it back and was told yes. It didn't happen. Sodisappointed in the product and Amazon. I also ordered a car charger, an adaptor, and a cover, the only things that I got any refund for arethe kindle and adaptor, but not what was promised. It was not my fault that the kindles didn't perform at my expectations and I feel I should have been given a full refund. Especially after trying 2 of them within 2 months. Don't waste your money buying a kindle.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Richard Bayne
Reviews.Content: Would like to see the way to add captions to the movie. Kindle Fire HD 7" has it. Other features OK

Reviews.Title: thank you in advance
Reviews.Author: anastasia40
Reviews.Content: this item arrived on time it was well packaged it was easily open I will be able to reuse the packaging the item is as the seller described although I do not see the cosmetic imperfection I am pleased with that.there has been a slight delays with some of the operations of the tablet but I'm going to give it a few days to work it out

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Angelinamorel
Reviews.Content: I love the graphics and speed of this I have had a Nook previously and the color was great but I love not only being able to read books but to easily have access to the internet I wish I could get Pet Rescue Saga and Farm Hero Saga though

Reviews.Title: Kindle 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Bridy
Reviews.Content: I choose this rating Because I love my Kindle. I can see the screen. I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd
Reviews.Author: Theresa
Reviews.Content: I love it! What More can I say? If this one dies I will not hesitate to get another one.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: D
Reviews.Content: I got this as a gift for someone. When it arrived, sealed, it had already been registered to be. I didn't appreciate that. I had to de-register it and try to set it up for someone else. It was a nightmare trying to set it up for a child in a way that wouldn't require a debit card merely to get free books and applications.Otherwise it's great.

Reviews.Title: Really nice and light
Reviews.Author: Netty Potts
Reviews.Content: I will recommend this product to any student it is very light ,easy to use and convenient. The size is just right also.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for me!
Reviews.Author: Books2 Love
Reviews.Content: I love this Kindle. It is my second Kindle, but the other is just for reading. I am on this one all the time! I have apps for games, for meditation, for music, email, and on and on. I have had no problems, except for accidentally turning it off once in a while, when I don't mean to do so. The on/off button is on the side or the top, and there is no place they could put it that would avoid that however.I am very happy with it and would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: marnie horner
Reviews.Content: I have been admiring this online from Amazon for so long. When the price came down to $189.00 I had to buy it. So glad I did! My husband purchased an off brand 8 " tablet for me for $40.00 and I got attached to it. Well, you get what you pay for. It froze permanently after about 2 months or so. I loved the Kindle reading app. and having internet access on a tablet. So, I kept checking for a Kindle special and ordered it Valentines Day. Wow! My husband was the first to plug it in and see the amazing HD screen. Charged very quickly with the USB cord it comes with through my Moto X smartphone USB power adapter. Will be ordering the PWR+ wall charger (with extra long cord) and a Bear Motion Premium Folio case w/keyboard to have a mini computer wherever I need it. I haven't watched movies or listened to music because this is really my handy books/internet access. My husband did tell me it doesn't seem to be able to read a PDF file (downloading a TV users manual) but we have several other computers so that's not an issue. If you are a light computer user (bill pay, web browsing, books, music,etc) this is an awesome little tablet. I haven't even discovered all it will do but I look forward to having my Kindle for a long time :)

Reviews.Title: Poor customer service
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I had my new Kindle less than a week when I started having problems with it.  After several attempts through the Kindle help, it was decided to send me a new Kindle, to replace the problem one.  This took place on 2/20/14.  The repalcement Kindle was to arrive on 2/25/14.  Received an email that day saying delivery was pushed back to 3/5/14.  Called to ask why the delivery date was pushed back.  Told they were waiting for a shipment, that may be 4 to 6 weeks out.  No one offered to do any thing to correct the problem.  I asked if I coul upgrade to a 32g Kindle, that was in stock.  I could do that at todays price.
